description:
Great service and good food.  Had a Bacon Bloody Mary... bacon and booze...  yum.

Michelle the bartender was great, friendly and made sure we were in and out in time for our concert near by (at The Chapel).
author: Tom B.

description:
First off, I will say I love the Buffalo wings here! The wings are very big and meaty, and also have a delicious Buffalo sauce. They also have a good beer selection on tap. Those are essentially the two things I come here for.

I've also had their burger, chipotle chicken sandwich, and fish and chips. All of these are okay, but nothing special.

They have a couple TVs at either end of the bar. While they do show games here, it's not the best place to watch games if you're specifically going out to watch the game. They generally don't have the game audio on, unless it's a playoff game, and the screens aren't that big.

Service is generally fine, but it can feel a bit unattentive at times.
author: Eric U.

description:
I've read some of these negative reviews but I got to say I was just here to watch game 7 of the Cleveland v Boston series and the servers held it down! Mind you this was the day of the SF Carnival and this bar was packed. 

They were understaffed and somehow 2 girls ran this entire bar without missing a beat. I know they were stressed but you couldn't tell. Both the server and bartender kept positive vibes somehow. 

I just had to write them a good review because it's far too common for folks to only leave bad reviews. Its super hard to get good service under regular conditions let alone a packed, hyped bar with crazed sports fans.

Check #304197
author: Kevin T.

description: I have walked past this place no fewer than 50 times and I finally stopped in for a lunch. Best. Decision. Ever. The woman running the bar, Michelle, is one of the friendliest people I have met in the Mission and the service was excellent. I will be back for more bangers and mash and good company! Also the tuna melt was bomb.
author: Shanna B.

description:
I'll be honest, the service really bugged. 

I ordered the chipotle salad but there wasn't any cheese on it and the dressing wasn't chipotle but rather a watery balsamic vinaigrette. It was also hard to get a refill on drinks.

It was also quite a loud atmosphere with the music but I guess that's to be expected of a pub.

The order of fries as an appetizer are quite small, more like a portion for a lunch - at $5 I recommend skipping it.

Since the Mission has a lot of great restaurants, what is great about this place is you'll actually be able to get in without a long wait. So if you're just looking for a quick note to eat or drink then this would be a good place for you but don't expect the best service.
author: Monica G.

description:
I came here for drinks and the holiday specials were awesome! I ordered apple cider with Sailor Jerry's rum and my date ordered the mulled wine - both were really good and fairly strong, which I like in a drink. 

The bartenders were super friendly, and the menu looked great - I definitely want to check this place out in the future for dinner.
author: Chelsey B.

description: Expensive drinks sub par food and absolutely horrible service. Don't waste your money.
author: Riley J.

description:
https://brokeassstuart.com/blog/2018/03/05/entire-staff-phoenix-irish-bar-fired-right-st-paddys-day/

I'm sure the entirely new crew is fine, but the owner deserves to go out of business. I will never come here again as long as Eugene Power continues to own it.
author: Teicho S.

description: Overpriced for quality. So many better options in the neighborhood with delicious food and excellent service.
author: Ashley R.

description: Great for happy hour!  Awesome happy hour cocktails (amazing old fashioned) and the BEST buffalo wings on the planet!!!  Mac n' cheese didn't blow my mind so might be worth sampling the other apps.  As always, nice ambience.  Really nice waitstaff.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Came here to grab some drinks and grub and watch the afternoon football games. It's surprisingly big on the inside. A good setup. We first sat a a table in the back that was showing our game but it was too hot and the air felt stagnant. The waiter was super nice and accommodating and had no problem putting the game we were interested in on another tv at the bar.
I ordered some chicken wings and fries (and of course a few beers) and they were really good. I asked for the wings to be tossed in bbq sauce, which wasn't an option on the menu; they did it and it came out great.
They have a nice open, spacious setup. As mentioned before, it was way cooler at the bar (closer to the door). 
The staff was great! They have plenty of tv's if you're interested in catching the games and you can get your drinks and decent bar food in the same spot. Looking forward to my next visit!
author: Lyndon G.

description: Great place to stop in and grab a beer... or three.  Wide assortment of the hard stuff and beer.  Bartender was great.
author: Chad T.

description:
A short walk and my craving for processed meats is satisfied! The Reuben sandwich is great and the price is right! Served hot and well-cooked. The sweet potato fries and a mound of brown mustard set it off! My favorite time to go is right after the traditional lunch hour. A seat at the bar is easy to find. The bartenders are always very welcoming, even though I manage to resist the temptation for a shot of J.D. on the side! Stick to your budget, T.B.!!

My order is usually served up very quickly and the sandwich is consistently good every time!

The ambiance is very classic Irish bar. Clean, but with a wall decor that is approaching cluttered. A little thinning out is called for! I'm sure the evenings here are boisterous - maybe soon I'll stop in here before BART'ing home and see if another star could be added to the review.
author: Tony B.

description: Stopped in to wait for my boyfriend while visiting the city on vacation. Layla was super friendly and made me feel right at home! Overheard someone order a beyond burger and Layla said it was her favorite, so I ordered one to go for my vegan boyfriend. Once he got here, he also loved the cozy vibe and we decided to stay and order another burger (with sweet potato fries and added avocado to the burger) because it was so good and the price was great. Music was relaxing, food was bomb, bartender was one of my favorites. I will be going back the very next time I'm in SF!
author: Megan R.

description: The owner is a complete prick. Please don't support him by giving him your hard earned money! He fired his whole crew out of the blue, leaving people that worked there for 10+ years without jobs and lied about closing the bar, but stayed open and just hired a new crew.
author: Ella B.

description:
Best fried pickles! Love that they are spears and not chips. :)

I have always had a good experience every time I am here. They have a bunch of TVs so it's a good place to catch football/basketball games. There's always a good crowd but never had any issues with it being too crowded except on St Patty's (duh). Pretty good drink menu here as well. If you want good food/drinks and good service, go to the Phoenix!
author: Alex S.

description: Do not support this bar! The owner walked in and fired 7 employees for no reason and does this every couple of years when his personal finances are in trouble, he takes it out on his loyal workers. Those girls are the only reason I went to that bar. Also I never was a given a free drink. Once I spent $140 on fernet and my best friend wouldn't even comp any of it cause she wasn't allowed. EUGENE is a douche. Boycott the Phoenix!!!
author: hannah s.

description: Great place! Came with some friends while visiting SF. Fun and nice dive bar with great drinks. Wide selection. Would definitely come back when we visit next.
author: Kaitlyn N.

description: Walked in and stayed for about 30 minutes.  The waitress walked past us back and forth.  People came in after us and she literally did an search and serve.  We never got service or the food we came looking for.  Dont go here.  You can get irish fare at a much better place than this.  So long Phoenix.  May you rise above your current poor service.
author: Abby G.

description:
I love this place but parking is really crappy and when you do find parking, it's either super far away or it's a metered but it is $5.25 an hour!!! 

Today we went there for happy hour for our dear coworker who is leaving. We've been here many many many times before but the last time we've been here, we had another coworker tossing her cookies in the bathroom.....*hee*

Anyway, in the beginning around 2:30-4:00, it's not as loud and it's not as hot so the atmosphere is pretty good. But then when it's actually happy hour hours.... it gets louder as more people gets packed and packed. They have happy hour specials and deals.

The 4 of us ordered 3 Guinness, an Oatmeal Stout, Irish Nachos, Calamari, and Sliders... with 2 Jamesons w/Ginger Ale cost about $95 with tip. I think the portions are much bigger than happy hour prices, but it's way cheaper!! Their Nachos were packed with a lot of sour cream and beans. An order of sliders came in fours with some onions in it, it could be a little juicier, butfor me, it was a little dry. Last but not least, CALAMARI, it was good with a pile of lettuce and arugula underneath. Other than that, it's pretty good.

I don't like the bathrooms because it's always super cramped. I'm really tall (for a girl) and it was hard for me to maneuver in the stalls. 

It's a good hang out place for after work.
author: Eugenia W.

description: This spot was pretty cool! It was a very low key pub with a lot of regulators, the food was pretty good for bar/pub food. And it was the first time I've had Irish food so that was a cool experience. My favorite was the fries with curry.
author: MJ L.

description:
this place is fine, unless you're a woman in a wheelchair and you have to take a piss. then you realize there's no accessible bathroom and the staff has no idea what to tell you when you ask where you're supposed to pee. maybe next time staff can provide me with an empty glass and i can make a show of it by the bar? 

building doesn't seem old enough to be grandfathered into failing at legal ADA accessibility, so i'm quite curious about the justification for why disabled humans don't get the same experience as everyone else.
author: Heather R.

description: We're British & were craving some home comforts so we came to this local spot for some fish & chips and bangers & mash. Though they were a little heavy handed on the gravy & the "chips" were most definitely "fries", the food was pretty good. If you're looking for "pub grub" you could do a lot worse.
author: Fi M.

description: The Phoenix is a great dive that is guaranteed to be playing the Warriors game. The service is excellent, and their wings are pretty great. What else could you ask for?
author: Christina S.

description: Came here on a Sunday specifically for an irish coffee, which I will have to say was very well made. The Phoenix is your typical Irish bar, drinks are reasonably priced and it seems like a good spot to come to for sports games. I'll be back!
author: Angela K.

description:
09.24.16

Indian Summer was upon us in San Francisco. Cal had pulled off an upset against Texas the week prior. Can we do it again vs. ASU? I was at Phoenix to find out.

Fact: days cannot be bad when you order this Bloody Mary. Complete with two thick strips of bacon, you will get your protein and vegetables in one drink. (https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-phoenix-bar-and-irish-gathering-house-san-francisco?select=xu5d01vH4sjUBHcaq_IhcQ&userid=tGgTIueZy1JNTzQD9rkZLQ)

Fact: college football games are long. We were there for hours. There was a shot instigator in the group. Shots may or may not have been had.

Fact: their spinach and artichoke dip is on point. If you ask nicely, they'll even give you fresh salsa for your remaining heap of chips.

And no, Cal football did what it always does, and the game ended in disappointment.
author: Jenny L.

description: Great service! Very friendly! We had Jackie as a waitress, she was awesome! Food was great and fast! We came for happy hour which is from 4-7pm. We ordered the fried pickles, garlic fries, and spinach dip from the happy hour menu; all under $8. For sure a good place to try!!
author: Nicole H.

description: Homey Irish bar with good food. The Irish nachos are delicious, best Irish nachos I've ever had. We have a tradition of going to get the Irish nachos when it's raining. Something comforting & cozy about the Phoenix in the rain. Friendly service as well. One of the better Irish bars in SF and my favorite Irish bar in the Mission.
author: Marybeth S.

description: Ordered the full Irish breakfast that is supposed to have Irish bacon and Irish sausage. What I got was American bacon and Jimmy Dean sausage. They are charging $18 for a plate that looks like something you could get at Denny's for half the price.
author: Sam B.

description:
We came here towards the ending of Game 1 of the LA Dodgers vs. Chicago Cubs championship series. It was a packed crowd on a rainy Saturday night! Our server was great and really attentive to our group of 8 people. There was a minor mix-up when it came to paying for our table since the previous group moved from another table and we moved from another table as well. The other party accidentally paid for our bill instead of their own. Fortunately for them, we didn't want to give them the short end of the stick, so we asked if they really meant to pay for our bill. Like any stranger.. they did NOT mean to pay for our bill haha. Our server corrected their bill and gave us ours and that was that.

I'd definitely come here again to chill with a smaller group of friends.
author: Aimee I.

description:
This place came up on Yelp as my friend and I were looking for a place to watch the Warriors game (May 9th, 132-125 Go Warriors!). And sure enough, as promised, there are 9 TVs in the place, and they were all tuned to the game.

Though the place seemed pretty packed, we were eventually able to find some seats by sharing a table with another smaller group. Shoutout to Jackie our waitress who was super friendly and helped us find a seat!

The beer selection is pretty comprehensive (as expected for an Irish pub), though I'm not much of a drinker so I suppose I don't have high standards in this regard. There was a sign outside advertising their "famous Irish soda bread" so we had to try it out...and it was delicious! "But it's just bread..." you say. Yeah, I know, but believe me, it's really good! Dense but also soft and chewy and slightly sweet. Goes really well with butter.

Great place to hang out and watch the game with a fun crowd and great staff, while enjoying some beer and bread.
author: Brittany C.

description: This has been my go to spot for fried pickles, real American wings lathered in spicy buffalo sauce and a generous helping of blue cheese, and watching Ku basketball games. We were regulars here but last time we came the wings were so dry and hard to get down. Keep them juicy as we hope to come back for watching many games at once during march madness
author: Morgan S.

description:
I went here for lunch and it was way overpriced, even compared to the other fancy restaurants around the area... and this is an average looking bar!  

You would think they would want to attract more lunch customers.  Also, the service wasn't that great, below average since the waitress was also the bar tender, and she didn't really tend that much to people eating. 

The food tasted okay but the portions were so little. I paid almost double of what I would pay at other comparable places, and the portions were so paltry??  Give me a break. 

What a sham. 

Also, shame on them for not having ADA access in the restrooms, as it was noted by another recent review.
author: Christiani C.

description:
Tried the chicken sandwich and wings here. Both were very good for just pub food. I wish they had more options in sauces for the wings. It is loud inside. I mean yes it is a sports bar... but seriously you can only get away speaking by yelling or sitting very close to each other. Do not expect to communicate with a big group without yelling :) 
Service was awesome.. don't remember the name of our server.. but he was on top of everything. Loved it. They have a bunch of tvs so views from
Most tables is easy if you go for a game.
I will definitely go here again!
author: Shital R.

description:
I often forget about this place as a restaurant, but it's actually pretty good. 

It's also often loud, and the front tables fill up faster than the rear (so make sure to swing through the whole place before deciding it's packed). Table service can be slow if they're busy, especially because they don't always know you're here for food only (lots of beer-only drinkers will seat themselves at the tables), but they're friendly about it if you wave someone down or ask for help.

On my last visit, we had a lamb stew and pot roast. The pot roast definitely won in terms of being visually appealing, tasty and big portions, but the lamb stew was good, too (just a little soupier than I was expecting). I wish either dish came with the Irish soda bread advertised on the wall outside (my favorite kind of bread), but I didn't see it anywhere on the menu and forgot to ask. Maybe it's only available by request.

You want Irish pub food? It's been almost two decades since I was in Ireland to compare, but this place is good in its own right.
author: Krista L.

description: There is nothing Irish about this place except the soda bread. That bread is good but I would not go back here and eat.  It's an OK Mission dive bar. For a more authentic Irish vibe and better food I would head to The Liberties.
author: Linda S.

description:
Received what we expected from this place.  It's not trying to be something that it's not, which is appreciated. 

Cold beer on tap, friendly staff.  A bit "divey" which is to be expected.  Wouldn't come here for food, but if you're looking for a comfortable neighborhood dive that offers cold beer at reasonable prices, this place has your back.
author: Rachael S.

description: Stopped by as we were walking around the area.  Very busy place, but service was friendly and fast.  Just had drinks, but this looked like good food being served too.
author: Lisa E.

description:
Came by for dinner last night with a friend to watch the end of the Eagles/Falcons game then the first half of the Niners game; great mix of locals-only bar, great bar food, and dive bar prices for happy hour.

Atmosphere was on point; a couple of TVs, but not so many TVs that it's a full-on sports bar...a couple of bartenders, both of whom made and served beer and rail drinks as fast as any place I have ever been...locals yelling about how terrible the Niners were playing (at least, in the first half) mixed with people like me who just wanted a place to finish a pint.

Tried the half orders of the fish and chips, chicken tenders, and sliders plus a side order of fries...the tenders were a bust but the rest of it was bar food, slightly elevated and crazy greasy good.  And the HH prices are solid here--$4-$6 per plate, so after we got a bunch of food (doubled up on the fish) and a few drinks, our bill was around $60, so I think we did pretty well given our location and the amount of time we were in there, about three hours.

A nice find if you are visiting town!
author: Justin B.

description:
The Phoenix was the second stop on a birthday bar crawl so it was here that we decided to eat. It was incredibly crowded -- around 7 PM on a Friday night -- so it was a miracle that six of us were able to squeeze around a table and get service!

We had a traditional round of Guinness, Smithwicks and Boddingtons and then ordered fish and chips, lamb stew, chicken enchiladas, and Irish BLT. I shit you not, everything was delicious! And we weren't drunk yet, so I know this is true. Definitely the place to go for a drink and a hearty meal.
author: Angelique L.

description: No, just no. We were bored and walking around Valencia and decided to stop on. I should have trusted my gut instinct. We ordered the Patty melt and tuna melt. Blah. My burger was way overcooked, and the tuna was bland and needed more salt and mayonnaise.
author: Ha D.

description:
My neighborhood bar. Stood here and watched the Giants win in 2014. Bar erupted in cheers and then spilled out onto noisy Valencia Street crowd. 

Plenty packed and loud on game days, which makes it hard to get a drink or food. But you came here knowing that, and you came anyway.
author: Mandy H.

description:
Is the Phoenix Bar an "Irish Gathering House?" It most certainly is.

Went here on St. Paddy's Day for lunch and there were throngs of people watching footie on the tube. If you think Americans are loud when it comes to "football," you haven't seen anything yet. They really got into it! 

Food here's solid too. Service was kind of slow (they forgot one of our orders) and prices are pricy, but the ambiance can't be beat.
author: Casey S.

description: Busy street hard find parking, better to ride share. Didn't eat too crowded. They will only serve you food if you have a table. A few draft selections for beer. $7 drafts. Bartenders were fast. Good amount of tv's to watch the game
author: Jessica L.

description:
After a night of swing dance lessons, we traveled over to the Phoenix Bar to grab a late-ish Monday night bite. This was also during Cinco de Mayo so the Irish pubs weren't the crowded locations. 

Jacqueline was our server and she was phenomenal. If every waitress I ever had was as excellent as she was, I'd want to eat out every night. We sat in the back part, which was dark, and more quiet.  I had the Shephard's Pie, which was pretty good and my fiancé had something else, that he liked, and I don't recall. The food came out quick and the food came out hot.

The bar isn't the cleanest, but it's not that bad. But again, Jacqueline's amazing customer service and the decent food made this location a surefire place for a repeat Irish pub food craving.
author: Jennifer A.

description: One of the best places in the city to watch live games (basketball, baseball, football, etc.).  Great location, great food and drinks and most importantly excellent customer service!
author: Reggie B.

description: Drinks were good, but the food was just okay nothing to get excited about. I had the Irish nachos and forgot to ask for chips instead of potatoes so when the nachos came out in realized it was on potatoes vs chips. So no problem I ask for a side of chips, literally a handful was $3.
author: Koby G.

description:
This is a hidden brunch gem!

There was an hour and a half wait at Radish around the corner so we decided to check out this pub. And, in a stunning turn of events, they have an awesome brunch menu that is served until 4. Clearly this isn't well known because there were only about 4 other people here. 

Service was prompt and friendly, with expedient coffee refills. 

Boyfriend had the Full Irish Breakfast. He, an Irish pudding connoisseur, found the whole spread to be to his liking, and really quite a deal at $16, considering the huge plate of food. 

I had the Bacon Boxty, a neat spin on eggs Benedict. It was tasty and filling and well seasoned. 

I almost didn't want to post such a raving review of their brunch because I hope to keep this secretly tasty and relatively inexpensive option to myself!
author: Lori S.

description: Came for dinner with a couple friends on Sunday night. Food was good, service was good, no complaints. Definitely a nice spot to unwind and have a decent meal/drink. Laid back vibe and delicious "Irish" Potato nachos (most likely not authentic Irish cuisine but scrumptious nonetheless).
author: Natasha M.

description:
This place is a dump. Come here if you;
1.  Are A guy and like being around other guys. 
2. Recently out of college 
3. Like noise and not being able to hear the person you're with talk. 
4. Have a fondness of douchebaggery
author: Kyle K.

description:
Not a bad spot, but also not a particularly memorable bar as the draft selection and cocktails were both extremely standard.
 
It was fairly empty when we came in, bartender was nice, they have some great copper top tables if you're coming with a larger group, but again it just felt like, well, any other pub bar. I did appreciate finding a place where we could grab a table and talk without overpowering crowds and/or music though. Didn't have any food, so can't speak to that, and ended up having a good time mainly due to the libations - ultimately if you're in the neighborhood just bouncing around, worth it to stop in for a drink.
author: Andres B.

description:
I came here to watch the World Series Giants game and during any major sports game, you'll find this bar crowded with the team spirit. 

My friend saved seats at the bar, so we had excellent viewing. I couldn't imagine standing in that over crowded bar for 9 whole innings. I already knew we were going to sweep the Tigers, but it's fun to sit on the edge of your stool waiting for it. 

We had beers, more beers and an irish car bomb. Irish Bars and Irish Car Bombs go together sweetly. We even had Irish Nachos (potatoes instead of chips) and Jalapeno poppers for game watching snacks. 

The Phoenix is so lively, I left shortly and heard the people in the neighborhood commenting on the crowsd at the Phoenix. Filled to capacity and a whole lotta fun.
author: Rebekah T.

description: cold beer but probably rather eat at one of the much better restaurants in that area. cost me $32 for mac and cheese, was sloppy and wedges in the nachos were a little undercooked. $32...
author: Mat K.

description:
We love this place. They serve food until 11 on weeknights, which is hard to find on this street. They have great burgers and sliders, made with either beef or lamb. The weeknight bar tender is efficient and has this "all business" attitude that I appreciate. 

There is only one thing. Do not order the garlic hot wings. They are horrible. They smell horrible. Jus don't do it. So disappointing.
author: Jake S.

description: The mac and cheese is to die for. I got the half order, but wish I got.the whole.thing and took some home. The server was super friendly and really helpful. Fantastic beer selection too.
author: Christianna S.

description:
Irish Gathering House? Too bad I'm not Irish... no, scratch that: Italians are also welcome / tolerated as I gather at The Pheonix on the reg. 

On my first visit a few years back, I hazily remember chomping on Chicken Wings, beer in hand, as I unhelpfully watched on as one of my friends hauled the another friend out the door and into a cab; she had a tendency to fully fall asleep at bars and thusly required "help".

Coming back to Pheonix is always a fun time, from the time I nervously entertained a dude I was crushing on with stupid card games, to going back and parking our butts for an all day Bloody Mary, beer, and bar food fest.  

Very casual and chill, lots of tables, the Fish and Chips ($18) are bomb diggity, as is the Irish BLT ($12). You may think it's pricey for bar food, but I wouldn't consider it to be that. Good deals at Happy Hour if you make your way over there between 4 and 7PM, everything's a couple dollars off. Lots of TVs to watch sports and for some reason, by fluke of course, a very friendly crowd.
author: Crystal C.

description:
Chill bar in the middle of hipster-ville, definitely a great place with a chill atmosphere. One of the few bars within that vicinity that is not trying hard to be "unique" and "different", and yet is nice enough that it doesn't have the "trashy hipster" vibe that is so common on Mission street!

Definitely a cool place to sit down, have a couple of beers, and chill out with some friends.
author: Henry L.

description:
The corn beef Rueben is AMAZING!!!!!! I will try a Rueben anywhere as I'm a fanatic. This Rueben was juicy, the rye bread was perfectly toasted, and the  sauerkraut was not over powering. Usually I power through a sandwich, but this sandwich MADE me take my time. Side of shoes string sweet potatoes fries was good. Recommendation is to leave the ramekin of mayo off. 

Coming back for sure!!!!


If you're a Reuben lover come check it out. If your want some good beer come check it out. If you like good service come check it out.
author: Customer R.

description: Had a scary experience this evening. One patron smacked another and the person who got hit had to leave. Then the hitter then comes over and starts yelling at me. Then starts using racial epithets at me. The bartender appeared not willing to do much as they apparently were friends. Didn't feel safe here.
author: Paul B.

description: I had fun last night. I had the oatmeal stout and it was the best dark beer I've had. Never tried the food, but cheap tacos are too tempting.
author: Thomas J.

description: So rad I be back in the mission !!  This place was a friend's local favorite and I dig it ....  Great place for to watch a game and grab an anchor steam!!!
author: Jesse S.

description: Great local watering hole right in the heart of the mission,  great place to start or end the evening.
author: Nicholas P.

description:
After almost a year and a half hiatus from drinking in the Mission (after a somewhat dangerous night of blacking out and trekking back home to SoMa on foot), I wound up at Phoenix in celebration of my friend passing firefighter academy. And while places like Phoenix aren't my first choice (I prefer lounges over pubs and sports bars), they certainly serve up some cheap, tasty drinks here (albeit nothing as fancy as you'd find at, say, Rickhouse or Zero Zero).

And while the venue is fairly large, it's mostly long and narrow, which means that once 10 or 11pm rolls around, the place gets pretty packed, and pretty loud, which I suspect is even crazier on actual game days. Oh, and while I'm not normally one to comment on service, our waitress was SUPER bubbly and friendly.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - Given the above about the long and narrow setup of the venue, you're better off somewhere towards the front. Maneuvering towards the back does require a bit of back patting and pardoning. As for tables, you'll find a mix of normal height tables, as well as bar counter or counter table tops here. 

Bathroom - Didn't use, so no comment.
author: Johnny W.

description:
I love this bar. Came here two years ago for SPD and they were amazing. Came again this year (1 hours ago) and felt the same way until SHE started her shift.

I will find out her name soon enough and warn you about her, but until then, you should take time to read this.

So today is the primary day in the city to celebrate SPD. Dolores was packed, which means any bar within one mile should expect degenerates. Enter: me and my idiot friends. Definitely drunk, but based on multiple random accounts, coherent and friendly. At 5.30p comes one bartender who literally just started her shift and immediately comes to me and my buddy at the bar and responds to our request for two Irish coffees and a picture with her with and her cool glasses with:

Bartender: "I will kick you out of this bar if you keep up your attitude. I've had enough of you!"
Me: "Wait, what?"
Bartender: "No drinks for you!"
Me: [Curse words to myself, and maybe outloud] "Good talk"

We end up getting drinks from another bartender and we're ok for a while. We move to the side tables and hang out. But, I'll be honest, I'm annoyed. I used to be a bartender so I don't respect people who don't respect customer service.

After an hour or so, I go back to the bar. Again, to be honest, I go back to where the same bartender was working to figure out whey she was so mean. As she approached me, she starts saying "You think I'm going to serve you?!"

Her colleague, another bartender, is close by so I ask her for two drinks and if I'm being mean or loud or degenerate. She shakes her head as though this is par for the course. She serves us a few more and we enjoy the next hour or so.

Come 7p, we call an Uber to leave the bar. Again, I'm super annoyed. This bar was solid and fun with the exception of one bad apple. I'm curbside with a sight-line to the bar and I'm looking back inside to see if that same bartender will see me (pretty aggressive move by me, I will admit) and she sees me and starts yelling at me from behind the bar. So I walk back inside and, again according to my friends, pretty calmly ask her why she is so mad. Here is what transpires:

Her: "You have no idea what I've been through today. You don't know me! You don't know my struggles"
Me: "I don't care, you're a bartender. I've been one too. Your main job is to shake that $hit off!" Sure, maybe I could have been more polite, but given how aggressive she was, I was not in a place to be calm. I'll take blame for that.
Her: "I have no problem kicking you out of here!"
Me: "I've literally already paid our tab."

If the goal of this bar is to provide solid drinks and get you drunk, mission accomplished. If part of the goal is to make people want to come back, I'd say they failed miserably. She is terrible and I will find out her name and let you all know so you avoid her.
author: Preetesh B.

description:
I discovered the Holy Grail of buffalo chicken wings when I was yelping around for some good chicken wings.  Service could be better, but it's a bar so I don't expect that much.

Pro tips:
- Happy hour makes the wings cheaper but make sure you check your bill
- Do not order more than 12 wings at a time or they may come out cold (they must have a small deep fryer)

For the sake of comparisons, I'd say it's better than SmokeEaters in Cupertino and definitely better than Kezar Pub in SF.  But the difference is you don't get a variety of sauces.  There's only one sauce so if you either love it or not.
author: B F.

description:
I come here for 2 things: the ball games and the pork loin sandwiches.. and Boddington's on tap. OK, 3 things. 

Phoenix is one of the few decent sports bars in the Mission IMO. The other one would be Giordano Bros (review pending). There's a real shortage of them in my hipster-filled, taqueria-lovin neighborhood. 

But first, let me tell you about that pork loin sammy. OMG is it delicious. What I love about it is that they don't scrimp on the meat. They put 3 or 4 succulent slices of perfectly roasted pork loin in there and serve it with a side of aioli. I like to treat it like a french dip, only I'm dipping it in garlic-infused mayonnaise instead of au jus. They never give you enough aioli so be prepared to ask for a second serving. It's a massive sandwich, and for $10.50, totally worth it.

Happy hour is between 4pm to 7pm Monday to Friday. What makes Phoenix stand out among the rest of the hh spots is their garlic fries for $2. The fries aren't bad. For $2, you'd think they would just buy fries from McDonalds and serve it to you on a plate (although that wouldn't be such a bad thing coz I love me some Mickey D's fries). Nay. The fries taste like $6 fries and are also served with their house aioli (but just between you and me, I think it's just mayonnaise and garlic powder). 

As for beer, it's $1 off drafts. Pretty standard but they are one of the few places that have Boddington's Pub Ale on draft. If you haven't tried it, I like to describe it as buttermilk pancake in a glass. So buttery and creamy. Yummeh. 

The only gripe I have, and this is why they lose a few stars, is the service. Their servers are pretty standoffish and the bartender isn't that friendly either. Sure she looks good and that's why they hired her, but she has the snobbery of a Russian supermodel. Trust me honey, you ain't all that. It wouldn't hurt to smile sometimes. It's a minor gripe but I notice these things.

So Phoenix old friend, you get 3.4 stars from this yelper.
author: Angelo B.

description: Amazing Shepard's Pie. Essentially beef in Guinness gravy with a mash potato crust. Great on a chilly day (of which there are plenty of in the City).
author: Paul K.

description: Dive-y bar with decent fries and a decent beer selection. I thought they did a strong job keeping up with the large crowd during yesterday's terrible terrible loss of our Dear Warriors at the hands of the Griz. Sigh. But yeah, they kept the bar humming despite the large group of folks.
author: Misha T.

description:
Great dingy Irish bar in the mission - never eaten here, not sure if I want to, but the drinks are always stiff and the bartenders seem happy to refill the beers on a regular basis - what's not to like about that.

Always a cast of characters strolling by this place (or inside of it) - but that's what I like.
author: Joshua B.

description:
This is sort of an Irish Mission Dive Bar meets a Fusion Diner Sports bar. 

Phoenix is a couple of steps up from your classic Mission Dive Bar, there aren't enough hipsters and dingy decor for that, albeit there are plenty of skinny jeans and knit caps hiding bad hair. 

It is a fun and friendly place, with the bartenders down home, and our waitress in the back was superbly professional and really nice, which is remarkable considering she was serving a group of loosely confederated real and virtually friended individuals that morphed between 10 and 30 through the night, who were partly from the Bay, and partly from San Diego, thanks to Mariela. 

Besides the long bar on the left, there are a lot of tables to get your grub sit-down style on the right and in the rear. They serve what one might call Irish-Cali sports bar comfort food. So you can get some traditional favorites from the Isles, like Bangers and Mash, Shepherd's pie and the like, or you can go Cali Sports bar with Buffalo Wings, Burgers and Sliders. 

Then there are the unique "Fusion" dishes fit for a half Irish, half Cali person who goes to major sporting events wanting Nachos Irish style, with potatoes instead of chips. 

Good fun place to gather that is relaxed with decent food and libations.
author: Wanugee N.

description: NINE YEARS I have waited to come back to San Francisco and return to this restaurant!!! And it is STILL just as good as I remembered. The colcannon is just INCREDIBLE! I have never found any as good!! They also have amazing bloody mary's and shephard's pie. We also had really good Irish "nachos". I ate like a big pig! I hope its not another 9 years before I return to SF!!!
author: Sarah S.

description: Outstanding Full Irish breakfast, As good as anything I had in Boston.
author: Jason C.

description:
Never been. Glad I went! :)

Happy Hour menu items I selected!

Irish Potato Nachos -  Yummy in my tummy!
Jalapeno Poppers - Cheesy, crunchy and chipotle aioli was bomb!
Fish Taco - It was good.

Good crowd to watch a game or just hang out.
author: Carla F.

description: Great drinks, great ambiance, great people, ok prices! Have tried the food yet. But when with a friend to watch a Giants game and have some drinks, and we had a blast. Drinks were great.
author: Marie S.

description:
Came here a few weeks back the night the Giants made it into the World Series! That was the exciting part!
The place is cool for a dive bar. 
I didn't feel their happy hour was too great. I've had better for better prices.
The service was kinda crappy. We had to ask our server 4 times for a glass of water, finally the bar back took over our table and he was awesome!
Sliders are pretty small, but tasty.
author: Angela Z.

description:
This is a great place to watch a game while having a drink and maybe something to eat.

There are many many TVs, and the waitstaff is really accommodating about changing the channel so you can watch what you like.  Don't expect to be able to hear the game commentary (not an issue for me) because there's music....though  I'll bet they'd put captioning on if you wanted. 

The food is standard pub fare:  fish and chips, burgers, Shepard's pie and the like.

Atmosphere? Not a meat market.
author: El B.

description:
I am definately a fan of the Mission district, and I love coming to the Phoenix. They have the best grilled fish tacos for happy hour (which usually I prefer fried fish). I always come here for a few drinks when I go bar hopping in the mission or after work for hh. The place has a lot of TVs too for games. During a game though, you would have to go early or get lucky for seating.

The drink prices are average, but if you like that Irish Pub feel, but not grimey, this is the place to go. Sometimes the waitresses wont be AS friendly, that's why it's a 4 star, not 5. They aren't mean or anything, just not as attentive. Other than that, I love coming here for the chill vibe.
author: Jamie B.

description: Great food and service! I mean GREAT.  Music and atmosphere are also above satisfactory but loud at night. Can't comment on day as we had dinner here.  We really enjoyed our evening here.
author: Estefania S.

description: Regular spot for drinks. I love the new staff always very attentive. Shots can get a little pricey but it's worth the environment. It can get pretty crowded during the weekend but weekdays are very quiet unless there's a sports event going on. To top it off after a few drinks the spicy chicken wing won't disappoint you.
author: Suzy R.

description:
A typical Irish bar, allowing a group of four a free table on a Friday night. The premises felt quite naked and didn't offer any cozy Irish feeling. None of us actually found what we wanted on the menu, that seemed quite basic. 
I do not think I will go back, but I'm not usually going to Irish bars, so my review doesn't count for all that much.
author: Hildegunn N.

description:
I came here for the World Cup Final and I'm so glad I napped a table (though it didn't really matter as I had to resort to standing at the end. Too many tall people!) It was super fun and lively during the game and I'm sure it's like that for all major sporting games and possibly any given night!

What I liked the most was their Irish nachos. Potato wedges slathered with cheese, guacamole, olives, and sour cream. (Think nachos but without the nachos). Yummmm. Their artichoke dip was also pretty good!
author: Christina C.

description: Came in before a show at the Chapel.. Boddingtons on tap?.. yes, please.. shot of jameson on the side for happy hour?.. done!.. got hungry and ordered the Irish nachos of the happy hour menu.. they were just okay.. Gave a star back to the bartender (Paula?) for the great bar service..
author: Ron N.

description:
Came here yesterday to watch the Sharks vs Kings game. I was surprised there were so many TVs to watch the game! It was great. A lot of places to sit as well. 
The beer selection is awesome. I also got the mac n cheese and it was great! It was made with good cheese and was baked- it was still bubbling when it got to the table. Melty, cheesy goodness washed down with a smooth Anchor Steam. Yes, please.
author: Jenn A.

description: Decent food, good beers. I actually like this place. Would have been 4 stars except for the fact it IS NOT showing the RUGBY WORLD CUP (Unlike the Napper Tandy which will even remain open past 4am to show the USA teams World Cup match).  Loses major Irish Pub credibility for not supporting Rugby. Guess I'm going an extra 6 blocks down to the Napper Tandy instead (even though I live near the Phoenix).
author: Rubeun T.

description: Great bar and great staff. Everything you'd expect from an Irish staple. Food - eh, it's pretty good. Depends upon how much you've had to drink I suppose.
author: Bill S.

description:
My cousin and I went looking for a bar in the Mission and we found Phoenix.  We walked in and she ordered Stella from the tap.  All of their tap beers are easily 20 oz pours.  I think there's even a sign up that says just that.  I just had a sip of her beer since she wasn't planning on drinking it all.  We waited a while and watched some of the games that were playing on the multitude of flat screens.  

I perused the menu items.  They had a lot of food items that really sounded good like lamb stew, shepherd's pie, and burgers.  I saw some of them brought out to other patrons and thought that the portions were quite large so it might be worth your time and money.  The patrons looked really happy with their choices so it must be a worthwhile place to spend an afternoon eating and drinking at.  Someone even ordered a rather large, but tasty looking salad.  

Unfortunately, we had dinner plans elsewhere so we didn't partake in any food.  There were a few rowdy guests doing a Sunday-Funday bachelorette party complete with questionable costumes.  The bartenders were gracious, speedy, and really nice people.  What a cool place in such a chic neighborhood!
author: Trina D.

description: I love The Phoenix and stop here frequently. The beer selection and the sweet potato fries are awesome! The service can be a little slow, but the people who work here are all very nice and hilarious. It's also a good place to watch a game, with lots of TVs and extra space in the back - although, it gets crowded, so get in early to grab a table.
author: Kat W.

description:
I liked my experience at this bar last night since it wasn't super crowded, easy to find some seating, food is served until 1:00AM, and the drinks are decently priced. There isn't super loud music and the crowd seemed nice.

This is a nice spot to add to a night of bar hopping around Valencia/Mission.
author: Marlon T.

description:
I recently visited this bar as a weary Irish traveller. I order the chicken chipotle  sandwich and a green salad which was excellent and exactly the type of pub grub I was looking for. 

I did order a Guinness which was 7 Dollars, a bit more that I anticipated. The customer service was friendly. I'd recommend giving this place a try, plus they had the Liverpool Bolton game on the tele which was a big +!
author: Matthew P.

description:
I came here around midnight to grab some drinks with friends so I can't speak towards the food. It was okay, just another bar in my opinion.

Crowd Control: Lots of open tables in the back for our group of about 10 people. The bar is a little busy but it doesn't take more than 10 minutes to get your drink ordered and served. Not sure if we came in on a slow night or what.

Drinks: I'm sure this place is great if you order beers or shots. I ordered two Liquid Cocaines for my friends. The bar tender was really nice about it, but she didn't know how to make it. She looked it up but the drinks ended up tasting fruity which was unexpected. Still, no harm done - just not what we expected. I would say next time, don't order if they don't know how to make it. Bad call on my end.
author: Pam M.

description: A great neighborhood bar to grab a drink  in and just chill. Decent fries too! Nice vibe and very laid back. Shocked the bar a bit when I jukeboxed some Minaj into action but the bartender quickly turned the volume down and the inhibited locals ignored their way through the offending tune. Next time I'm getting a fancier drink.
author: Viv R.

description:
Food is good, pretty decent wings and hamburguers... I give them that but...  their service is the worst in the Mission!!!!

Been there a few times and always have to wait FOREEEEEVER for a waitress to come to my table. This last weekend I went again to grab a snack and there was a blond girl there that shocked me and my friends with her atitude. Just an awful, awful awful waitress! I dont think that girl ever worked as a waitress in her life , or if she did I have no idea how people still hire her...
She seemed so miserable, that I promissed myself I'm never going back there. 
Sorry Phoenix, your service suck.
author: Paula C.

description:
Wow!!!  Woke before last away Niners game and went for breakfast at the Phoenix  and not only did the 49ers win, but I felt like a winner too after and amazing breakfast!!!

It all started with the irish soda bread ... waitress was amazing trying to please everyone by adjusting the tv stations to accomadate everyone's football game of choice!

Large portions and food is well seasoned and make!  I had an amazing "Phoenix Scramble"  (irish bacon, sausage, mushroom, jack-cheddar & potatoes)

My boyfriend had the corn beef hash with eggs over easy... = sooo yummy!!!  I woke up this morning wishing I could take off work and go back for another fabulous breakfast!!!

Kitchen open til 1am !! OOOh Weeee!!
author: Jessica C.

description: Seriously great salads for a pub. I'm having the cobb, my friend is having the grilled chicken salad. Both are amazing!
author: Patty G.

description: Love the way they use space here, as there are plenty of bar stools, lots of tables with chairs, and a few booths to share with large groups. The drinks are priced decently (for Valencia St), and you can't argue with the selection to choose from. The food is pretty standard pub fare, though, so don't expect anything great. The bathroom will be a little gross when you get in, but hey, it's a bar.
author: Danny C.

description:
Now this is a pub I would come back to over and over again.  Not only are the 'tenders uber cute and attentive, but the food is amazing!  C_ and I walked in on a whim whence looking for supper, and we were not disappointed in the least.

Classic detailing in the old world fashion, the bar is very large and there's plenty of table and booth seating to accomodate many thirsty patrons.  We chose to eat at the bar, and the 'tenders were most gracious in attending to our needs.  C_ ordered the chicken pot pie, and I the lamb stew.  Both were exceptionally tasty dishes.  We also enjoyed watching the 'tenders do their thing behind the bar.  The simple fact that they make sure the glasses are hot before they serve the irish coffees is a plus, and the second girl attending us was amazing to watch as she continually shook out two margueritas at once.  Loved watching her!  She's now become my inspiration while I learn the art of cocktailing.

Hop on over and sample their menu, not just their drinks.  You won't be disappointed either.
author: Lorrayne L.

description:
Fun pub, open with a level of "trend" to it with the booths.
Outdoor seating, but too chilly in shorts and tee.
Boddington on tap!
Wings were generic, but good!
author: Stephen T.

description:
I have been here several times before without a problem, but yesterday was awful...
We were lucky enough to get a small table as aoon as we walked in.  Unfortunately, after waiting for quite awhile, I just went to the bar and got the drinks myself.  The table of people who sat down after us we're given menues and their order was taken.  The waiter started walking away and my husband asked if we could get menues.  He asked if I had a tab at the bar, I said no, and then he brought us menues.  We ordered a couple of appetizers and they were great.  We sat there for awhile (again), and the bartender brought us the bill.  We all looked at each other and were confused because we didn't ask for it and we wanted to order more.  A new waitress came to our table and I asked if we could order more drinks.  She said we could not because we didn't pay the tab yet, and they were going through shift change.  Confused  we gave her our card to pay and she walked away.  Some time later she came back and asked if we wanted to order, but by then  we decided not to because we just were not happy with how things were going.  She was like oh I thought you wanted something sorry... Again we had to wait ..... She never brought our card back...my husband had to ask for them to return it.   A few minutes later the bartender came back with our card.  We then left.  We really would have stayed to have dinner and more drinks, but instead left very confused as to why the service was so bad. Do any of these people know what they are doing?  Was anyone in charge yesterday?  Does the owner know there service sucked on the day of the St. Patrick's Parade.  Thank goodness it was raining because this crew would never have been able to handle a bigger crowd.. Get more help or help that knows how to do their job.  I left very disappointed... And too bad for them, spent my money at two other establishments that were. Happy to have us.
author: Denise G.

description: Love this place! Great food. Great bartenders. The Australian bartender is by far on a scale of Angelina Jolie to Jessica Simpson, shes a new bracket.
author: Sam L.

description:
Bartenders in this place are a joke. They don't know how to make simplest cocktails. To top that off, they are also extremely rude. NEVER again we go back to this nasty place. What a waste of a wonderful location. It's basically a trap laid out at a perfect spot. Well we learned it the hard way: waste of time, money and nerves!
STAY AWAY!!!!!
author: Eric S.

description:
Cheap as hell. Trying to find parking is a nightmare though per the usual for the streets of SF no matter the night. Phenomenal Shepard's Pie but be warned this is a very heavy dish. I've had it before at basically every Irish bar I've ever been to in L.A. but this was by far the heaviest version I've yet to encounter. I ate about half and had to pass it off to my guy friend who will eat all leftovers happily. All the apps are great too especially the fried everything platter with "Tayto chips and Skins". Friends raved about the chicken wings though I skipped them due to my weird thing about meat off the bone. 

Fun spot to meet a group of friends and get a little rowdy. We had our eye on the list of desserts we saw scrawled on a chalkboard in the kitchen entry way so using the leftover cash after everyone pitched in for the group bill we ordered two desserts and the total including tax was something ridiculous like $6! We expected dinky bite size portions to come out but we were floored to see the large size of each dessert, enough to share amongst the table of about 6 people.
author: Amber B.

description: casual irish pub...a drink before dinner...seated by long charming bar...small tables plenty and decent food available...a solo visit and stool at bar...browsing the liquor choices...beers on tap...choice of guinness $five...small wait for proper pour...perfect head...$dollar tip in appreciation...few screens for sports...a good place for gathering, drinking and eating...cheers to the friendly bartender and a final gulp of guinness...mission adios...
author: Hen A.

description:
The Phoenix is a great little Irish bar that's a perfect way to end your night. I came here with a group after enjoying Dr. Teeth's happy hour and we decided to go all out on shots. 

Service here is fantastic. The waitress was very kind despite how rowdy we might have gotten. She gave us drink suggestions and would come out with our shots within minutes. 

To be honest, I don't remember what was taken that night. All I recount is a variety of Irish liqueurs, as well as Fernet, the spicy aromatic alcohol of the Mission hipsters. Tasty at first, but comes with a horrible aftertaste. 

Atmosphere is very relaxing and down to earth. No one to impress, no one judging you, and an extensive selection of drinks. What more do you need?
author: Dmitriy S.

description:
You know it's a happy day in an Irish pub when the St. Patrick's Day decorations are going up. I stopped by for a quick beer with a friend, and we got sucked into the unassuming atmosphere (and the flowing beer) and stayed a lot longer than we expected.

There's no lack of dive bars in the Mission, but The Phoenix always managed to pull off the feel well without trying. (Like that one friend of yours who actually looks good in skinny jeans.)

If you need a beer and a respite from artisanal eateries and hipster dingy, try the Phoenix!
author: Kevin B.

description:
"As you slide down the banister of life, may the splinters never point in the wrong direction."  Irish blessing and wall art near the entrance of the Phoenix.


Here's some pointers:

- DO NOT UNDERESTIMATE this place.  They have REALLY good food considering you're in a pub.  They know what they're doing in the kitchen.

- HUGE portions, a gal next to us had a 1/2 order of some Irish potato nachos and it was massive.
- Another woman had ordered a salad that looked like 2 salads on one ginormous plate.  Good Lordie.

- Their burger is better than big mouth's.  There, I said it!  Ordered the blue burger, loved it!  Make sure you get a side of aoili to smear on the bun.  Trust me.

- 20 oz. standard pub size drafts.   YaYo.  

My friend tried to get me to eat here for months, why it took me so damn long is beyond me.


Not exactly a happy hour gal but I probably could be coaxed every now and then ... and this place seems that happy hour might turn into a couple happy hours.
author: Athena S.

description: Irish sportsbar in the Mission district. great staff. good selection of beer and bar food. casual place to hang out with friends. A little loud  but it ads to the great atmosphere.
author: Cesar D.

description:
First off, The Phoenix does not feel particularly "Irish". Now, I really like this place and I really don't care because I don't really think they were going for authenticity or anything, but if you're expecting that, you're not going to get it. 

Along with the extensive beer selection, they have mojitos, margaritas, martinis, and much more. Their happy hour also kicks ass. Cheap half - pints if you want to try a few different beers, and cheap (I think $5 - 7) appetizers. My boyfriend and I have been here a handful of times, and we've tried the fish and chips, bangers and mash, vegetable pot pie, and a good selection of appetizers. The jalepeno poppers are the best. 

As far as ambiance goes, like I said, it is not the most "Irish" Irish bar, but it is Irish enough. It's very warm and cozy, with families and children sitting side by side with drunken college kids, and top 40 music on the jukebox. 

I really like the Phoenix. It's a great deal, a great happy hour, and a great environment to spend a relexing evening in The Mission.
author: Angela S.

description: I love this bar, second time I have come around and the music is to my taste classic hip hop music. The food is very good especially if your going to drink. I ordered the Broiled Chicken Sandwich. The bacon on it was so good, would of been nice to have some BBQ sauce to put on it. You want to have a good time with your friends and feel invited then this is the bar to go.
author: David U.

description:
STAY AWAY - DON'T GO!
I really hate to write a review because I love this place so much and it can already get pretty crowded on a game day... however, its really deserves every stellar review it receives. 
At The Phoenix you will find:
1. The warm, cozy ambiance you expect from an Irish pub
2. Amazing food, huge servings and great quality at very reasonable prices - that you don't expect to find in a typical Irish pub. An especially unexpected surprise is the breakfast. Its my favorite breakfast place in the Mission. OMG! You must try the Bacon Boxty. Ask for extra hollandaise.
3. One of the best Happy Hours for food, also features drink specials
4. Great service with a smile, fast and efficient
5. Friendly, laid back servers are always helpful and courteous
6. Great sports bar with access to screens from almost every seat

CONS:
-It can get really rowdy and loud during sporting events so if thats not your thing beware. 
-Avoid the lower booths on a game day. You will have an excellent view of the screen until the place fills up and people are standing in front of you, obstructing the screen
- must get there early during sporting events. Arrived just before noon (too late) for the 49ers v Falcons game. No room at the Inn, no amazing breakfast for me, so I sit here at my second fave breakfast place, Boogalooz. Not so bad, but no game :(

Overall, 5 stars and worth every one!
author: Yolanda I.

description:
5!

Service was prompt and helpful, menu was full of variety but not overloaded. Not squeaky clean, but decent.. everything else makes up for it. lol

It was super random to stumble in here.. An Irish place in the Mission? C'mon.. I was quite reluctant at first, but glad I did!

Sheperd's pie: YUM.. the only downside was it was HOT for so long (cuz of the mashed potatoes).. my fav part was the mash potatoes that got a bit browned on the edges :)
Quesadillas: didn't have too much of it but DAMN it was a bigass plate. I thought it was random for an "Irish pub" but it's good beer food I guess.
Mac n Cheese: nothing special but big portion as well.

The soda bread was also a good touch. On the house! It's like.. cakey bread. The butter was good with it too :)
author: Emily C.

description:
They have the prettiest waitresses/bartenders here! 

I went here the day after Valentines for breakfast. I don't remember the name of my order but it was some sort of veggie hash with two poached eggs. It came with goat cheese sauce that I asked to have on the side and I'm glad I did. It was really gross tasting. It was a huge portion and I was only able to eat half of it. The whole wheat pancakes looked really good too but I thought I would choose the more nutritious entree. The veggie hash came out really oily though. 

It came with complimentary Irish Soda Bread which was disgusting. It was so bitter. My friend told me it tasted better with butter but I don't eat butter so I was just stuck with bitter bread. 

Our orders took forever to come out and then one of the waitresses came and told us they forgot our order. They only charged us for one entree to compensate. It was $15 total for both of us.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
One of my new favorite bars in the Mission. I've been here twice and both times it did not disappoint. Came in the early afternoon both times and we all ordered off the food menu, no complaints by anyone! For apps though the Nachos are amazing!
The bar teeters on the verge of being divey, but its rather nice inside and the bathrooms are clean, at least during the day. 
There is a nice selection of food and beer/alcohol on the menu. And they still have tv's and will play the Giants game, which is a plus because I feel like you don't get enough bars like that in the city. 
Definitely would recommend for brunch, lunch, and dinner. They have some cheaper beers, some hard to find beers, a great bloody mary, and a lot of whiskey!
author: Lisa S.

description:
It's  not an official trip until you start drinking in the AM ;)

Took a weekend trip to San Francisco with my boyfriend & friends and after hitting up Mission District in the AM, we passed by this bar. After walking for about an hour or so, the drinks definitely hit the spot :) 

I'm not a beer snob at all, but it seemed that they had a great beer selection, so thumbs up. The service was OK.  

It's a very chill, hipster bar with Indie music playing in the background. No complaints. Can't say anything about the food since we had none, but would give it a try if I go back.
author: Mirna F.

description:
Great place to watch Sunday Football.  It doesn't get too crowded and service is quick.  
Happy to see there were a couple of Charger fans there too to help me cheer on my Bolts!!
author: Michele S.

description: Went there to watch football on a Sunday.  It gets pretty crowded, but it's a bar in the Mission during the playoffs.  We managed to get a table.  The soda bread, which I am assuming is made in house is delicious.  Fresh, not laying like a brick in your intestines like some that I have had.  I ordered from the brunch menu, some egg scramble concoction.  It was pretty good, nothing to write home about.  The real highlight was the soda bread for me, that and some drinks I could have saved myself a few bucks.
author: Trenicia W.

description: The guinness isn't good nor do they poor one properly... And the temp on the guinness isn't right. Did they buy the guinness from Mexico? To be a good true Irish pub you have to know how to serve Guinness.
author: C D.

description: A favorite for sports with a real pub atmosphere and friendly locals
author: Jim E.

description: One of my favorite pubs in the Mission. Drop in, get a black velvet, treat yourself.
author: C N M.

description:
An Irish bar that's clean and yet still has that pubby feel?  Love it.

Rest assured that here, you will never be more than 10 feet away from a TV,  staff Will change the channels for you if you ask, and you'll be in the company of a super chill/friendly crowd.

Obviously another plus would be the happy hour ($1 off draft, $5 margaritas!!).

Therefore, my only word of advice would be if it's game night, arrive early to snag a table.  The worst that can happen is you'll just be early and have more time to fuel up with the HH menu!
author: Tracy K.

description:
Based on my last three experiences here, I would have rated the Phoenix a two.  The wings were chewy, the service was terrible, and the doorman was ridiculously rude.  That all changed on my last visit to watch the NBA Finals.  Soo, SF is definitely not a basketball town and it is so hard to find any place that is playing a game, especially if there is a Giants game on.  My boyfriend and I stopped by Phoenix after we just couldn't stand standing anymore at Hi-Tops.  I was famished and although I've never really enjoyed any of the food I'd had here, I gave in. 

We walked in and there wasn't really any seating but I asked a waitress anyways and she offered us a corner counter top area, which had a good view of the kitchen (which I always like).  I ordered the Chipotle Chicken Salad which was actually really good and asked for Jalapenos which came with it.  My bf ordered the cheese sticks and he also enjoyed his.  The service from our waitress was great but what we really enjoyed was watching the cook.  He is a young Latino guy working the kitchen by himself and pumping out finished dishes left and right.  He wasn't even timing the fryer but everything came out golden fried to perfection.  Everything looked good!!!

Although I was so reluctant to come here, I'm glad I did because they must have changed the waitstaff and the cooks because I was actually impressed.  I can't wait to go back but I'll make sure its the same cook before I order any food.
author: Brandy B.

description: First off, I will say that I'm not really a huge sports guy. That being said, Phoenix boasts some of the best wings in the bay, super impressed.  I'm from the Midwest my whole life, and have been a bit disappointed in sf. Phoenix has decent sliders, good shepards pie, and fantastic wings. Good job guys.
author: andy s.

description:
The name says it all. Irish Gathering House...like it was raining outside and we were safe in these welcoming Irish dwellings. 

I would like to give this place 4 1/2 stars because the service can be a little off, but otherwise the homestyle food; we had garlic fries, mashed potatoes, hamburger, and Shepherd's pie, all big portions and big flavor, the wide selection of European beers; chimay, affliglem, served in the appropriate glasses (specific to each beer), and multiple screen TVS with people shouting and then hugging and high-fiveing for big plays really had me enjoying my Sunday.
author: Daniella B.

description: Wandering around the Mission, my friend and I stumbled upon this spot to watch the A's epically lose to the Tigers. It was jam packed, but lucky for us there was a party leaving so we were able to swoop on their table. I really appreciated how quickly the server chick came to get us started with menus and water. What is super awesome about this spot is the variety of beers they have on tap. What's even more awesome is that you can order half pints so that you can sample a bunch of different beers. Even though I didn't get anything to eat, the items on the menu were definitely tempting. Overall, if you're looking for a chill spot to watch any games and grab a brewskie then this Irish bar is the place for you.
author: Cristal C.

description:
Terrible costumer service, food is ok meat is cheap and chewy.
Overrated hipster pub.
author: Dmitry K.

description: Decent bar in the Mission.  Not really sure what's Irish about it, but it's a good pub with friendly staff and plenty of seating.
author: Brian B.

description: If I could give a negative star, I would. The bartender was a complete moron and had no idea how to make any generic cocktail so I had to get a gin and soda and she gave me vodka and tonic with a nasty attitude. I've been in the service industry since I could work and some people, such as this girl, just aren't cut out for working as a bartender. Get a better and more experienced bartender. Middle of the day and she's stuck on her phone clueless af. Maybe more people would be there during the day if she would loosen up those braids on her head to increase the blood flow to her brain.
author: G C.

description: Close to Valencia, where I started the day. The rest of the day is kind of a blur, but I remember ordering a lot of cheap beer here and eating some subpar chicken wings. Thankfully got bar seats as the place started to fill up. The Knicks were on, but they lost. About all I can say about this one.
author: Dan M.

description:
Great Irish Pub!
Happy hour is a great deal.
Food is delicious! Their pot roast is wonderful. 
My Paddy's whiskey is always in stock. 
My favorite place to watch soccer games. :)
The staff is always on it and friendly.
author: Stacey D.

description: The food here is surprisingly good considering it's "bar food". The drinks are strong and the staff is really friendly and accommodating. It can get a bit noisy from time to time when there are games, on a Friday or Saturday night (duh!) or, and this is the worst, if the new fresh out of college and new to SF bros show up. Otherwise, this is a great bar that's just a wee bit away from the hotter areas of the Mission (16th and Valencia).
author: Jan S.

description: Prices were very reasonable and the service was great. The bartender even helped us with finding good restaurants to go to later.
author: Chad W.

description:
(See pics)

More of 3.3 stars.

Good Irish bar food and I had the "famous Irish breakfast." Like the atmosphere and it attracts locals who want to watch a game, solid food and friendly service.
author: T L.

description:
Bacon boxty (4.5 stars), shepards pie (3.5 stars), and Irish breakfast (3.5 stars) are all solid options for football brunch.  The food is solid and so are the Irish Coffees.  

Football brunch is awesome!  Just be aware that you'll need to get there before 10am to ensure you get a TV for game watching.  My only complaint is that we arrived very early one day, and the waitress tried to blow us off when we were trying claim our TV.  She was trying to avoid letting us have the screen, so the 9ers could have it among most other TVs in the bar.  You need to play fair Phoenix.  If we follow the rules, then your servers need to respect the rules too.  If this happens again, then we will be really disappointed and likely find somewhere else for game day.
author: Alexis B.

description:
What a cute Irish bar!

I like this bar because they have a lot of seating, including booths (I love those!).  Also, a long counter provides enough personal space, which is important when you're trying to do Irish car bombs/jager bombs with 8 of your friends!  The decor is nice and the people there seemed nice too!

This place is totally poppin' on a Saturday night - will come back again if I'm near the area!
author: Peggy S.

description:
Stopped by here last Monday for breakfast. 
Service was great, I had a delicious ale, and the I ordered the "Half Irish breakfast" which was an assortment of Irish bacon,sausages, potatoes, and eggs.  The meal tasted a little strange but I figured that was because I hadn't eaten "Irish Bacon or sausages" before.   That was a mistake!

By Monday night I was nauseous and by next morning, I had full blown diarrhea --- the vomiting, cramps, and diarrhea have stayed with me all week and I thought I had the flu until my doctor informed me yesterday that I had FOOD POISONING!  
i have been unable to consume anything but clear liquids until this morning when I had a couple ounces of oatmeal which may yet be regurgitated--wait and see!
So far this week I have lost 15 lbs off my fat ass which is the only bright spot in an otherwise agonizing 4 days of misery.  

My companion ate a different meal and is just fine so the place is probably OK but I doubt I'll ever eat here again.
author: Jim T.

description:
I must admit, I'm a Mission District  wanderer.  This bar is a casual, friendly place to catch a drink or come watch the game with some friends.  

I've gone a few times.  I love the Bloody Mary.  I've gone a few times during the game--it gets a little crazy crowded, but super exciting if you like to watch the game with a crowd.

The bartenders are fun and down-to-earth.  Our waitress actually told my husband that he was going to have to order something "less girlie" when he ordered a little fruity drink!  We LOVED that!

They also have $4 Mimosas til 4.  With mimosas, bloody mary's, irish, games, AND food--this place is quite the diverse!
author: Jensyn H.

description: Great flavors! Excellent food. Pub-like atmosphere, but my lunch (for two) of grilled cod tacos, corned beef Reuben and lamb stew was satisfying and delicious.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
Really comfortable place to go if you are a woman who wants to have a beer in a friendly, safe environment. You can have a beer, watch some sports, eat a hearty meal and not feel like this is 'only for the guys' or being stared at.  Sometimes a girl just wants a beer and some Irish food at 2PM without feeling like she's intruding on some man cave.
The staff are ridiculously nice, earthy good hearted gals.
author: Junie C.

description:
Unless you plan on going during happy hour or plan on staring at the hot bartenders, I'm not sure there's much else for you.

The beer selection is very basic, nothing special, unless you consider Sierra Nevada Pale Ale and Racer 5 to be extra special (they are delicious but you can find them most places) and the food really falls flat.

The servers and bartenders though - are awesome, hot and have great style. So eye candy for sure.

The happy hour specials include $1 off draft beer and $4 well drinks. I only get the food during happy hour since its cheap, but the only two things I like are the onion rings and the jalapeños and even then, they are just ok.
author: Lauren B.

description: The wings and food are delicious!  The service sucks!!!  Why do I need to ask our server 2-3 times for our cocktails? That's ALL!! ENOUGH SAID!
author: Jay S.

description:
Pretty nice digs. We were in the area for Bring Your Own Big Wheel, and decided to stop here since my friends were more of the Hibernophile persuasion. We sat in the back, where it was quieter, had a couple glasses of Magner's, and dined on brunch. 

The pre-meal soda bread they brought us was insanely good - I could make a whole meal of just this soft, brown goodness with a little butter. 

I had the Bacon Boxty ($10.95 - potato pancakes, Irish bacon, poached egg, topped with Hollandaise sauce). For some reason, I expected the potato pancake to be more of a hashbrown consistency or like a latke, but it pretty much was a potato-flavored short stack of pancakes. Never had boxty before, and didn't realize it was like that. 

The parts of the boxty short stack that didn't get drizzled with Hollandaise and refused to soak up any when dipped in the remaining puddles of sauce, were rather dry. Ended up leaving about a third of the potato pancakes uneaten. 

The bacon was wider and thicker than your typical bacon. Pretty good. 

I liked our pixy-ish waitress a lot - she was attentive and quickly righted an issue when my boyfriend received the wrong sandwich without having to be told. Sometime during the meal, we heard the crash of someone dropping something and immediately her voice rang through with, "It didn't break!" and the whole pub laughed.
author: Christine A.

description:
As a real Irishman I give this place a massive THUMBS UP!

1. 9 years I've lived in USA and this is the first pub to serve real pints. Full size pints.
2. Excellent service. Great staff, very friendly and attentive. 
3. Food was very good too, not easy to make good Irish food in the US but this was definitely a win. 
4. HARP! The Harp tasted like a pint from back home. The bottled Harp I buy in the store doesn't even taste this good. 
5. Clean, friendly and just because they deserve a second mention, FANTASTIC STAFF.

This was date night for us and what a great date we had.
Loved it and will be back again soon.
author: Tony W.

description: The Phoenix is the best place for food, drinks, and watching sports championship games. I recommend the steak, fish or chicken tacos, tuna Melt or Fish And Chips. You get hefty portions and all the dishes are cooked to perfection. The bartenders are great too. Jess the manager is the mainstay. She's great all around. Ashley and Yasmin are wonderful too. If you like to feel at home and love good Irish taste and a feel of old time San Francisco go to the Phoenix you won't be disappointed
author: Rob L.

description:
It's a good stop for some beers but I wouldn't expect good food.  

I've had lots of bar food, and good bar food, and pub food, and Irish food - this wasn't the best.  Or close.  The worst offender by far was the onion ring.  The simple onion ring.  Boy let me tell you, we ate two and left the rest.  The onions were still basically uncooked, the batter fell off immediately, and they were not seasoned at all!  Greasy to the extreme, and I LIKE GREASE.  So that's saying a lot.
author: Rachelle P.

description:
Check watch. 1:16 AM. Enter bar. Approach bar with cash in hand. Two Fernets. Give Cash. Drink Fernets. Get Change. Leave Tip. Smile. Exit. The run time of this Irish talkie: 126 seconds. 

There are some who see The Phoenix and think: yes, pint after pint like old Dubliners in one booth for four hours or more (I've seen myself in those boots, too). Know now though... this bird rises to any occasion, including a Fernet fly by.
author: Jon A.

description:
This is my second foray into the world of the Phoenix- the first was for St. Patrick's Day when I was supposed to meet a group of friends, couldn't find them, so I left.  

Of course I was first again for DYL, but then Stephan (and posse), as well as our organizer Kristina A showed up, so we were on our way to making it an epic evening.  

First of all, I had been detoxing all week- so I was ready for some pub food and a couple of beers.  Nothing too crazy, as I wanted to get to the gym the next day.  

They have some killer deals- I ordered the blonde (the beer, not a woman), wings, and Irish nachos.  The wings were good and appropriately messy.   The nachos were okay, but I really wish PLACES WOULD TELL YOU WHEN THEY PUT GREEN ONIONS ON THINGS.  

In any case, the company I kept more than made up for some pesky quasi-vegetable that annoys me.  Got to see many of my old favorites, met some new people, managed to get drunk enough to tell people things I probably shouldn't have, as well as drunk dialed people who probably wish I didn't.  Sadly I didn't get an ass grab, which would have made my night.

It's a good space, and the staff was very nice and accommodating.   

Would I come back?  Oh yes I would.
author: Pam S.

description:
