Not my favorite bar in the mission, but not that uncomfortable either. I've been able to come here with a group of five or six on a busy night and still be able to get a table. The drinks are okay, but sometimes depending on the night the crowd can be a little too much on the college age group, which nothing against them, but alas, I'm 26 and would prefer less stupidity/jackass behavior from guys who are four/five years younger than me. 

To all of you reading this, it's much sexier when guys can hold their drinks and hit on a girl at the same time!
author: Carolina S.

description: Not sure how this place escaped me all these years, but I'm a fan. This is a great spot if you want a low key night in the Mission (or turnt up - you can get cray if you want!) and eat some surprisingly good bar food. I came here with a small group and tried the Shepherd's Pie, Chicken Pot Pie, and the Fish 'N Chips. I would order all three again in a heartbeat, they were ON POINT. Great service, drinks, and food plus a laidback atmosphere to boot? Everything this old granny is looking for in a night out with friends.
author: Irene B.

description: A fun and unpretentious little pub in the middle of an otherwise hipster part of town, the Phoenix is the perfect place to kick back after a week of the grind and enjoy a good IPA. I went late on a Friday night, and it was just busy enough to be lively without being too crowded or loud for conversation. We sat at the tables in the back where it was quieter, but we were able to go up to the bar to get drinks without spending an eternity trying to catch someone's attention. All the bartenders were attentive, cordial, and, most of all, happy to be working there. Have to come back for the food!
author: Esther W.

description:
It's on the very short list of bars where I'd rather be there in the morning than at night.

They make an excellent Bloody Mary. They're generous with the horseradish and it's garnished beautifully with a slice of lemon, lime, a couple pickled green beans, and an olive and cocktail onion. Some might say it's a complete meal!

Their Irish Coffee is delicious as well. I'd be careful, though, they are stronger than you'd think!

I especially like their brunch. If it's on the specials board, get their NY steak. For $15, you probably won't find a better steak at that price. Try their soda bread too. It's as good as they say it is. It looks kind of dry and nondescript on appearance, but the taste and texture is just wonderful. I'd compare it to eating a nutritious slice of cake.

Nice place to get a weekend day started. It's doesn't get particularly crowded in the morning, so you can enjoy the game on their TV or even just hang out and read your book.
author: Jeffrey J.

description:
One of my favorite HH spots in the mission, but maybe I shouldn't share that because it's way better when I can get a seat and it's not super crowded. For games, it gets packed bc it has a bunch of TVs in the front and the back of the bar. Otherwise, M-W during HH it's chill, but T-F its pretty crowded, so get there early if you want to sit.

HH:
$4 big buffalo wings. Not many  places w  big wings in this city, so I like them.
$1 garlic fries - nothing special, wish they were more garlicky, but what can u expect for $1
$3 black bean quesadilla  - looks big and yummy
$3 Irish Nachos- instead of chips, they build the normal nacho toppings on potatoes - pretty yummy and big, although probably really bad for you
$2.50 sliders- a yummy burger (well, half of it). I pretty much get one every time. Definitely best cooked MR, but I guess that depends on your taste.

So the beers are $1 off during HH. They have prob 8-10 on tap...and Franziskaners yumm. They also have $5 margaritas during HH.

Regular hours: I've only went for breakfast besides HH, and the first time I went when I didn't live in the city, I thought their Eggs Benedict was amazing. They also serve you thick pieces of Soda Bread when you dine in. After living here for a bit, and trying out other eggs benedict (Circa-yum), I think its good, but not great. Everyone always seems to be satisfied with their meals, they are huge and filling, lots of carbs.

Also for the parents out there, I've seen kids here many times, and no one seems to have a problem with it.
author: Jessica S.

description: im irish and a fan might come back again in the future good decor
author: Leigh G.

description:
This place rocks! to say the least

Great Selection of beer, cute female bartenders...esp when they all dress up for Halloween or St Patty's Day, multiple TV displaying all the games you'd want to see, food is cheap considering you get a hearty portion..thriving crowd

I always have a great time when I come here, amazing lamb shank for $14...thats a steal!  Ribs are to die for...order the side of mac and cheese...some of the best M&C in town.  Great place for beers too..my pick is the Leffe. 

If you ever get a call from a buddy asking for a place with great food and a great beer without paying an arm and leg...this place is the winner hands down in the city
author: Eric H.

description: Decent Irish pub....interior is un-impressive, but my shepherds pie was satisfying, although unspectacular. Solid 3 star restaurant, would go again if in the area, and by in the area, I mean I'm less than a few blocks away.
author: Jeff I.

description:
I drive by this place every morning so I decided to check out the reviews to see if its worth my time since Valencia street gets super busy and crowded..

Seeing that most reviews are pretty good I decided to take my family out for lunch to see what this place was about.

We ordered a couple drinks (a few beers and a lemon drop) .. The lemon drop was really tastey & the beers were great of course.

I ordered the Chipotle Chicken sandwich... Considering I've had some bad experiences ordering chicken sandwiches with some being under cooked, too rough or too chewy.. I was completely shocked to have such a wonderful tasting & cooked perfectly chicken sandwich. It was so good that I told the waiter to tell the chef that it was one of the best chicken sandwiches I've ever had..

Overall the food and drinks were excellent and I am happy to say that my family and I will be returning soon!!
author: C A.

description:
I came to this bar last night just in time to watch the Cal game and was very fortunate to find an open booth right by the door. The place is not very big considering it got really crowded as the night wore on. The ambiance was filled with young groupies with a full bar and a few tables and booths at the front, followed by a pathway to the back where there were a few more tables to complete the layout. It was difficult for me to consider the visit a "sports bar experience" since most people were there for drinks rather than to watch the game. I don't remember seeing too many sports memorabilia and depending on where one sits some of the hanging lamps can be obstructive to the view of the flat screen TVs. Since the place is already small, it is understandable why their tables would be undersized, but this also led to numerous accidents where people either spilled their drinks or lost their beer glass to the floor. 

My order of roast pork sandwich ($9.50) with "taytoes" was smaller than expected. The sandwich came nice and warm with soft French rolls but only three slices of hand carved roast pork at the center. Although the roast pork had a nice hint of smoke surrounded with spicy aioli, the sauce did not have enough spiciness to inspire while the few pieces of greens did not distinguish.  The side of taytoes did not come in the thick cut fashion described by the server. They turned out to be homemade potato chips and were tasty at first but too greasy to finish it all. Overall, I don't mind paying more for food at  sports bars since I'll be occupying a table for a few hours, but the sandwich could be much better if the meat and greens were more fulfilling.

Service was friendly and attentive the entire time. There were two servers constantly checking on me and overall there was a lot of energy and enthusiasm from their wait staff. I might stop by again if I happen to be in the area in need of watching a game, but there's something obviously missing with all the TVs on mute while the game was on. Not bad, but hardly anything to cheer about. 3 stars for the decent experience.
author: Daniel L.

description:
Needed a place to watch MNF while I was in the area... Yelp to the rescue.

I headed over to the Phoenix and walked in to a pretty packed bar. I had to hover by a table as someone was leaving to grab a spot where I could see the TV. Folks there seemed evenly split between watching the football game, watching the baseball game, and chatting amongst themselves. 

My server was friendly but was obviously stretched pretty thin as it took a little while for her to get to me.

I got the happy hour 1/2 order of fish n chips. The "chips" were good, though the fish was a bit oily.

They had a bunch of local/regional beers which were pretty good and reasonably priced.
author: Damon T.

description:
Ahhh! Can't believe I've gone this long without writing a review for this place!

About eight of us were going to a book signing at Borderlands, and came here first for a bite and a drink. We were lucky in that we snagged one of the last two tables to fit our group. 
It's a bar, seating's first come first served. 
We came during happy hour, so we all sampled from the HH menu. I had a cider on draft (so much better than from a bottle) another of my friends had a Guinness, and everyone else had mixed drinks. No complaints as far as alcohol content goes, so nice to know they don't water down the well for the cheapies out there. 
The food was GREAT. Not a cluttered plate in the lot, and not much sharing at all. I had one of their sliders, and garlic fries, and they were very tasty. 
I wish this place was in the East Bay, mainly so I could visit it more often. It's got, like, everything I want in a bar.
author: Jamie B.

description:
Irish bar in the Mission, odd? Maybe.

But do I like it? Definitely! It's just a little different from your standard bar in the Mission, just to change it up every now and then.

Plus their bar food (artichoke dip) is pretty tasty.
author: Helen D.

description:
I've been to the Phoenix a number of times and was happy to go yesterday when some friends suggested we watch the 49ers game. Without getting bogged down in the details the bartender, Tanzie (sp?), could not have been more awful. After she bitched me out for having the audacity to ask for another beer while she was in the middle of pouring the four I ordered originally, she got into two shouting matches with other customers and yelled at one of the servers. 

Initially I was angry, but upon seeing her berate other people I became entertained and then just started feeling bad for her; she was clearly having a rough day. That being said, I would prefer not to be condescended to like Im a child before handing over $30 for some beers. There are too many bars in this city to deal with that kind of shitty service.

On the other hand, Megan, one of the servers, went out of her way to apologize to us and seemed genuinely upset that we'd had a bad experience. Thank you Megan, it was very much appreciated but I will still try to avoid the Phoenix in the future.
author: adam v.

description:
Lesson learned - never say never! Here I am finding myself dating a member of the species I had sworn I would never be involved with again: men who LOVE football. He's one of those whose favorite time of the year is now. He watches everything he can, including college football. He dresses up to go to the games. His iphone case is the color of his team. He bets with passion.The thing is that I adore him and found myself being happily reinitiated to this different world. I guess that The Phoenix had to do with it.

On a Thursday night, watching football at The Phoenix was a pleasant surprise. In spite of the tvs, it didn't feel like a sports bar, but more like a casual and fun Irish pub. Many people were just chatting in groups, some couples were having dinner and a few paying attention to the screens. They had some electronic music on, and although I am not a fan of that type of music, it did help the casual pub atmosphere even more. And seeing him playfully dancing sitting on his stool put a big smile on my face no football could erase. 

We had the fish tacos (chicken and fish) and they were pretty delicious. I saw people having other dishes and everything seemed really good. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive, always refiling our water. The music and the lighting definitely made it more of a 'casual bar experience'. All in all, The Phoenix made my 'compromise points' very easy to earn. :-)
author: Simone W.

description: I would have happily given 4 stars for the fish n chips but calling at 8 this morning to find out they will be opening early to show the France v Germany World Cup match, well, that merits an additional star for sure.
author: Deniz U.

description:
Drinks are solid. Prices are solid.

The slow-cooked foods are amazing. Normally an Irish pub like this will have some standard pub fare, but the shepherd's pie I had and the meatloaf she had were amazing.
author: Ben M.

description:
I went here with a friend to have an Irish Coffee and although it was still early in the evening we were happy to see a good amount of people in this pub. This place has great character and the nachos are an experience.  

This pub really gives you the feeling that it is a gathering house and a place that I will come back to often. This is not a bar, this is definitely not a bar but they do have a wide verity of beers available. The Irish coffee was $10.
author: Justin S.

description: Cool vibe inside. The staff is very friendly and professional. They have a large assortment of draft beers available. If you are Irish you will definitely appreciate the art work inside as well as the Sheppard's Pie.
author: Remington L.

description: This place was crackin' with all the right elements! Good food, good drinks, and football. Definitely going back.
author: Sofia F.

description: It's a decent size and it wasn't too hard to grab a table for 6 on a Saturday after dinner. Staff are super friendly, letting us have a look at the menu even though it was ~10 minutes to kitchen close, and they were happy to change the channel for us so we could watch our game. Nice variety of beers on tap; prices are average/fair.
author: Feifei X.

description:
Awesome place, with a very good collection irish whiskeys.
Loved their 12 yr - Red breast whiskey
Friendly service. Casual atmosphere , gets really rowdy with fun later in the night .
author: Vishu S.

description: Love this place! Its one of my favorite Irish pubs in SF. The Food is awesome and they have the BEST hot wings in the city~! If you disagree, tell me where to go that's better. The bar tenders here are also awesome! and they definitely take the time to get to know the locals! They remembered my crew when we showed up 6 months after our 2012 St. Patty's day adventure! Highly recommend this bar!
author: Natalia H.

description: A very nice bar overall, very attentive staff, many TV's and fresh, cold brew. I like the many TVs on the wall ready to play the game, and the seating arrangements. When it is packed I'd rather go somewhere else, but it's still a good place if you show up early and grab a stool at the bar or are lucky to get a table.
author: Joseph H.

description:
So I have actually grown to love this place. It's a pub with good food and a decent selection of drinks. The servers are always nice and friendly even when I or my friends in our drunken friends are at our worst.  But that's the cool part, I mean it's not usually packed, my friends and I can come grab a table and just chill. 
Food wise it's pretty good. Fries are decent, bangers and mash are awesome (the menu makes it sound like it doesn't come with mashed potatoes ... but it does), the tacos are petty good as well.

Overall good place.
author: Greg G.

description:
Stopped in here randomly because I was with someone with less of an attention span than me.  We must have walked in and out of 3 or 4 places before stopping here for a drink and some snacks.  We got the hot wings, based on the recommendation of the bartender, and the spinach artichoke dip.  The dip was tasty, but almost immediately congealed, so all I got were broken chips.  No bueno.  The chicken was fine.  The Patron and Stella's were the same as anywhere else.

This was not our main meal since we were heading to Hog and Rocks after, but it was a decent spot to meet up with people and grab a couple of drinks before moving on.
author: Seong P.

description:
Complimentary bread with butter & jam when you come in for brunch: DELICIOUS. My friend and I asked for a second serving of it. I'm not sure what kind of bread it was, but it was thick in texture like pound cake. It has a hint of sweetness to it. 

I ordered the bacon boxter which comes with eggs benedicts with hollandaise sauce  placed on top of Irish bacon and toast with a side of potatoes. It was filling for one person, but definitely not for sharing. The potatoes were cooked perfectly with the outside being crisp and the inside being soft. The Irish bacon was delicious and flavorful with each bite of the eggs. It added flavor to the eggs since the hollandaise sauce was really light. All this food for around $11!

I would definitely come back here again!

P.S. $4 mimosa... can't really go wrong with that :)
author: Melanie L.

description:
Do you like the Mission but aren't a 10 on the coolness meter? This place is perfect for those of us who don't fall into that 21-25 1/2 club. 

Here are my ratings:
Grub: Fried nicely. 8
Beer: Fine selection with fancy glasses. 9 1/2
Service: Pretty good. 9
Atmosphere: Dark enough so you don't have to see how ugly the other customers probably are. Tasteful. 9 1/2
Bathroom: OK except the urinals need a divider.  6
Clientele: Lacks the usual barroom undesirables. 9

Other than that... just another watering hole.
author: Mace W.

description:
Stopped in for a drink with a buddy mid pub crawl and met Jessica(?) as she made me her first ever Bumblebee (Boddingtons Ale & Guinness) and my buddy tried to explain the DERBY cocktail enjoyed previously at The Comstock Saloon and while he enjoyed it and I think Jessica did too, (But it was more like a whiskey mojito) I think she owes herself a trip to The Comstock Saloon and to sample their happy hour concoction the 'DERBY' and add it to her drink list and if feeling daring I hope she tries the Corpse Reviver 2 which is one of my favorite cocktails!
It was a good stop in for a drink in The Mission!
CHEERS!
author: Sean M.

description: Great place for drink and food.  Ordered food from the happy hour menu and it was great.  $5 for ( wings and they were great.  Homemade blue chees too.  Fish Tacos were great  Service was great. Highly recommend. Import Beers $5  at happy hour $6 normally. 20 oz beer glasses.
author: Michael C.

description: An Irish Sports Bar that plays music in the background during a game is just unacceptable & pathetic. I would understand if this was a restaurant, then i'd be ok with it but at a BAR? This is the most ridiculous thing ever! I'm never coming back to watch a game here. If it wasn't for the wonderful staff who work their socks off, I wouldn't have given them a single star.
author: True R.

description:
Been here twice so far, and enjoyed it both times. Its a nice neighborhood bar, with some very interesting crowd. First time I was there, was on my birthday. Thursday night, and at 10 pm we managed to get a booth. They've got a nice selection of beer and drinks. THe bar tenders are really nice too! 
They play some nice music as well. I will definitely try to be a regular here :-)
author: Gurpreet S.

description:
Friday night was my first night out in the Mission after living in San Francisco for over a year. 

The Phoenix is a calm, cool, and eclectic little joint. A Marina native, it was nice to breakaway from the pretentious,designer-label, frat-boys and blonde bimbos for a place that seemed more accepting of all walks of life. What joy to be wearing my Giants t-shirt and a pair of converse where NOBODY CARES! 

The staff were friendly and the drinks were strong (in a good way- not the oh-my-god this ratio of alcohol to mixer is out of control)!

A lovely little joint for post-game drinks. I certainly wouldn't mind going back!
author: Annalise F.

description: a week before st patricks day,  went there with my Irish partner ,   and he is so  strict regard the irish pubs he like to go.   this place  was so great.  fun.  the food was great,  the  beer was fantastic ,  i finally  find a  good irish place to take him and make him happy.      service was great!  !
author: Li H.

description:
I had the chicken pot pie, which was tasty.  My boyfriend had the BLT if memory serves.  

The place is cute, I was tired so it was a little loud for me and because I actually like conversing with my boy....  I would go back, hopefully when I'm not as tired.
author: Kristin G.

description:
This place is cool. So cool, that I forgot all about it.

I've only come here late night after a couple of drinks. Seems there is always space to sit down, and I like roomy bars.

Drinks are a bit pricey, but what isn't?

Ya, I'll go back here.
author: Rachel G.

description:
It was a sunny Sunday afternoon and my friend and I were walking in the Mission. We really wanted chicken wings but the restaurant we intended to go to was not open. Hence, we walked into the Phoenix Bar for food. 

I ordered some corned beef plate, which turned out to be huge!! The portion sizes were ridiculous. If you want more bang for your buck, this is the place to go. The dish was all carbs and meat so I seriously couldn't eat much before I had to ask for a to-go box. The meal was just okay, not great.

We also went up to the bar to get a drink before we walked off to bask in the sun at Dolores Park. Our drink: Irish Trash Can. Everyone has heard of the Irish Car Bomb but not the Trash Can. Actually, I've never heard of it until my friend asked for one on the spot. The bartender had to pull up her iphone to figure out how to make it too. I don't know what is in it but I did see her add Red Bull to the drink. Apparently Red Bull is a main component of the drink. My immediate reaction: Gag....I hate Red Bull. 

Well, I sucked it up, drank the Trash Can, and walked off to Dolores Park. However, the combination of too many potatoes, beef, and Red Bull made me uncomfortable for the rest of the day.
author: Lily Z.

description: This place is a sorry excuse for a bar. The bar tender gave me a taste of a beer from the tab that had clearly soured weeks, if months before and when I informed her that the beer was rancid her response was "I don't know, maybe it's supposed to taste that way". This palace was just sad with poor service.
author: Ben N.

description: Seating is difficult to find on the weekend of course but then standing around is awkward because the atmosphere is not cozy. So what do we do now? Down that beer and move on to the next.
author: Briget P.

description:
A great spot for various reasons. The bartenders are great, and the drinks are strong. But its the combination of great food which ties this place together for me.

Plenty of seating through the bar, more than any bar boasts along that strip on Valencia. The pub favorites are:

Fish & Chips, Baked Macaroni & Cheese                
Chicken & Mushroom Pot Pie, Bangers & Mash                
Farm House Vegetable Pie                

You really can't go wrong with any of those. Then there is also their Shepherds Pie and a ton of sandwiches. 

A great place to come for a brunch to grease that hang over away. And maybe do a little hair of the dog as well, the bloody Mary is also quite good there.
author: Anish B.

description:
I came here the day after Halloween.  Worth noting that the day after Halloween may be one of the few days you can sneak in with orange tights.  CUZ IT'S A BAR FOR REAL MEN, HOOAH!

Seriously though, I really liked this place.  Sat down, and got started with my Smithwick's at 10 am sharp!  They kept feeding me, and feeding me, and feeding me, but unlike Method Man, it was for my benefit!

I ordered some food too.  A sausage scramble.  It took a really, really long time to come out, which made me sad.  However, the bartender comped it for me, which I greatly appreciated.  I also got some Irish Nachos, which were quite tasty.

The people here are really great too.  I came in to watch the Niners game, and stayed for some extra football.  The crowd here was extremely knowledgeable, and we had some good football chatter going.  Definitely appreciated.  I even won a bet with another bar patron about where Dashon Goldson was from.  I correctly knew he was from UW, where he thought he was from LSU.  He got confused with Mark Roman and Curtis Taylor.  Duh ;)

I'll def come again if I'm in the hood and need somewhere to watch some foosball.
author: Robert S.

description: This place is rad. I love that its not your typical grunge dive that takes cash only and has graffiti on the walls, sorry gangster hipsters, not this time. It's the closest thing to a sports bar in the Mission, with savory snacks, space for groups to conjure, and Irish coffees to be had. Their bartenders are as delightful as the crowd they attract, making the over all experience one to remember. Cheers!
author: Danielle L.

description:
Came here for a drink (or two...) after dinner one night.

The place was crowded but we managed two seats at the bar.  I really liked the vibe of the place, it was busy but everybody seemed happy. Good for groups.

Also, good for watching games. Gets ridiculously crowded during Giants and 49er games so beware of that! 

Otherwise, if you are looking for a fun place to drink and are in the area, come here!
author: Saria M.

description:
One of the best spots to host a DYL that I can think of. Great crowd, attentive and creative bartenders, good music and lost of seating options. 

Good decibel level to converse and the best part is that there are almost zero douchebags. Not hard to like this spot. 

I take back all that nonsense I talked about the Irish.
author: Dru P.

description:
Stumbled into it after work one hungry day, which made it happy hour.

Avoid the chicken strips (they look and taste like lame microwaved strip of fake chicken)

The hot wings were on point!

Garlic fries were good but not amazing.

$1 off draft beers (an okay incentive to go there for HH)

Overall, I enjoyed the ambiance and the wings with beer. There were plenty of TV screens for the basketball games as well.
author: Elisha Y.

description:
Happy hour (dollar off brews), GREAT food, awesome location, relaxed energy, friendly service. What more could you want?

Oh you also want vegetarian options with a popped pinky? They can do that too. I'm a fan of any place that allows me to indulge in fresh, delicious veggie food while also slamming down a beer and feeling completely natural about it.
author: Jen N.

description:
My brother, Dan B, and I stopped into The Phoenix after a morning of exploring Haight and the Mission District. I was wanting brunch and a beer, and that's exactly what I got here. The beer selection is typical of an Irish Pub, but I ended up with a Sierra Nevada cause who doesn't like hops in the morning. Food wise, I ordered the waffle with Irish bacon. [I think it's more so that I wanted the Irish bacon over the waffle, but both ended up being delicious.]

Service was good, a little slow to get our beers at first, but our waitress was really nice. I would definitely come back here again for brunch or dinner next time I'm in SF.
author: Candice Z.

description: This is one of my friends favorite spot to go so every time we hang out, he wants to go there. Happy hour is a great deal, beer and the fish and chips are our usual.
author: Marlo M.

description:
This is our go to place for brunch on the weekend in SF.
Even with a group of 6 or more of us we never had to wait for a table.

Possibly the best bloody mary's in the City too. Love the pickled Asparagus!

I've tried most things on the menu and they are all delicious.
author: Nici G.

description:
I love The Phoenix because it's a pub and a restaurant that delivers on both fronts. I went last night after not having been there for a year. It was a Friday and of course there was a soccer (futbol) game on the monitors. The place was lively, to say the least, but the food and service were strong. I had the Shepherd's Pie, which was delicious. My friends liked their Fish and Chips and burger. I stole a few fries and ended up stealing more because they were so good.

We had a three-year-old with us and the waitress was very accommodating. A server brought wings to our table that we didn't order and we reluctantly turned them away because they looked pretty tasty. I love the beer choices here and will be back soon, since I get consistent food and service here.
author: Arthur P.

description:
Let's say you're in the Mission. Let's say you've just gotten out of a movie at the Roxie and you're wanting to drink, but not whilst simultaneously combatting an unwieldy crowd of hipsters and/or a gaggle of girls in slutty dresses and sky-high heels. What are you to do?

I found myself in this predicament last Friday night with a few friends. We were not in the mood to dance, so we stumbled upon the Phoenix. While I can't say it's a bar I intend to frequent, I could definitely see myself parking it here occasionally when I'm just not feeling the loud scene-ness of literally every other bar in the Mission. Phoenix has decently-priced booze, decently-prepared food, seating to accommodate parties of different sizes, and most importantly, you can hear yourself talk. We shared the mostly-cheese artichoke dip and had a conversation that didn't involve awkward leaning and abuse of the word "WHAT?" On a Friday night in the Mission, that's all you can ask for.
author: Stefanie L.

description:
First of all people need to stop being retards! This is a go to bar, Olympics, world cup giants games! Been going to phoenix for at least three years. The food is great,the waitresses an bartenders rock! 
What my point on how many haters are on yelp, it's like fun place food was good and great lay out. Ect ect. Then they give it two stars???? If you liked it so much why such a low score? 

Ok off soup box, if u love good bars and good food head to Phoenix...
author: Konstantine A.

description: Good draft selection and great prices for the city. The service didn't blow me away, but I would definitely return to Phoenix Bar for another pint if I'm in the neighborhood!
author: Sophia A.

description:
My roommates and I came here for Valentine's Day...while it was somewhat busy, we had a really great time! They've never really been introduced to Irish cuisine before and I figured since they really wanted to drink, an Irish Pub would be a great choice (since I've been craving Shepherd's Pie also).

The food was delicious...I, of course, got the shepherd's pie, another person ordered the pot roast, and another ordered the steak sandwich...all were sooo good! Onto the drinks, I'm not much of a drinker, but according to my roommies, the drinks were SUPERB!!! They got some red-headed sluts (aka Lindsay Lohans..hehehehe), AMF's, Long Island Ice Teas, and blow job shots....The bartender was super nice and she really knew how to make all the drinks! All in all, everything was great! Definitely going to be coming back here...plus all the signs and sayings in the bar were hysterical!

Only reason why I didn't give a full 5 star review is because the food service was a bit slow and they weren't ENTIRELY busy...but it was worth it.
author: Maya B.

description:
I saw the Dallas Mavericks ruin Lebron's legacy here.

Service was a little bit on the slow side and the drinks were overpriced.  I would have also liked a more passionate and rowdy crowd. Then again, sports aren't a hipster thing.
author: David H.

description:
Terrible!  STAY AWAY!

We had been to this place before and were disappointed by the mediocre food, weak and overpriced drinks, loud and cheesy atmosphere and disgusting restrooms so had no intention of going back. But last Sunday night we are on our way to dinner and walked in front of this place. There is a big sign that says: " Sunday special: 2 for one drinks". It sounded like a good deal and we decide to go in and have a drink there before dinner. We sit at the bar and when the bartender finally arrives I say: Hi, we want to try the Sunday special". The bartender nods in agreement. We order our drinks and when they arrive, since we don't have much time I ask for the check. Bartender comes back and much to our surprise, we are billed for the full price of two drinks! I ask what happened to the Sunday special and he says: "That doesn't include this drink"!!!! I remind him that I specifically mentioned the Sunday special and he should have said something if these drinks were not included. He just says" That's the deal man"! I'm thinking we are out to have a good time and it's not worth getting upset. I sign the bill but I also ask for his name. His reply:' My name is kiss my a... Get the f... out of here!" I was shocked but I am with a guest and do not want to make a scene. I go to the other side of the bar and ask another employee for the manager. The bartender rushes over and yells: 'I am the f,,,ing manager. Get the f.. out of here man".
The guy obviously has serious psychological issues and I was not about to get into feast fight with a crazy guy. We leave, having barely touched our expensive drinks and guess what: I later see he actually has charged my credit card for those drinks that we had to leave untouched!!
Well, I regret I fell for the "Special" sign and walked into that dump place to begin with. I obviously will never go back and recommend you also stay away if you want to save your money, time and nerves. 
A business that hires people like this does not deserve to be around.
author: E B.

description:
Great beers on tap and seriously good pub food. 

I got some sort of pork sandwich that came with a little salad. Craig got a shepherds pie. That is what I should have ordered instead. Holy Tacos, it was delicious!

If I was in the area more often I could see this being a regular spot for me to kick it.
author: Loli L.

description:
They have fantastic pub grub. I love coming here with big groups. 

It gets PACKED with bodies and it can take a while to get drinks.
author: Jordan P.

description:
Looking for a place to watch the game on a monday night, me and a few others decided to head over to the pheonix for some food and drinks. 

The breakdown:

-The food was decently priced and was good for your standard Irish fare. Points for the soda bread, and the lamb stew was phenomenal- perfectly cooked and seasoned. Not to mention that the meatloaf came with a healthy slice of irish bacon, and really? When is bacon ever bad? That's right, never. 

- They had a very extensive beer collection of varying tastes and price range which is favorable.

-Service was terrible. Had our waitress not ignored us, continually given us poor and snarky attitude, or taken our plates away from beneath us AS WE WERE EATING, this place may have deserved a couple more stars. However, the combination of poor service and poorer damage control (in our attempt to try and apologize after our meal our waitress snapped at us and stalked away leaving us to wait close to an hour for any sort of attention) leaves me to say that this place has horrendous service for either a bar or resturant. 

It's a pity that this establishment has chosen to employ people who act cold and misanthropic to thier customers because we will most definately not advocate this place to anyone.
author: Melanie G.

description:
Sad to say I kinda hated it.  We were in the neighborhood looking for a new place to grab a bite during happy hour and checked The Phoenix Bar out due to the pretty good yelp ratings.

We checked out the happy hour specials and ordered the chicken wings, the chicken fingers and the artichoke dip.  

Chicken Wings: Good, spicy but very heavily breaded. If you don't like breading you won't like the wings. They were decent though.  Not Wing Wings quality but decent.

Chicken Fingers: Oh, how horrible.  They were about 1/4 inch thin like someone had flattened them with a steamroller and had the worst breading on them.  And they were bordering on burnt.  It reminded me of when we used to have chicken strips in high school lunch...but 10x worse.  Unfortunately we were starving and ate them anyway.  Our stomachs were not to happy with that choice later.

Artichoke Dip: Alright, nothing fancy. They served it with somewhat state chips.

On a positive note the bartender was very nice.  The place was really loud.
author: Kimberly W.

description:
Staff that are down-to-earth and very accomodating. Very casual and friendly vibe throughout the place. And plenty of real Irish people with pints in the place too. It's got be good, if the Irish dig it! The food is excellent too. Try the tato-skins and macaroni and cheese. High quality comfort food, to say the least. Also, if you're feeling very adventurous - try the Guinness Pudding - I actually kinda liked it. 

I've run into many an (ok - I admit - just one) Obie here, and have had nothing but good food and times at this cute Irish pub. If you want a laid-back drinking night with friends in the Mission - I recommend downing a few here, before heading on your way. Or, not heading on your way - if the few work.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Phoenix saved me from an awful dinner at Herbivore.

After Albert W. tricked me into eating some noodles-gone-wrong at Herbivore, we rushed to Phoenix for some drinks and some non-vegetarian fat laden chicken wings.  Ahhhh - MUCH better. 

Where can you have great pub food, access to a big selection of booze, friendly staff, and simultaneously hear Bjork over the sound system and a table full of drunk gals singing at the top of their lungs in Spanish?  Phoenix that's where.
author: Amy C.

description:
Hmmmm. Phoenix Bar is one of those places that would be so much better if their staff was just a bit more on the ball.

When I went, I was actually there for a large Deaf event. When I arrived (early) the staff had no idea what I was talking about, and wound up just anxiously placing me in the far back corner of the restaurant. After that, the staff disappeared for a very long time until I managed to flag someone down. After that, any question, drink order, food order, or request I had was dealt with like the greatest of impositions. 

I once again checked about if they were sure of the location, and once again asked around if the Servers were aware of the impending event. No one had a clue. Soon the bar was packed with well over 30+ Deaf people, completely overwhelming the restaurant and staff. I also checked with the coordinator of the event, and he swore he informed, warned, and planned with the Phoenix Bar many times over. Sloppy communication on the part of the bar.

The food? It was fine. Inexpensive pub food that pars well with most beers and mixed drinks. It was actually decent enough that I'd be willing to eat here again. Sadly the service would spook me.
author: Adam G.

description:
We were slated to meet up with several of my boyfriend's friends at this well known bar for locals, so despite the rain dampening our hair and splashing our feet, we made it in one piece.

Except, in that arriving late to meet a group of friends and not being able to find a place to sit among a table of people already packed sardines.  This applies to movie theaters and anything that involves first-come seating etiquette.  This place was packed.

There was no room at the counter.  Almost all of the tables and stools had been taken and to make it worse, the large group of young twenty-somethings blonde co-eds had a bunch of guys sporting shirts with vertical stripes.  Well, that just  challenged my previous post on Guys in Vertical Stripes.  Hah!

I ordered a Midori since I was not in a flirty mood (that would have commanded a vodka rocks) and had my honey to stabilize me once I start slipping.  For $6, I got a cup the size of a standard styrofoam cup filled to the brim with ice and a bunch of sweetened syrup and barely any Midori other than the splash to give it the traditional honeydew green tint.  I drank it within 5 minutes.

So, in reflection, a good place to hang out and get some food and beer with a group of friends, but I'm definitely not ordering a Midori here again.  The waitstaff are attentive though, and was on every order, even with the large tables of people and teeny boppers flooding the other side of the room.

I respect that.  And having to deal with guys in vertical shorts and crew cuts.
author: Miika M.

description:
I visited this place twice in two weeks to watch my hometown hockey team's games without leaving the Mission. For that, I will recommend it. Also, our server, who is cute and blonde and tiny, was absolutely terrific - had her both times. The drinks are a little pricy for an Irish pub. $8 house red - watch out. I drank a couple before I found out how much they cost.

Didn't try the food.
author: Malloreigh M.

description: This bar has surprisingly good food.  It also has plenty of beer and booze for those days that you need a little sweet release.  So far I've had the mac-n-cheese, shepherds pie, a couple of breakfast scrambles, and no fewer than twenty beers.  All very good!  I plan to try the burger next.  You don't maintain a figure like mine by eating salads.
author: Don S.

description: If I need to grab a bite to eat and want to watch the Sharks play hockey, this pub is right around the corner from me.  Have never had a problem with the food, the burgers are great and come with garlic fries.
author: T G.

description:
I'm...torn.  On the one hand, they HAVE margaritas.  On the other hand, their margaritas taste like Kool-Aid.

Of course, you might be thinking to yourself, "Why would someone order a margarita at an Irish bar anyway?"  Valid question.  The answer, my friend, is Cinco de Mayo.  The answer is also "The Mission," if the question were "Why does an Irish bar serve margaritas at all?"

Nevertheless, stick to the brews (good, if a bit pricey) and the snacks (yum, though be sure to ask for your sliders medium rare).
author: Jillian Y.

description:
This World Cup mania is a kick, no?

I had no idea so many of my friends were soccer fans. What, you say? People are just looking for a patriotic excuse to drink heavily at 7 am on a weekday? 

I can get behind that. If we can get up at dawn on the third Sunday of May each year to celebrate San Francisco being awesome, we certainly can mosey over to the nearest sports bar/Irish pub to pretend to be soccer fans every four years. 

The Phoenix has been awesome about showing the early games, and has been understandably standing-room-only when the US plays. They make strong and spicy bloody marys, and the crowd is loud and exuberant.

Two minor complaints:
1) The bar staff seemed overwhelmed during yesterday's game. While I can understand it being early, two bartenders and a busser for a packed bar just doesn't make sense. People were visibly refraining from ordering more drinks so that the bar staff wouldn't be so overloaded. 
2) Look, I am all for everyone and their mother bandwagonning onto my childhood love. I did it myself back when I was a crazed fan in '94 and mildly stalked Tab Ramos for an autograph. But if you're going to cheer on the WC, at least learn the rules. If a player is offside, the goal doesn't count. And it's offside, not offsides. And every time someone touches/runs into someone else, that is not an automatic yellow card. 

And because as of mid-July this review will be otherwise irrelevant until 2014, the Phoenix is a quality bar even when the game's not on. Cheap drinks, Guinness on tap, and showing movies like Saving Private Ryan and Super Troopers on TV? Now that's something you can always get behind.
author: Devon S.

description: Phoenix is an irish pub slash sports bar with a long bar counter and a good amount of seating. It was crowded enough but not so much you couldn't get a drink. We snatched a small table with high seats right by the window - score! It's super casual and i could see myself sitting here enjoying a pint if it weren't so loud. I found my friends and i speaking directly into each others ears to have a conversation. Thumbs up for offering a lot of different beers and having a full bar. Unfortunately they ran out of the Absolut and Acai drink on their $5 chalk drawn menu behind the bar. The bartender instead suggested a sweet peach schnapps drink for my friend that went down easily. It looks like a local favorite although i don't know if i'd purposely come here again.
author: Samantha L.

description:
This place is pretty awesome for happy hour and I look forward to watching some games there this season (football and basketball, lord willing). The specials are M-F 4-7 and are listed on the website. 

Atmosphere (4): On Valencia, which seems to really change the culture of the establishment. It was mostly very clean, although at some point there was this awful dirty water/cleaning fluid type of smell that was really gross, but I think it must have been from somewhere in the back because it went away when they closed a door. Plenty of space, very comfy. 

Clientele (4): didn't really talk to anyone, but it was a pretty cool, mixed crowd. There was a father-son looking duo having food next us and a group of skaters eating, drinking and watching their footie they just filmed. Pretty chill overall. 

Food (4): Came back a second time and tried some of the food. The chicken wings ($4) were actually pretty good. Remember this was bar good, so it really hit the spot. We got some fries ($1), which I did not try, but for the price, how bad could they have been. Finally, we had the quesadilla ($3), which, I know was a bad choice, but was not that bad considering our expectations. 

Drinks (4): The variety is just awesome. Great beers on tap. Local and domestic, craft and corporate. All different types to choose from. Full bar and everything. Loved my Speakeasy. The wifey's marg was very, very strong and decently flavored. It was also huge (in a pint glass). Our friends really enjoyed the Racer 5 and Lagunitas. I had a few rum and cokes though that were a little light on the rum. 

Value (4): I had a $4 20 oz pint. My wife had a $5 marg and very big. They have specials on a number of food items as well as other drinks listed on their website. 

Service (4): the waitress didn't leave us hanging much, but did disappear for a brief period. It was fine though, she came back. 

Grade: 4.0

Wifey's two-cents: "Fun place, but it's too loud and crowded (Giants game.)"
author: Miguel V.

description: Walking into a bar can be intimidating. But that's not an issue here at all. Just cruise on in and you'll find yourself amidst a crowd of rowdy sport speculators with one beer in hand and the hand in a fist pumping the air. Aside from all the energy in the room, it's a pretty laid-back, no-frills type of bar. There are flat screens in every direction and even the standing room is cozy. Cozy also means tolerating the sticky floors and tables though. The servers make waiting for a tip real obvious, but pretty speedy service overall. But if there's one thing you should know about this place, like any Irish pub, it is LOUD in here.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Foods good and I've recommend it to many people. The bartenders are good to great, despite the bar manager, who is terrible and does not know what it means to properly manage such a busy establishment. I would give it 5 stars otherwise, but can't, due to the horrible management.
author: Dae H.

description:
$10 turkey burger done right. Though their fries suck, their complementary bread makes up for it.

Come to Phoenix Bar with great company for great eats and drinks.
author: Bruce M.

description:
Great selection of beer (they even have a draft cider!) served in large glasses. Servers are friendly but not over-friendly. Atmosphere here is great, filled with vintage Guinness posters and white holiday lights, lots of knick knacks and plenty of seating. Chicken wings are crunchy and perfectly spicy, and the blue cheese dip is great. Fries are also great, I can't wait to try more from their menu! 

PLUS only a short walk from 16th & mission Bart. I'll be back.
author: Alyssa G.

description:
GO EARLY or you will not find a seat. 

We were luck to find one in the back of the restaurant on a Friday night around 8. The place was packed and rightfully so. Great beers on tap and off the chart chicken wings. It is a very loud bar so don't go if you want to talk
author: Casandra R.

description:
Cheap food and they have Lagunitas on tap! This place is LEGIT! 

Not only do they have my favorite beer on tap, they also have a really good happy hour menu.  I love me some happy hour wings, after having the crapiest wings I have ever had at a wing stop last week, i needed a fixin on some good wings and the Pheonix pulled through.

This bar has a great atmosphere and everyone there seemed to be cool, with lots of seating this is a great spot in the mission to grab some drinks and  grub with your friends. Also the bartenders are pretty hot!
author: Skyler W.

description: A fun pub experience. I love dark beers, and stouts, and this pub had plenty of both. Great bar food, friendly environment. The serving staff was helpful and quite easy on the eyes as well. Good place to kick back after work and catch up with some friends.
author: Shan S.

description:
This is by far my favorite bar.  Prove me wrong...

I've been here a couple of times with friends for Happy Hour and not-so-happy hours.  

The Dollar Garlic Fries are not so garlic-y, but what do you expect. They're crisp fries. How about that? Call it dollar fries.

Spicy wings hit you before you even bite it. Can we say YUM?  No?  Try it.

Beers on tap are good. Wide selection.

Service - hit-or-miss. I say figure out what you want, order it all in one go, and then don't expect the waitress to be back for a long, long time.  If you want more interaction, stay in the front. If you want to be with friends for the most part, stick to the back. I wouldn't suggest either table next to the bathroom though...its a little TOO close to the bathroom...

Cheap Food, good atmosphere.  Worth a go or two...or multiple.  Just go.
author: Lily W.

description: We came all the way from Sacramento to watch the game on Sunday (YAY, 49ers!!) and picked The Phoenix randomly. Happy accident! Packed? Yes! But service was very good and faster than I expected for how packed it was. Crowd was rowdy, but why not?? Honestly cannot recall decor due to the fact of the sea of people, but I do rememeber bathrooms being pretty clean for all the use. I may never end up here again, but would absolutely recommend it.
author: Kimberley L.

description: Too many telles.  Too many people.  Too long a wait.  Too many other better places to go.
author: David S.

description: No AC....but then again you rarely really need it in the city....Pub food + Good Beers = Fun times!
author: B P.

description: The food here is great. I recommend the Irish classics: both the meatloaf (packed with flavor, topped with Guinness gravy and Iris bacon, served off course with mashed potatoes and veggies) and the shepard's pie (with delicious braised beef) are outstanding. Filled with flavor! And the soda bread is like all good things baked together: salt, sweet, darkness and light, denseness without feeling heavy. Their beer list is stocked with the classics, not too many surprises. Go for the food, stick around for a beer, and kick back for a good pub night. If they only had a pub quiz night, it would be my perfect bar! But I'll settle for the perfect pub dinner and pint. :-)
author: Erin H.

description: I am a fan of this place. It's a great place for some Irish grub and a morning Irish coffee. I'll come here in the late morning or late evening- either time, this place is always a hit. I never drive and park here, I always take Bart. If you happen to love sports and want to hit the city for an afternoon or night game, go here!
author: Linnea H.

description:
Despite all the mixed reviews, I really like The Phoenix. Yes, it does get super crowded and so busy when there is a game on, but that is to be expected. Happy Hour is between 4pm to 7pm on Mondays-Fridays, and it does get busy, but they have really good deals.  

I have been here for brunch, and it was super crowded. Service was borderline non-existent but the food was good. I have tried the Dolores Omelet and the Phoenix Scramble and was happy with both. 

I have also been here for dinner and have had the Shepherd's Pie, the Farmhouse Vegetable Pie, and the Braised Lamb Shank. Everything was above average and reasonably priced.
author: Joy L.

description:
Ummmm.... I'm glad we left this place after only 1 drink.  It was really crowded and the positioning of the tables left people to stand awkwardly in the aisles, but not really conducive to talking and mingling.  

I liked the view of the kitchen though.  Watching them make food was fun.  

I guess maybe this is more of a food place.  And I probably would have enjoyed it more if I wasn't constantly shifting around, trying to not get bumped into.  The bus people were also constantly reaching over us or asking us to move to get to things they needed.  It was just awkward overall.
author: Kara S.

description:
This place has a cool vibe and good food but the service could be better. They just seem to be under staffed that makes you wait for a long time but when the food does come it is pretty good.

The beer selection is good and prices could be lower but won't rip you off nearly as bad as other places. They have a couple of tvs that you can watch sports on ample seating. I have been to better Irish pubs but this place is good enough to continue going there.
author: Kate D.

description:
The Phoenix Bar is my go-to spot in the Mission. Comfy, low-key, and with space for groups of all sizes, Phoenix is a reliable bet any day of the week.

With Speakeasy on tap and awesome bar food, Phoenix is a great place to grab a meal or midnight snack (their kitchen is now open till 1am!) My favorite: a side of mashed potatoes topped with melted cheese and green onions.

Chill staff, chill crowd - a good place to eat, drink and hang out for hours.
author: Valerie L.

description:
My new favorite fall bar!!! The shepperds pie was really good  and piping hot! I needed that because the door had to be open for minor construction reasons. Great selection of local brews on tap. I had a true pint and not a 16oz . my bill was under $20. very satisfied.
        
      Now the service! I'll keep it short and sweet. The Bartender was very friendly, warm smile and i truly felt i got personal attention.  Jessica gets  my vote for best lunchtime bartender in the mission. you just got check it out!!
author: Paul P.

description: I went here while bar hopping with some friends. They have a good selection of beers, it's not overly crowded the the music isn't too loud (don't get me wrong, it's a bar, the music is till loud, but you can at least hear your friends here). Those three things are pretty much exactly what I look for in a pub, I'll have to come back and see how their food stacks up.
author: Chris M.

description:
Yelp recently had a game night here in the back of the pub so I've only been there that once.  The interiors are actually fairly spacious with table and booth seating up front.  In the back there is plenty of room to rearrange the tables and pack 20+ people in.  I had a beer and calamari frites, the calamari was very good and came with a spritz of lemon already on it---be sure to ask for no lemon if that's not your thing.  I saw that they had shepherds pie on the menu, something I want to try later.

Times visited: 1
author: Amy L.

description:
Living in a city, there are places that neighbor many of my frequent haunts that I've never been, and people that may very well live on my block that I never see. We circle around each other ignorant of our shared orbits, inhabiting the same areas and never muster a hello. 

Apparently, some of these folks wander to the Phoenix to wet their lips, bright screens showing sports lighting up their faces as they down cold Sierras and engage in mate fishing rituals to top forty tunes. It's the Marina in the Mission. Not my scene, but I can see that for some, they've got the makings of a solid neighborhood watering hole. Extra star for the expediency of the bar staff.
author: Ligaya T.

description:
My first time here.  The server/bartender was very nice and quick.
I had to try their Shepherd's Pie.  It was not very good.  The flavor was halfway decent but it had the consistency of canned dog food with virtually no vegetables.  A far cry from the Shepherd's Pie at the Irish Bank (which is also cheaper).  I would not recommend this dish unless you just happen to be a dog, but then again, Alpo and Purina smell pretty good.  Stick with the soda bread which was quite good and a cold cider or beer.
author: Scott A.

description:
I have always liked this place for the chill music and good food and beer. But today was the worst experience I've ever had in a bar. I was sitting at the bar with a friend and we had already noticed that the bartender was by herself on a busy day. We came to watch the niners game and the bar was full. But this bartender was off, not all there, possibly drunk. I had ordered 2 beers originally and the tab was given to me with 2 jameson shots on the bill I never ordered, but a friend drank them so I decided whatever since I knew them and we paid for it. Then I ordered garlic fries and prepaid for them so we could stay at the bar to watch the game. 
Then some girl down the bar and the bartender start fighting about something and the girl gets so angry she throws her beer at the bartender and gets kicked out. 
The bartender then accuses us of being friends with that girl who I'd never seen before. Then she tells me I owe her for the beers I drank earlier to which I reply that I already paid for them. She gives me a funny look and walks away. I then notice that from the scuffle she had with the girl that there was glass in my fries so I said hey I know this isn't your fault but I barely touched these and there's glass in them. She replaces them but then brings me a bill for them after I had already paid for first order with glass. When I complain that she had also forgot to bring me my soda and side sauce for the fries, she tells me that I owe her for my beer and fries. I'm like lady are you drunk? We already had this discussion and I already paid. 
Then she starts ranting and accuses my friend of never paying for her drinks too! When we start arguing with her some dude at the end of the bar starts screaming at us calling us names and telling us to get out. My friend gets offended and starts yelling back, which resulted in us getting kicked out while the bartender was just smiling in the corner. If you're gona be a bartender on a busy day- then remember what your customers order and don't accuse anyone of anything unless you know for sure. And don't drink on the job!
author: Lu C.

description:
A mingled crew of honey-weathered marauders sprinkled an Irish melody with bliss and standard. A piece of fine tuned Jameson and drum lined clover came to mix.

A forgotten french fry from a strange fellow. A she queen of epic proportions. 55 bottles of beer on the wall, were gone the first hour.. we stopped counting after that. 

Lesbians who weren't lesbians but loved every lesbian. Men kissing men, like long lost brothers separated for too long after a thousand happy hour tours. 

The Hansel and Gretel bread crumbs left on the cold steel steps of a transit that sleeps after midnight; she promises to know our name for only so long. 

Potatoes grown on a sidewalk, the lipstick mark kissed on her beer. A naked bottle of red stripe, the foamy mouth finish. Birthday wishes for a runaway angel who cabs her way in the crevices of modernity, on time, yet always late....she's right where she needs to be.

Marketing impostors, super cat hero's. Whisper in my ear to complete your night. Protective love makers, never share their secret.

I touched her cheek, she fell in my eyes, and sat on the swing in my heart. All in a matter of time...
author: Christopher L.

description: It has become my place to hang out! the bartenders are friendly the whole vibe of the pub is good. I also like the  background music . Oh I love how they serve all the beers in a cold glass! makes my day :)
author: Parikshit T.

description:
WORST FOOD EVER.
Holy cow. how do you mess up bar food? its so easy! HOW HOW HOW do you mess up chicken fingers? they were paper thin, and over fried... almost like if you deep fried beef jerky. and the quesidillas were just soggy, sloppy mess. 
The only reason they got the extra star was the beer selection was decent.
But seriously? if you can't figure out chicken fingers... you shouldn't have food.
author: Paige R.

description:
Arguably the best DYL since Kristina took the helm; the Phoenix proves to be one hott/happening place. Funny thing is that I was going to last minute "sounds cool" the event. I'm so glad I did not flake out, as I have been feeling really really exhausted the first week of January. If you have never worked in the Insurance Industry (Health Insurance particularly), you don't know how insane January is. People (including me) NEVER read their benefits pack from the HR. They always insist on a play by play by calling their insurance company. So in January, there is no scheduled PTO for any employee (except for Dr. appts.). 

The place is pretty roomy w/ a bar on your left side, booths to the right when you enter. A couple of big screen TV's hang over the bar. In the back, there are more tables and the bathrooms, more TV's. When we went, there was a Monster Truck Rally playing. Awesome. 

Huge plus's: 
1. Bartenders were very attractive. Adam makes a very good point that calling a girl "hot" makes her seem unattainable, but very attractive is still in the ballpark. Also "hot" is so 2000 late. 
2. They take plastic (maybe this is also a minus as I have signed away an entire paycheck before). 
3. The food!!! I thought I knew what good bar food was until I ate at The Phoenix. I was moded! I just had the Irish Nachos and the buffalo wings but they were amazing. Buffalo wings were huge, moist, gooey, w/ enough heat. Irish nachos were basically steak fries covered in cheese, guac, sour cream, black beans; ohh so good. 
4. I got there too late but I heard that the apps are 1/2 off during happy hour. Must make it back there to confirm. 

The only problem that night was when a drunk asshole "demanded" we sit down as we were blocking his view of the Golden State game. Amazing how entitled he felt. Apparently he thought there was enough seating there to accommodate everyone in the place.
author: Angelo F.

description:
Perfectly adequate.

Can't say I've ever had anything really out of this world here (although I do like their Buffalo Wings), but definitely haven't ever had anything bad either.

A nice break from the overbearing hipster-ness of the rest of this neighborhood.
author: Andrew L.

description: This place is pretty cool.  You gotta love an internet jukebox where the people get to choose what you hear.  I didn't order anything to drink so I can't rate those.  The atmosphere here seemed pretty decent and low key.  There's a lot more light in here than in some other bars in the Mission.  So if there's a cutie you see, go and say hello because you can't blame it on the lighting like in the other places (but you can blame it on the alcohol if you make a poor choice).
author: Amy J.

description:
I came here for DYL and what a place.  Food, beer, full bar and inappropriate groping from fellow yelpers ensued.  Hi-jinx followed and everybody had fun tonight (nobody "wang chung'd" however, except for Merrilee T which I unfortunately missed)

Over all it was a good time at a good bar.
author: Theron L.

description:
It was a Sunday afternoon and they didn't seem that busy, but we still had to wait much too long for mediocre food.
 Our waitress seemed unconcerned that our food was taking too long to get to us. 
 The corned-beef sandwich I got was greasy and lacking flavor.

 All around, pretty dissappointing.
author: Nathan P.

description:
I've been totally into the idea of bars opening early for the World Cup, so this Saturday morning, we dragged ourselves out of bed and headed over to The Phoenix for breakfast and soccer.  There were only 5 or 6 people there, but to be fair, it was 7:30am.  The bartender/server was perky and friendly (to be fair, it was 7:30, so her smile counts double).  I started my morning off with a stellar bloody mary-- just the right amount of spice, citrus and salad components (this one came with pickled string beans and olives).  We shared some irish bacon benedict-type thing that had potato patties instead of the more traditional english muffin-- GENIUS!  It was really delicious.  Filling, for sure, but great for splitting with a sleepy boyfriend.  $25 and a relatively uneventful soccer game later, we went home for a nap.

Great breakfast place, awesome bloody maries, friendly staff and cool pub atmosphere.  AND they were dog-friendly, even in the dining space!
author: Kristin P.

description:
I love Irish bars.  Of course, the Irish bars here in the states are nothing compared to Irish bars... well, practically anywhere else but still, I liked the Phoenix.  
Juke Box that can play Deadmau5, Audioslave, and Al Green-hands down, this rocks.
Food--pretty dayam good and fairly priced.
Enough of a choice when it comes to beer.  Beer is beer.
Long bar, booths, tables in the back and whatever, it's a bar in the Mission--what do you want exactly?  Perfection?
author: Katherine P.

description:
So frickin good!

Really good Irish comfort food and a great beer selection.
The staff is not the snotty hipster type, like a lot of places in the Mission, which helps.

You get your food pretty quick and there is a good amount of seating.

Plus, they have a great happy hour until 7pm durring the week, which is perfect the take advantage of after work.
author: Brett P.

description:
I went to enjoy the Sheperds' Pie, recommended by a local friend, and I'm glad I went. The pie was as good as my friend said, and the beer I enjoyed was great, too.  

The place sure got noisy when the Giant's game and hockey were up on the two televisions on either side of the bar, but, that's what people come here for, I guess.
author: Eric A.

description:
I love me some biscuits and gravy.
And some irish bacon, even if it looks like you're eating flesh and more specifically ears of an animal.
mmm bacon.
This place has breakfast/brunch and a great selection of beerz. 
mmm beerz.
I have mad respect for any place with bacon and beerz and does it well.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Awesome happy hour!!  Cheap, well poured drinks and delicious food! The chicken wings and fries are perfect.  I want to come back and try entrees from their menu.  My sister had a peach lemonade tea with vodka...or something like that, and it was delicious.   This was during the summer and it was so refreshing.  

This place is very comfortable and there is plenty of seating!  

Service is fast and the bartenders are very friendly.
author: Lesliegh H.

description: Nothing to complain about here, I love a good Irish pub. Boddingtons on draught for 5 bucks, along with Smithycks and some other good ones too. The bartenders were hot and efficient. Another plus was the AWESOME show on one of the TVs that was some sort of martial arts shit. basically a bunch of crazy karate shit was happening while we were getting hammered. always fun.
author: Samir K.

description:
I've been frequenting the Phoenix for a long time, on many various occasions and with many various companions.  I believe in the Phoenix.  But I am disappointed in a few recent experiences with the service there that make me wonder whether they're taking a lesson from other less worthy neighbors who shall remain nameless.

First question: have you forgotten that you advertise yourself as a sports bar?  If that's your target audience, it shouldn't be a surprise when patrons come in and ask if one of the many TVs can be switched to show the other big game that's playing.  It's not like I'm asking you to change it to Maury or something.

Second, in keeping with the first: is it possible to be polite when asked such a question?  If for some reason you are unable to change a screen, could you say, "I'm sorry, we can't do that right now," instead of "Look, what's on is on, okay?"

Bottom line for me is that I understand it can be difficult to serve in a busy pub with lots of guests wanting different things.  But there's always time for courtesy, says Emerson, and I believe him.
author: Ciara W.

description:
Cheers to the rockstar bartenders who handled St. Patty's day like pros.  
Despite the sea of green drunkards hovering around the bar, I didn't have to wait more than a couple minutes for a drink.  And you know what?  They were smiling and friendly to boot.

Jeers to the obnoxious girl in the back who shouted (read: slurred loudly) "party foul!" every time someone walked by.  Go back to the frat house or go home.
author: Christine M.

description: Came on a late afternoon, good beer choices (local beers!!), really good music (more indie-ish), and amazing prices for happy hour. 2 dollars for a whole plate of garlic fries, what?! Lots of seating and tables so good for groups, nice and cozy. Fun to people watch, people from all kinds of crowds come here... :)
author: Ann P.

description:
This place rocks in an I-had-to-call-in-sick-and-blamed-it-on-bad-sushi kind of way...

But it wasn't the sushi. They don't even have sushi. What they do have is wow yummy drinks and super cold beer. The night I was in I found my way to a $6 special featuring one domestic beer and one shot of bourbon. I'm Texan. That was amazing. 

Great service, cool atmosphere, perfect for a divey kind of night.
author: Kay T.

description: Your typical dive bar in the Mission.  Prices are fair.
author: Laurence H.

description:
Whether it's 11 AM or 11 PM this is one of my favorite hangouts in the city.  Great food and excellent drink selections. Good place to watch a game.

Oh and just a side tip, if you're here for a sandwich and they ask if you want fries or chips, get the chips.  mmmmmm....


Oh and it has good public transportation access including street parking and 16th st bart.
author: Britt B.

description:
Good fish and chips.  Yummy "Irish Nachos".  Too many distracting TVs.  

I give an extra star for their new late night kitchen hours:  Open until 1a.m.!
author: Napoleon R.

description: Soda bread was a great complimentary starter. Fish and Chips were very crispy and the fries tasted like a hand cut potato, but with a shoe string size similar to In and Out. The beer was ice cold and Anchor Steam was on tap but that's nearly ubiquitous in The City. Solid food, good service. Seating is a little tight which is a fun thing in my opinion, but some people don't like sitting that close to strangers :)
author: John K.

description:
My friend and I were originally drawn here for the happy hour food and $5 hop stoopid beers- what a steal for an 8% alc. beer! Also, the tv set up makes for the best place in the mission to watch a game, which is why we have been back several times but begrudgingly. 

The main issue is the service sucks, one time we sat at the bar waiting forever to have someone look at us and offer us a menu. We finally got service and were enjoying our beers when we saw two different bartenders taste the drinks they made with their mouths and then serve them to customers. My advice is don't order mixed drinks here. 

They also recently made the hop stoopids $6 but didn't change the price on the menu. They can charge whatever they want for beers and $1 increase isn't that much. But you've got to change it on the menu or not be surprised when customers complain when they get the check after multiple rounds have been ordered. 

I'm not opposed to going here since its as close as the Mission gets to a sports bar but it's no longer at the top of my list.
author: Ben G.

description:
Despite the fantastic number of TVs in this place, I don't find it very conducive to sports watching. Maybe that doesn't matter to you. Maybe you like to go to a sports-looking pub place with a bunch of friends and just talk, loudly, and flirt and giggle. Great, you found your place. 

When I've been here, I've either had to leave without ordering because there was nowhere to sit, or I've found a seat and soon had to deal with some drunk dude either slobbering and leaning my way (to the right) or trying to pick me up (to the left) or it's been almost completely empty and I've been made to feel like a freak for wanting to watch whatever sporting event was on (example: Giants v Reds, still tied in the 12th inning and the bartender looks up and says "They're still playing? What a boring game!")
author: Will R.

description:
This isn't a bar it's a public house. It's kind of weird that while people are getting crocked on imperial pints there are kids running around and Valencia corridor yuppies coming in for dinner.

I've never had the food but I've seen it and IMO it isn't very appetizing looking, very heavy. This place has been popping up recently on my rotation. They have a decent selection of beer, a full bar, and pretty bartenders.

The jury's out on if this is going to become a regular hang out for me.
author: Manny F.

description:
The plan was hatched two months ago: Irish DJ John O'Callaghan was coming back to San Francisco, and I wanted to have an Irish brunch the following morning to celebrate. The Phoenix was my destination.

My eyes (and stomach) quickly decided on the whole wheat pancakes with a banger on the side. If you're like me and have no idea what that is, it's a massive sausage. Delicious, in fact. So were those pancakes, topped with an unexpected medley of strawberries and bananas. It was served without the warm honey listed on the menu, yet another casualty of an outdated menu (see my first yelp). However, my friendly waitress got me some anyway. It was worth asking.

John O'Callaghan, if you happen to be reading this, trust me on this one, next time you are in SF (soon!), hit up The Phoenix for a taste of home. I don't think you'll be disappointed. I certainly wasn't.
author: Jason B.

description: We went there after a reading at Borderlands with a group of writers. The appetizers were yummy, but really varies on portions on what item you get. The veggie pot pie was soooo good, I'm still full after a day out from being there! The Magners Cider was frosty and soothing. They had the Giant's game on as well as the Stanley Cup finals, so it was crowded and noisy to the point of people looking at you in anticipation of you leaving half way through your meal. The service was good, considering the volume. I think going there for a snack and a frosty beverage would be a better option than a full meal next time.
author: Spring S.

description:
On Sunday night, April 29, 2012 I ordered a cosmo. It tasted really bad. I could tell it had too much triple sec and cranberry.  I had my friend taste it. She agreed.
The bartender was young so I figured she probably didn't know any better. I asked her  if she wouldn't mind changing my drink by using less triple sec and cran so that it was pink instead of red. She got very defensive, insisted it was pink, that the drinks were measured so it was made correctly, blah, blah, blah. I ended up telling her to never mind  because I didn't want to listen to her go on and on. Don't give me attitude, just give me a new drink!  Sheesh!
My friend and I have worked in the restaurant industry for years and couldn't believe this girl. She has a lot to learn. I hope management speaks with her about how to make a drink and treat customers. 
A shame really, I've been here a number of times and always enjoyed the place before this.
author: Red H.

description:
Great pub, more American than Irish, but a GREAT time nonetheless.

Bartenders are friendly but in a bit of a rush, so don't dally when ordering.

Gets busy, but not overpacked.

Can watch a game here.

Only bar I've found in SF that has Macallan Amber, which is a scotch addict's breakfast.
author: Dmytro A.

description: Best bar to make a pee stop in while walking to another bar. There are no ladies, which means there are no lines!
author: Rebecca P.

description: I'm giving it a 4 just because we haven't been here enough to give it a 5/5. But for what it's worth- good beer on tap, friendly bartenders, good crowd and surprisingly great food.
author: Kelly G.

description:
The Phoenix is one of  my personal favorite bars in the Mission. It's pretty big, well laid-out, has tons of seating and tables, a nice full bar with tons of beers on tap and has pretty good food. My absolute favorite here is the pot roast - always super tender, flavorful with well steamed veggies and a nice gravy that's neither too oily or salty. Yummerz! Also, the pints are $5 during happy hour (4-7) - even for a pint of Leffe :p

My main gripe with this place is how overwhelming/distracting all of the flat screen TVs plastered on every wall can be when several games are going on. That and the service can be kind of... lackadaisical.
author: Kristina A.

description:
Grace place to have a beer and watch a sporting event. Had a few (too many) drinks here and caught a Lakers game. SCORE!

Will have to come back for some bar food and more drinks. 

World Cup?! Didn't even try. I'm sure it was NUTS. Lesser known places were slammed packed. 

Ill.be.back!
author: Art A.

description:
I've gone here many times for drinks and it is a great bar with a good selection of beers and some TVs to distract you with sports. For that alone I would give it 3-4 stars. 

But I finally went there for food. I was craving Mexican food that day (yes, I realize the irony of going to an Irish pub in the Mission with that craving) so I ordered the nachos which came with potato wedges instead of tortilla chips. This was actually a pretty damn good combo. What else would you expect from lots of carbs and fat? :) 4 stars it is!
author: Anand M.

description:
Me and the Celtics like to meet up here during playoff season.  We have a deal where I will promise to gain as much weight as possible eating $1 garlic fries and $3 potato nachos, if they will promise to make Kobe Bryant suffer on national television.  

Best happy hour snacks in the city.  Hands down.  Have you ever had Irish potato nachos?  I think they made them up, but whatever evil genius is behind them, I'd like to say wow.
