Despite all this, I liked the place and their food, and I suspect I had a fluke experience, so I give three stars.
author: Eric S.

description: I love this bar. I love it. The people are so friendly, the waitresses are helpful, and the drinks are affordable. I want to move to SF permanently just to I can hang out here more. This is the bar where I want everyone to know my name. The happy hour prices are great, the drinks are delicious if not a little bit weak, but the ambience is everything I want in a bar. It's definitely a great place to meet new people and hang out all night.
author: Maria Z.

description:
My burger was mediocre, my ice water tepid.... but the soda bread was incredible! I would come back here again only to eat their soda bread.

The ambiance,  seemed a little "under construction" - tools and construction equipment laying on the floor by our table, and I could barely squeeze myself through the bathroom stall door.
author: Rachel Q.

description: Great beer and atmosphere. Food is whatevs, its a pub so its not going to be great. Except for the shepard's pie, which was excellent. Three stars only because the service isn't great. Brought me the wrong beer. Twice. And I think she checked on us once. Still a solid spot to grab a beer and watch a game.
author: Nick G.

description:
cool spot. parking was a bitch, but i'm glad i came. it was packed on a friday night, but that is to be expected in the mission. it was still fairly easy to get drinks in a timely manner. and drink prices were very reasonable even at non-happy hour prices. they had plasma's everywhere and, apparently, good food(i wasn't hungry). the bartenders were hot and very precise. 

kezar will still be my spot, but i may head over here a couple times for some english football. -1 star to the douche that was upset because other people were blocking the tv. watch at home or stand up, dumbass...
author: Andrew T.

description: Great corned beef sandwich, and even greater bloody marys!
author: Peter R.

description:
They have Paulener on tap. Period If you know anything about German beer, you'll know what i'm talking about. If you don't, a small part of me inside cries and dies.

Seems like a good place to go for that hangover the morning for their Irish brunch and perhaps keep the party (or your pathetic life) going.
author: Eric O.

description:
I love me a good irish bar. This irish lass will do just about anything for good friends, cute boys and a delicious frosty beverage. This place had all of the above. 

Lost a star for the sole reason that I ordered a vodka soda and it was an embarrassment of a cocktail. Trying to stay on the drinking train I was already on I made a very serious mistake in ordering this. Stick to beer in this establishment.
author: Nancy B.

description:
All I need to say is baked mac-n-cheese.  I swear there was a bechamel sauce in there somewhere.

And the crispiest wings I've ever had.  So tart, so spicy, so gooooood!

Mister B had the pot roast which he thoroughly enjoyed and while I'm not a fan I thought it was good too.

I hope to try their brunch soon.
author: Aimee B.

description:
This would have been a five star if you hadn't gotten rid of my favourite beer. Bring back the Newcastle! Honestly telling me that you sell more Murphy's than Newkie? And then a double whammy, no more sides of black pudding at will! I used to be able to pop in and grab a small plate and a couple of pints but now it's only served at Sunday brunch. Going downhill, man...
Still come back for the beer and a good craic I suppose, even if it is a bloody Irish bar...

I'm updating this again. I agree that $5 a pint is nonsense, even if they are Imperial size. I'm over th black pudding, the Irish style is never as good as the Scottish stuff. Thanks to Jake for setting me right, so I'm only taking the star back off. Thinks its fair, not the kitchen's fault but don't feel like the staff are trying very hard and the food is overpriced and doesn't taste all that Irish. Soda bread is the best item there! Maybe this place is only good in the summer when all the 'tatty heuchers' are over here...
author: Shad M.

description: Absolutely the best Bar Food in the Mission.  The Chipotle Chicken sandwich is in a class of its own.  Good beers, friendly staff, and great place to watch sports---yep, sports!  In the Mission!
author: Andrew M.

description: While visiting SF, I came here on a Friday night specifically for their wings. Despite being packed, the bartender treated me great and I felt unrushed. The wings were awesome, beer selection great and the employees friendly.
author: Chris W.

description:
Fun fun packed Irish Pub and Restaurant.  

Booths, bar, tables, well lit place, lots of people eating and drinking.  I kinda felt like I was in the Inner Sunset but I wasn't.  It had that neighborhoody kinda feel about it.  Typical Irish pub and bar food.  From what I hear it's good.  I myself can only speak for the drinks which were averaged priced and strong.  

At 3pm on a Saturday every seat was taken.  Fun fun fun.  I really don't have much else to say about the place.  I had a good time, I don't remember much else.  I guess that itself should give you an idea of the place.

Update August 25, 2007
So I took a star away for last night's dinner there.  Foodwise: the fries and calamari were severely lacking in flavor, and my burger was average.  But on a brighter note, the mac and cheese was really pretty good.  What warrants to me the taken away star was the waitress though.  As nice as she was she wasn't very good.  We had to chase her down for anything, and she never checked on us, and when we asked her for something she took a really long time to get it to us!  

I'll stick to this as a place to drink, but maybe not to eat.
author: Denise B.

description: Super fast and friendly service by our server Ashley and great pub food on a Saturday night in SF!  After waiting 3 hours around the block at a Tapas bar without being seated on what we were told by the staff was a slow night, the Phoenix  Bar truly resurrected our dining experience. Pun intended! : )
author: Lauren L.

description:
had brunch here this morning and don't have much to rave about despite its positive reviews on yelp. first off, the service was awful. our server did not check in with us once. not sure if she just didn't like our table or what but i felt like i had to scream at her to flag her down just to get some more coffee.

it took about 45 min from the time we ordered to the time we got our food, which can seem like forever when you are starving.

i had the crab cake benny and was not impressed. the crab cakes seemed store bought and probably came out of the freezer a few minutes before they hit my plate. my friend got the steak and eggs. her steak was overcooked and the sauce on the steak was incredibly salty which made it almost inedible.

between the bad service and not so great food i don't see myself coming back any day soon.
author: Jae C.

description:
Drunk Irish guys, Juicy burgers, and a hot chick bartender. Go to this place!

I stopped into the Phoenix for a bite and a pint and was very impressed. I grabbed a seat at the bar an ordered a Phoenix burger. The bartender was super cute. I didn't catch her name but she had these amazing eyes that I could not get enough of. The burger was great! I could taste the Worcestershire and the meat was juicy as hell. I loved it. I am not a big fan of mayonnaise, but I tried it on the burger and my mouth felt like it was in heaven.
On a side note, I used the bathroom at this place and a couple Irish guys were yelling at each other and a fight almost started. It was the funniest thing I ever heard. One guy kept saying, "Want to have a go round wit me?" When two guys are about to get in a fight and they have Irish accents, it is fuckin' hilarious. I am a fan of the Phoenix for life cause of the bathroom incident and the burger and the super cute bartender with those eyes.
Yeah.
author: Eric B.

description: This is my favorite happy hour place in the city. They offer great deals on food ranging from $3-$5. The sweet tea vodkas, Irish nachos, and hot wings are my favorite! The service here is very friendly, which is always a plus :0)
author: Jenee Y.

description:
I went here twice: once for drinks and another time for brunch,

The brunch food was atrocious.  The food came out looking inedible and my friend had to send hers back because they messed up the order.   The bloody mary was fantastic though!  Pulls out a 3 star rating between the two.

For happy hour, the drinks were reasonable- we got 4 beers, onion rings and fries for $27.  The Happy Hour onion rings were only $1 and a huge bowl of fries were only $2.  Service was slipshod and it took a long while to flag down our server to ask for the check.  Between the great value and okay service, this gets 3 stars.

So 3 stars for brunch and 3 stars for happy hour.  This is the kind of place where you won't love everything but you will probably have a good time overall.
author: Jeff A.

description:
I've always liked this bar.  It never gets too full.  It especially never gets too full of hipsters.  The food is greasy and delicious and the service is pretty efficient.  They can accomodate a big group easily, sometimes even during prime drinking times.

Last time I was walking by this place (wearing a big, fake moustache on the way to Esta Noche...yeah, it was one of those kinds of nights), I ran into my long lost brother.  We had a tearful reunion, it was really amazing.

Wait no, it was some drunk frat boy celebrating his birthday, ALSO sporting a big, fake moustache.
author: Frankie D.

description:
Its more like 3.5 stars.  I went here for the food and the fact that they have cider. :) I love cider with my fish & chips.  The table service leaves a lot to be desired both during crowded full service menu hours and also for the after hours bar menu.  The fries are wonderfully crispy. The garlic fries are great. The fish was crsipy  and not greasy- great fish & chips.  I was sooo happy that they had curry sauce, but i found the curry sauce to be a little too sweet- and not in a good way like coconut might be, but it tasterd almost like apple sauce.  Good with latkes, not in curry.  

We also had the wings. They tasted as close to reall Buffalo wings as I have had in this city. I lived in Buffalo & so I know wings well- its really all that city has going for it. really. They were spicy and tangy Wonderfully close to a Buffalo wing- but too vinegary tangy and not enough heat, although it would have been fine if they let off the vinegar.  They were also fried well. Im super picky & very particular- try it you might like it.  Might be better when drunk :)
author: N A.

description:
Here's another spot I stumbled on a few nites back when I had a fiece craving for a decent steak. I had wanted to go to the Valencian, which is a couple blocks from this joint, but it was closed on a Mon. nite, as restaurants sometimes are.

Maybe that's a good thing; I sauntered in, by now nearly in despair and seriously ravenous.

I spotted a convenient seat at the bar, and was greeted warmly by a really cute blond bartender. I had seen the menu in the window and ordered up immediately, intrigued by what was termed a "salsa gravy" on their ribeye. 

I found out pretty quickly.

The ribeye was served up in what seemed like no time at all, accompanied by some of the most heavenly mashed taters I've had in many moons. Not only that, but there was some braised veggies, a mix of green beans, spinach and broccoli that had a tangy lemony/lime flavor, which was pretty frickin' awesome too. The portions were good-sized also--I had to box it and finish it at home after a few hours. Not only that, but the tab was under 20 bux with a beer to wash it all down.

Hell, I'm salivating while I'm writing this--that's how good it was.

I also liked the mix of Irish folk and rock music (I've got a wee bit of the Emerald Isle in me), although it was a bit loud, given the half-filled house. A bit less U2, and maybe a bit more Thin Lizzy as well. Other than that, it was stellar.

I'll be back for more soon...yum.
author: ACE A.

description:
Staff is friendly, but really cheap with alcohol.

I asked for a dirty martini, and she filled the glass with half WATER... I asked her about it, and she said that, that's how a dirty martini is made... What a joke.
author: Neil H.

description: So i know us Irish aren't known for their impecible taste but the Shepherd's pie is great here, as is the soda bread! Friendly wait-staff as well, though sometimes they're a bit understaffed.
author: Nikki M.

description: Stopped in for lunch.  Now this may or may not say something about me, but they had two of my favorite foods on the menu:  Macaroni & Cheese and Heinz' Baked Beans.  I don't know if that makes me wannabe Euro-trash, but both were fabulous.
author: Jennifer L.

description: It is also only 3 blocks or so from BART 16th st station which makes it perfect.
author: Jim J.

description: Sarah ROCKS.  She needs to win best of SF, seriously.
author: Bernard W.

description: I work too hard for my money to waste it on mixed drinks with hardly a splash of alcohol in them. Okay atmosphere though.
author: Dave H.

description:
Came here a week before Xmas and the place was full of Santas. 
..huh, cools. 
Anyways, i ordered the ribeye ($14) and it was huge and del-ish (& of course took a huge 'ish afterwards). 
Well worth it tho'
I'll be back soon-ish
T
author: Tak H.

description:
Best seat in the house in next to the outside wall on a nice day.

Good beers on tap (of course).  Passable bar service (they're busy so that is actually a good sign).  Clean toilet (the exception and not the rule in the Mission).  Nice interior.  Great location.  

I've had the food a couple times but I can't say for the life of me if I had any feelings about it...therefore, I'd say the food wasn't memorable (that could be a plus!).

Good quality place for a pint and conversation any day.
author: Chris D.

description: Nice bartenders. I meet my friend here every week for a meal and a beer or two. Food is above average for an Irish pub, I like bangers and mash. The bartender knows what my friend and I order. The place gets crowded during sports events, could not even make it through the door during the world series.
author: Cup C.

description: Yes, as good as it gets for an Irish Pub.  Happy hour fish tacos and effin' AMAZING wings?  Adorable waitresses?  Yes and yes. Fish and chips are delicious.  Comfortable atmosphere.  So comfy, in fact, I've ventured here alone a few times to watch my SEC football game.  A surplus of TV's and cool folks fill the place.
author: J. Tyner R.

description: Great place to stop for a few pints with friendly bartenders and good food what else could you ask for?
author: Eric T.

description: The bartender and the food is great, the people our friendly . The best thing if you come with a big group sometime it hard to get a drink but the place is fun.
author: Riley W.

description:
Never been here for food and I've only been here once in general.

Rolled in with a group of bitchez and took Irish Car Bombs, yes - we were being cliche on purpose.

The owner or manager of the bar was super helpful and friendly as well as the server, this chill guy from Guatemala or Guadalajara - I was pretty tipsy so the specifics have been lost.

Had a good time while we were there and will definitely go back for the chill environment and the friendly people - even the bar crowd was helpful and two guys overheard me asking where I should take my out-of-towner friends and they offered up a few good ideas.  I liked that, I like friendly people.
author: Lauren G.

description:
I love going for a pint and a bite here whenever I'm in the neighborhood.
A great selection of beers and the food is good too! 

While waiting to order, they bring out a bowl of their delicious soda bread, but make sure you leave room for your meal. A favorite of mine here is their fish tacos... yes, I said it, great fish tacos at an irish pub!  Who woulda thunk it?
author: Jason M.

description:
My roommates are addicted to this place (I live with two guys on 19th between Valencia and Mission).  

They come here for brunch, dinner, sports games, casual drinking - basically to do everything but shower and sleep. 

I have joined them a couple of times and I really like the service - the food is actually pretty good (chipotle charred chicken) BUT the reason this place rocks is....

(drumroll please)

Carlsberg on tap.  Enough said.
author: Laura G.

description: This is I think the best sports bar in the city, in the way that it still feels like a pub. Its rowdy but not obnoxious and you can still easily have a conversation, the food is great, yesterday I was compelled to go in for a banana pancake special which came with 2 pieces of bacon and strawberries which I believe is a proper breakfast, I always get annoyed that you are charged 7-8 for pancakes, waffles, or French toast and nothing comes with it so you don't finish and you don't have any protein to start your day. Anyway delish and cozy suited for a bunch of friends but can easily be an intimate spot to chilax in the mission.
author: crystal j.

description:
Two biggest complaints:
1)
Worse fish and chips I've had in a really long time - well beyond stuff that comes frozen from the grocery store. =)

2) When I go to an English or Irish pub, one of the big perks is the availability of beers I never see at a normal bar - you know Speckled Hen, Fullers, Murphy's, ect.  While their beer selection was decently large, it didn't have any difficult to find English or Irish beers.

So yeah, if you absolutely are craving some pub grub and can't leave the Mission to go someplace better like Pig & Whistle or Irish Bank then this is likely your best option, but I can't say you should seek it out.
author: Josh M.

description: We were waiting for an afternoon event at The Church and ran into the Phoenix to get out of the rain. Had a quick pint and came back later to eat. It's a busy place, but the minimal staff does an amazing job! We had the Skirtsteak sandwich with home made chips, the corned beef sandwich with onion rings, and Shepherd's Pie and it was all very very good. Music is loud, but no deafening.
author: C. L. T.

description: Cute little irish pub, delicious restaurant...yummy fish and chips. The crowd seems friendly but very coupled off. It's definitely a fun place to get a couple beers, eat yummy food, and watch a game!
author: Sonya D.

description:
Not really the type of place I would come to on my own, but one of the companies I work for, The Go Game 
( http://www.yelp.com/biz/pB5aJsxB98GvPld3ooRFxg ), stations me here for gigs from time to time, where I usually end up siting at the bar for about two to three hours by myself, so I've had plenty of time to dig the vibe, which is low-key with a slightly international flair...

Their food just doesn't do it for me, and after trying like four different dishes, I think I'm through. The portions are HUGE (which is a con, for me...I hate wasting food) and the food is heavy. But hey, maybe that's just pub food in general. 

I do like the fact that they serve bottles of Magner's apple cider, though, in two different sizes...I'll probably just order a large Magner's, from now on. Their coffee is also good, although, be forewarned that you only get ONE REFILL for free, and then after that they charge you for a second coffee...

They play good music, and the service is great, especially for the mission, so overall, I can't complain about getting paid to hang out here!I
author: Shannon R.

description:
Very solid pub food.... very solid indeed. I've eaten here twice. The first time, I had a corned beef sandwich. It was chunky and juicy, and the bread was delicious. I was very impressed. The second time, I had a ribeye with "salsa gravy". The steak itself was pretty decent.... a little tough maybe (hey dude, it's pub food, and it's very reasonably priced, so decent is fantastic)... I have to agree with the other people who wrote about the mashed potatoes. They were outstanding. Normally, I don't even like mashed potatoes unless they're garnishing a huge pile of garlic. The veggies were nicely prepared, too.

I dig the atmosphere quite a bit. There's always a good mix of people in here. The music is generally controlled by the bartenders, but that ain't so bad. Granted, I am more of a Thin Lizzy guy than a U2 guy myself.

One thing I wish this place had (along with a few other bars in the Mission)... better ventilation. Some people really like to bring tha funk in here. I'm not sure if this is all part of creating a legit Mission hipster persona or what, but it has to stop. Trust me. No one should question your integrity just because you rub a stick on your pits in the morning.
author: Angelo B.

description:
The theme of the evening was "Only 1 Pint."  

And as we all know, there is no such thing when you venture out to the Mission.  The pub had a good vibe, very friendly bartenders, and a decent selection of beers.   TVs in the front of the bar and also in the back of the restaurant.  Music selection was quite diverse going from hip-hop to 80's to rap to 70's.  Oh, did I mention the very friendly bartenders!

Thus, the evening ended after "Only 5 Pints."

A little more than I wanted to drink for a Wednesday night, but less than what normally happens when I'm out in the Mission. 

I almost forgot, my STAR rating:

-1 STAR - Calamari was mediocre, the cocktail sauce sure tasted a lot like ketchup.  And who mixes lettuce with their calamari.
author: James C.

description:
I don't know why I love this bar, but I love it.  I'm holding myself back from 5 stars, but it is my favorite bar in town.  Good atmosphere, friendly people.  

One of the bartenders is exceptionally slow at making drinks right now.  She's easy on the eyes though.  Maybe if she speeds it up a bit I can make this 5 stars (I know, a little bitchy, but isn't that the point of Yelp)

Love you, mean it
author: Shawn H.

description: It's hard to decide what criteria to use when reviewing a bar; after all, the IPA tastes like IPA. We were there with a huge group, and they were very accommodating. I got inappropriately hammered after consuming 4 drinks (thanks for the beer Cooper), and proceeded to announce sordid details of my personal life to anyone in earshot (apologies to Pam and Jon, and, well...everyone else). I like the layout, the staff was friendly, and the vibe was good. I will be back.
author: Merrilee T.

description: Nice area to go have have a drink. The bartenders are good at what they do and will always respond to a $20 on the table.
author: Chris K.

description: Food is good specifically like the wings, and coming from a family member of the Famous Duffs Wings in Buffalo, I am the fore most expert in wings and I like. Bar is also good more of a locals/group place hangout. Lots of female bartenders.
author: Christopher F.

description:
you'll find me here on Monday nights. just don't sit in the back right corner, it's right by the bathroom and smells of urine. 

the food is good, the service is good, and it's just a nice homey place to hang with friends! love it!
author: linda t.

description:
First of all, has anyone ever seen an Irish person in San Francisco outside of an Irish bar?  I've been asking and the answers are defensive "there's this person I kind of know"s at best.  What's with these people?  If I moved to Dublin I wouldn't exist solely at the local Applebees.  Why do they come here?
  
Anyway, the food is pretty good here.  However, they use the term "tatoes" though.  I've changed it on a few menus but not all.  Watch out.

Never had an urge to drink here but once danced for a minute or two while sneaking into the bathroom on a Valencia walk.
author: Ed B.

description:
It twas the night before St. Patrick's day and all through the bar, all you could hear was Irish car bombs going off in my mouth. I am a sensible gal in her early 40s, so how did this happen? Peer pressure I say; OK that is a lie, all my friend Mike said was, "Want a Irish car bomb?"  and I replied with, "Sounds like a very sensible drink." I will admit they were much better than doing Lady Libertys--Note to self: best to stay away from flaming finger drinks while drunk. 

Four bombs later I was still standing and still quite happy--it was a good evening without the crowds of St. Paddy's day observers--a jump start to the holiday I like to say. 

I always stop by the Phoenix when I am going to dinner down on Valencia or going to Noe--all roads lead to the Phoenix. Now, besides the ICB, I love the spicy bloody Mary's and the Boddington's draught. Servers are friendly and they always want to make sure I eat and I do not look like I have ever missed a meal; just motherly I guess. Stop by and have a drink while waiting for your table at Range.
author: Deborah S.

description:
Great place to come when you just want to sit and hang out with friends.  The people are nice, and it's never too long of a wait for drinks. I like sitting in the back where it's not as crowded.  
Probably one of my favorite bars in this area.. it's unpretentious, not too loud, and I feel like I could take anyone here.
author: Stacy S.

description:
I like coming here.  Feels like home.  Except I'm not Irish.  At all.  :)

The Phoenix is a good pub.  They have an extended selection of libations to choose from.  They also have a full menu.  Last night, I had my Stella plus a good beefy mushroom burger with all the fixins.  I'm also a big fan of the mac and cheese.  The staff is always busy but they still manage to be attentive and patient.
author: Pelle Y.

description:
I've been frequenting this pub for the past couple of years. The waitresses and bartenders are friendly and helpful. The mixed drinks are pretty good though I usually get Pacifico with a lemon slice for sentimental purposes. The pina colada's are actually tolerable here (I've had some crappy Pina's..seriously). 
The food is decent. I mean, it's pub food, so you can't really expect much. You can't go wrong with the Fish and Chips either. 
Usually some cheesy tunes are playing from the jukebox, the atmosphere is alright. Definitely not a place to go to on a date. This is the place where I meet up with some friends for a drink and grub. I love my fine dining, but I'll always have a place in my heart for the Phoenix.
author: Shereen R.

description:
I could not have pick a more appropriate day to check out this little Irish pub than on St. Paddy's Day.  It's only 8:30 and it's jam-packed. It's loud, full of drunk asses spilling beer all over the place, stuffy and fortunately, they serve great beer - now how can anyone go wrong with Stella Atrois on tap? Although, I felt like I was dishonoring St. Patrick by not throwing back an Irish car bomb or just plain ol' Guinness.  Oh well.   

I would've loved to try some of the bar food, especially the "Irish Nachos" and their fish and chips, but the server told us the kitchen was closed.

I give it 2.5 stars.  Half star goes to the bouncer who let me in without my ID.
author: Yvonne C.

description: This place was so so for me. It an ok irish pub, as far as pubs go. The food is barfood, and the beer is cold.
author: Mark A.

description: returned to a bit older, a bit wiser. Came on a Friday night, prime time for mission dist bars. I like it. It isn't as hipstery as some of the bars in the area and there seemed to be a lot of space. It has now upgraded to a place I would recommend to friends as a go-to.
author: Geralyn Y.

description: Perfect if you want good food with your drinks in the mission.  Also, it is possible to sit and talk to friends here.  Get the Irish Nachos. Yum!
author: Kacie O.

description:
note to management: 
your bartendresses and waitstaff are good eye-candy, but the whole two-tiered staff system is really, really unnerving.  there are about 3 more "blonde chicks" than is ever really needed "working" on any given night.  they greet you when you walk in, come over and talk to you, smile a lot, and take your order, pour your beers.  but when your drinks are up, a troop of brown people (not in quotes) scurry around bringing them over, and taking away your plates.  sometimes a "blond chick" accompanies the brown people person bringing your food but for some reason she cannot carry it.  and if you want to order another round or anything else for that matter, you have to ask a "blonde chick". and only a "blonde chick" can bring you your check which comes with a dutiful wink and a grand finale smile.  

really unnerving.  even at hooters the waitresses work.  i mean come on.  besides, if you're going for eye-candy, then you need to be equal opportunity.  let's see as many lissome men in tight plaid flannel shirts and skinny skinny jeans.  

thank you.

p.s. why does a non-happy hour FULL order of wings now contain only 6 wings total,  with a five to 1 flipper to drummette ratio?  a plateful of flippers is nasty.  arrgh, no thanks.
author: Nikki F.

description: This local bar has great drinks and delicious food that's fresh. Love the Bloody Marys, the beer selection and salads and sandwiches. I've never eaten anything here that wasn't good. The only reason why I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is because service is slow. However, I like coming here for the vibe, drinks and food-it's a can't beat.
author: MARIA M.

description: I have not been to many sports bars in SF but this is definitely one of my favorites. Good bar food with a nice beer selection. Bartenders are always friendly and service is usually pretty good. Have had some slow nights while sitting at a table but overall pretty solid. It can get rather crowed during the week if a good game is on, but I say stick it out and join the crowd for a rowdy night of cheering your team on!
author: Michael C.

description:
After a day at Dolores Park, some friends and I decided to walk down to the mission to find a spot for drinks. We ran into the Phoenix bar and  was amazed at how packed it was for an early Sunday evening. 

The Phoenix is an irish pub that hosts a variety of beers on tap--none of which I drank of course. Silly me had a chardonnay in a a beer pub. One mistake for the books! The environment is what you expect of a pub with a long bar, tv's, fairly loud acoustics and wooden booths. We sat in a booth and my bum hurt by the end of the night. Therefore, the seating can be a bit crammed and not the most comfortable.

However, I did try the comfort food they serve up. I ordered a Chicken and Mushroom Pot Pie and also tried a bit of my friend's Bangers and Mash  and they were both delicious. The Chicken Pot Pie came with a flaky pastry puff placed on top of it and the creamines and texture of the puff with the chicken and vegetables was really yummy. The sausage in the bangers and mash were very tender and flavorful. All the portions are fairly large, so just a tip when ordering that you might have some left overs!

I would go back, it was a fairly enjoyable atmosphere with suprisingly good food for a pub.

Happy food finding!
author: Laura L.

description:
Something about this watering hole is charmed.  Could it be that there is always an empty parking space on the curb?  Maybe it a classic Irish pub without the frat house element that makes is special.. 

In any case, try the hot toddy on a chilly day and if your brave get an order of the fish and chips.  Sometimes its good, sometimes its not.  

Thumbs UP:  Easy drinkin in the Mission without the cooler than thou element. 
Thumbs DOWN:  Unreliable food.
author: Jeff C.

description:
This is a great bar, so what if it doesn't have hipsters or a gang of Irish people.  If anything I'm a huge fan of this bar because its just as the Irish, interested in getting some fucking drinks and talking with good people.  Probably the best part of this place comes in that you can show up with about 6 other people and not be crammed into some corner or have to have one person order all the drinks because no one else can fit at the bar.  Twice I have come here with sizable crowds and both times we have all had a place to hang out and chat.  
As much as I love mission bars, I do like this place because you can take a short break from all the hipsters with dogs without going to North Beach or the Marina.  

This place is a great place for car bombs.
author: Steven R.

description:
Pros:
-great, cool atmosphere
-fries with all that stuff on them are awesome
-staff was great
author: Jonny d.

description:
Great place for beer and breakfast!

The soda bread is addicting, as is the fact that they serve breakfast all day.

Can't beat a beer and a hearty breakfast of beans, eggs and bacon at 3pm!
author: thrasher b.

description: Pretty good bar/ gathering house (see restaurant) in the Mission.  Decent food, its great when drunk, but sober its good.  Nice service, although on a game night or on the weekends, you might have to use an air-horn or cut an artery to get their attention.  Great bar...nice selection of beers and great selection of hard liquors.  Ok for watching a game, sitting at the bar is preferable to sitting a a table.  But overall a good experience, but not OMG!
author: Dean D.

description: This place is my home. All of the employees are ridiculously good at what they do. The food is the best bar food in San Francisco. A great place to be on a cold and dark night.
author: Paul D.

description: Great place to have few beers and appetizers! bartenders are good and quick on filling your drinks. The quesadillas were great! however the wings were just ok...!
author: Johnny B.

description:
So I've been here twice, both times just drinking in the back at one of the tables with friends. And, for that purpose, it does admirably.

We went there last night after dinner at Osha Thai. The waitress was really friendly and conversational, and they had a large enough beer and liquor selection to keep everyone happy (my friend was particularly impressed by the gin martini that came out). The waiter also brought bread for us to munch on.

It's certainly a go-to spot for when I'm down here for dinner (which is often--it's a fantastic neighborhood). I'm tempted to give it a five.
author: Nathan N.

description:
I have been going to this pub since the day it opened.  (I am not even kidding)  I have seen many splendid servers/tenders/cookers pass through on there way in life.  I have never been disappointed, and more than a few times have insisted the cook be brought to my table to compliment them.

The Shepherd's Pie is bombastic!  The Lamb Shanks are kickin'!  Great burgers and good times.  Had my last Birthday here too with 30 friends and the staff was very, very accommodating.

Whether I am up or down (I came here on the day I was canned from my last crappy job) I always enjoy myself, and that's not jsut because I live around the corner.  ;-)
author: Travis E.

description:
I like to stop in here, order a pint and a mac and cheese, and read by the window.  Last time Bonds was breaking the record, so there were rubberneckers hanging their heads in the window to watch the TVs.  The waitress asked them to move on so they weren't panting over my plate.  That was nice.  

Their Irish soda bread is really good.
author: saudade s.

description:
This place is cozy and warm. I always feel at home at the Phoenix, whether it's celebrating the World Cup, having a shot (or two) of whiskey, or just grubbing on some fries.

I suggest the Veggie-Burger with bleu-cheese. YUM. Garlic fries are yummy. Fish and Chips are tasty. This place introduced me to my new appreciation for mayonnaise.

Good pub food for a rainy day, a sunny day, any day.
author: Sprout S.

description:
Loved the hot buffalo wings, lots of TVs to watch the games, good beer selection...

But, all the TVs are out of sync from one another by like 10 seconds... I hate hearing a touchdown way before I see it!
author: Simon S.

description:
Good but not great. The burger I had was more than medium and a bit salty, but it was still a burger and I still ate it. Good beer selection.

I'd come back but it's nothing to write home about.
author: Stu M.

description:
3.5 stars: I love Irish Pubs.  I am a connoisseur of such locales.   
Decor:  fine, irish bar with booths
Service: good, fast and friendly
Prices:  decent, i don't usually pay for my drinks but im goin to say around 5-7 for a cocktail
Crowd: a mix of non-hipster dorks and foreigners
Music:  never registered in my head
author: Ann M.

description: My favorite beer and booze, always a soccer game on, friendly people, and better than average pub-grub. I'm usually a weekday visitor so not really here for packed late night or weekend sport-watching crowds. Never dissapoints...unless they are out of Smithwicks! ;-)
author: Doug V.

description:
The Phoenix has been a solid and staple establishment in my life. The beer is good. The vibe is good. The food is good. Especially the shepherds pie, that one is my favorite. 

However something happened today that prompted me to write a review. I wandered in here with the bf for a much needed Irish breakfast. After browsing through the menu we realized that hair of the dog would be necessary to assuage our hangover. We settled on sharing a Bloody Mary and informed the very friendly waitress of our plans. She split the drink into two glasses that were complete with strong pours and yummy garnishes.

This was a small thing, but it was thoughtful and it was awesome. And it will definitely keep me coming back to a place with such great staff.
author: A K.

description: Friendly bartenders, great shepherds pie and tasty beers!!
author: Brian R.

description:
"Let's go to the Irish bar down the street for some food" invariable brings looks of dismay from my friends( until they eat here). Irish pub food is notorious for being terrible.

Not so at the Phoenix-
They serve a great Irish brunch on weekends- love the Gaelic fried steak.
Fish and chips are excellent- the fish is fresh and flaky with a tasty batter. Another favorite is the roast chicken quesadilla.
The menu is a mix of comfort food( mac and cheese) and healthy offerings( salads).

The ambiance is fun- locals and drunk Irish guys screaming at the tv occasionally, with a cool jukebox to boot.
author: Ariel W.

description:
I always walk into the Phoenix because I like to watch sports and drink beer. I walk out saying "I am always surprised by how good the food is there". Bars usually are pretty ho hum on the food side but the food at the Phoenix is genuinely good.

The macaroni and cheese here is YUM-MY! Especially with the shaved ham.
I love the Patty Melt - get the taytoes they are very very good!

The staff is super friendly and attentive.
author: Ashley T.

description:
A very well deserved solid 4 stars. I have been here before to enjoy drinks with friends, but came for the first time to try out their food. My cousin's wife is having a birthday soon, and we needed to find a place that had booze and food. Yeah, that should be easy, but there were a lot of dietary restrictions... weird dietary restrictions... and the best bet with an irish family was to take them to an irish bar. 

Food... tasty, they had this crazy tasty bread, it was one of the best baskets of bread I have had in a long long while. 

Service was really good, the server was always ready to fill out water or drinks. 

What ruined it was the douche bags that rolled in 7 deep and started yelling and swearing... I understand that it's a bar, but it was around 7 at night on a Monday. Not the bars fault, but I'm a prick so, oh well.
author: danny e.

description: One of my favorite Irish pubs in the city. Great beers on tap and no waiting around for the next round, the bartender is always aware when your about to finsh that pint, and the next one is waiting for you right wnen you finish that last sip. Great food 2 can't go wrong with the fish n chips and anchor steam perfect .
author: Chris D.

description: Went there on a busy day during a niners game. Ordered food and a beer. Could not hear the bar tender tell me the price for everything over crowd and gave her just enough food and the drink by accident. Instead of just giving me change back so i could really tip her she started yelling about how i was cheap. The service sucks i will never go there again. All bad
author: Anthony B.

description:
got a bad hangover from this place the night before so went here the next day for a little hair of the dog.

breakfast of meat  meat meat and potatoes did the trick. 

down side. wait till after football season because the douche patrol is out in force screaming at the TV which only made my head throb even more..
author: Mattew W.

description:
I'd hate to give out my favorite sports bar but this place rocks the Mission area.  Its probably the only real sports bar in the mission; they have 8 flat screen tv's and the nfl package.  In addition, the food is unlike any other sports bar, its really good.  Its the closest you'll get to white table cloth dining at a sports bar.   
This place is like a second home.  I have spent brunch, lunch, & dinner at this place in one day several times...only during football & march madness seasons.
The issue with this place, you'll love the first dish so much that you won't order something different.  I just began eating different item(s) and have not been let down.  Try their corned beef hash, fish & chips, wings (very NY, crispy with Frank's red hot sauce), lamb shank,...just try everything.
As for service, it really depends.  They've revamped their amazing servers/bartender with new ones.  They are all sweet except one, Jenna, you'll know who she is when you get her....she's the one that'll pay more attention to her friends and give you an attitude bc she'd rather be hanging out with her friends and not take your order.  I'll update this review with 5 stars when she's gone.  I can't imagine her lasting any longer.
author: LIVE to E.

description: Me and two of my friends visited this place during happy hour the other day. We got two big dishes of garlic fries, a plate of southwestern potato skins (they call them Irish Nachos), a soda and a half pint of Guinness... for about $10. Cheap delicious filling snackage FTW!!!
author: Kathleen P.

description:
Pleasantly surprised by the food here. Tayto skins = really tasty (despite the terrible name). Good steak sandwich. The lamb shank is a serious portion of meat--more or less the size of my buddy's face. I'd go back if it was bar food I craved. 

However, do they water down the non-Guiness beer?
author: David K.

description:
So It's Sunday morning, well it's 2:30, and you just got outa bed, and you are ready for breakfast, but you're totally screwed cuz most of the trendy brunch spots stop serving breakfast at three.  What do you do?  Before you settle for lunch food, consider and unlikely place: the Irish pub on Valencia.

I ended up here on one such morning and had one of the most amazing breakfasts of my life.  I had the Box Bixby Benedict (no, that's not its real name but there are three B's), which had amazing irish bacon on potato bread with a great Hollandaise Sauce.  Ok, I might be mixing up two benedicts because they have a few but they are all amazing, and they have a goat cheese sauce that will give you a coronary, but it's worth it.

Don't forget to order a side of pancakes, for two bucks, they're a nice compliment to any meal.

They have pretty good food at any time of day, and one day I'll try the Irish coffee with donuts, but the breakfast is exceptional.

Note:  They serve breakfast seven days a week, but only have a full brunch menu on Saturday and Sunday, so no pancakes on Wednesday.
author: Jessica R.

description: Week 17 of the NFL SEASON with the Niners, Raiders, Chargers and Seahawks playing...They let a pittsburg Steeler fan choose the game-  the Viking game.  UGH.  They no longer care for the locals.. Sad day for a regular who's been going there for years. sad day for all the Niners fans asking the bartender to change the Chanel.
author: J C.

description:
came here for some bromance with 5 homies, ended up drinking a lot of beer, eating probably the best shepards pie EVAR and shared stories while giggling like a bunch of 13 yr old schoolgirls.

perfect setup spot for the rest of the night, which included us coming back here later in the eve for some more rounds after realizing we shouldn't have left in the first place.

i thought men were decisive.  nope.  not us...
author: omar b.

description:
I love this pace.. No seriously just the thought of going there makes me skip in joy.

It is billed as an Irish bar, but the food is so much more pot roast to die for, meatloaf that is awesome, fish and chips that are great and breakfasts that I would gladly sacrifice my lifelong collection of garbage pail kids cards for.

BTW if you are like me and a UK original the full Irish breakfast has both black and white pudding and British bacon and on the tables they have HP sauce- be still my beating heart!!!

All the beer is good and the staff are great fun.

Bonus item is a jukebox.
author: Alex H.

description:
I've been there twice now, and both experiences were positive. It can get a little crowded at night, and the line for the women's restroom takes a freakishly long time (seriously, ladies, what are you DOING in there?), but it's got a lot going for it.

I've been on both Friday and Saturday night, and sat at the bar both times. I'm easy - bring me a $5 Hoegaarden - but from what I've overheard, the bartenders are pretty fantastic at taking everyone's way-too-complicated, huge orders, and remembering them with no problems. I've never heard anyone complain.

French fries are $3.80 with tax and come with a side of mayonnaise. Good fries. Definitely enough to keep me happy while I'm sitting at the bar watching World Series of Poker.

It's dog-friendly, so you'll occasionally have puppies poking around at your feet. Like every other dog-friendly bar in the Mission, they always seem to be super cool and under control.

My only issue is that people seem to be super wasted super early, and then they want to interfere with the conversation I'm trying to have at the bar. I'm not interrupting you and your friends - it would be nice to have the same respect for me and mine. Also, it's usually pretty loud, so I'm just nodding and smiling as you're talking, because I can't hear anything you're trying to tell me. Take the hint.
author: Jen R.

description: Came here recently for a friend's going away party and thought it was a nice spot for a big group gathering.  The food was plentiful, the service was fast, patient & accomodating, this is a solid place.  The shepherd's pie and lamb stew were overly salty but still good.
author: Suzanne V.

description:
I loved the food!
My boyfriend never finishes his dinner & he gobbled it up..
The skirt steak sandwhich was yummy & tender.
He had the meatloaf & it was not on his plate for long..
A tad loud but heck it is a bar too!
author: Margie C.

description: Yeah, yeah, yeah. I've never been to Ireland but i spent some teenage years in Britain and English and Irish pubs there will probably beat it. Sure. But you know what? Guinness and Boddington's on tap, nice fish and chips with malt vinegar, best Buffalo Wings in town and nicest bartenders too. Everybody knows everybody, food is great and soda bread is unlimited. Fridays are kinda too crowded, but still-good beer, good food. Cheers!
author: Maria O.

description: fish & chips were awesome nothing compared to the irish bank but they do the job , wings and burgers weren't all that but definetly a fun place to hang out and pre drink before a wild night out ....
author: NAEL K.

description:
A friend and I recently had lunch at the Phoenix. My alter ego had this to say about our beloved Irish pub. Enjoy. 

Dear Hot Girl at the Phoenix,

So there you sat conspicuously perched atop the epitome of counter culture casually sipping a beer when I noticed you drifting into my universe. As the stars smiled at the heavens and the interstellar dust began to part it became obvious that no one in our newly formed solar system noticed how well your designer jeans and Louis Vuitton's complimented your boyfriends "Blinger" hoodie and Vans cargo shorts. Certainly not the two gentlemen engrossed in a heated debate over the likely outcome of tonight's stick and ball games. And doubtful that the walking tattoo portfolio that escorted you to this pub-crawl paradise was able to break concentration from the pint of beer he was fixated on to pay you any homage. The ego takes one on the chin. It is worth noting that you did however receive a few catty-eyed glances from not only the wait staff, but also by a woman on her way to the lavatory. Just thought I should mention that.

Well, you probably don't notice much beyond the ten layers of eyeliner you feverishly pasted on before this romantic night on the town, but sitting tangential to the royal you was of course me who at the time happened to be enjoying a delicious meal at our favorite neighborhood bar on a sunny and optimistic Saturday afternoon. And as luck would have it without warning you presented a conundrum like a shovel to the face. So I ask no one in particular," Is it the lack of life-long ambition or the complete unadherence to the laws of fashion that allow third-rate skater punks to pull highly refined trust-fund babies such as yourself ?". Never the less, I reached for a frosty beverage to quench my thirst for knowledge as you pretend to be entertained by the proverbial mirror hanging behind the bar and I wondered how hard it must be to for a small town girl living in a lonely world.

Don't stop believing.

Sincerely,

Steve Perry
author: Chad L.

description: My new favorite happy hour. Smithwick's is a buck off (20oz!), and the garlic fries are ONE DOLLAR and are actually really good. Also had a slider, which was at least twice the size and heft of your average White Castle burger.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
i've been here once before, but i didn't know it until i walked in for the second time.

beers are well priced, the chicken wings are delicious, and the place can hold plenty of people. i'm not sure i'd go here for  a full meal, but i def like the barfood+beer combo.
author: Ameer N.

description: This is my go-to get-drunk bar after performing at Monday Night Marsh. It rarely fails to disappoint, though service can occasionally be slow and olives lacking in Bloody Marys. (What's up with that?) Friendly crowd and a typically packed house, but there's always a seat for you. Be on the lookout for cute dogs and great garlic fries.
author: Allison L.

description: Five stars. Because the tarbender stopped us for paying twice for our shots of Jameson last night. And in the state we were in, we sure as hell would have. Now that's quality.
author: margot b.

description: Pretty good food and a great selection of beer. Gets pretty crowded for 49ers games, get there early if you want a seat. They also make a pretty good bloody mary here, had one on a Sunday morning and I wasn't disappointed.
author: Matt F.

description:
after showing up on time for our biweekly game night at doc's clock sunday evening and finding out the place is celebrating its 3rd anniversary with a jive ass live band and the bacon dog cart parked right out front (the smell alone made me want to puke) a few yelpers and i put our heads together and made our way to the phoenix.

what a difference lighting, good service, pub food and music can do. we played a 2 hour game, one of the most completely annoying in history because everyone was gunning for the win until andrew came out of nowhere and beat the living daylights out of us, and watched the end of the shark's game on the tellies.

i don't know shit about hockey, but what the fuck is up with hockey fans? i saw one dude plopped on a barstool almost cry [seriously, his face was all red and scrunched up....i could see the tears glistening around the corners of his eyes], and almost every hardcore fan in the joint sported a beard. 

beards are sexy and all, but EVERYONE?!? jesus, it's like a cult.

minus two stars for that scary drunk guy who came by our table and said unintelligible things as he pointed at our game [dude, if he knocked anything over or barfed on my board, i would have started a crazy bar fight right then and there]. I WILL CUT A MUTHAFUCKA FOR THAT SHIT.

now, it's physically impossible for me to grow a beard in support of things i love, but i DO know how to work a switchblade and have no qualms about cutting a chump to defend my fellow board game geeks. 

just sayin.
author: May T.

description: The real deal here.  A very nice Irish Pub.  Sat here and watched the rain blow through for the afternoon, enjoying watching the peeps dash around in the storm out the front window.  Although it was 2 PM, the crowd was jamming inside like it was 2 AM.  Located by an interesting little shopping district next to Mission Street in the city.  Bad news was the cost of refreshments, even in a large glass is hardly worth a five spot. Slow bartender service kind of took the sheen off of the place with the cost.
author: T L.

description: I absolutely love the four prettiest and sweetest girls over at The Phoenix and one of them is just a piece of sunshine. It is simply my favorite place to hang out in the city. The music is something I would have on my playlist and the lamb shank is a great bargain. I go out of my way to the Mission for this wonderful "gathering house".
author: Salim M.

description: We BART from the East Bay just to get the shepherd's pie, which is the best I've ever had and the best the boyfriend has ever had... and he lived in London for a year.  Place is enormously popular and apt to be crowded and deafeningly noisy any night of the week so keep that in mind when planning.  I've been there Sunday at midday (quiet) and at 7:30pm during World Cup soccer so I think I've run the gamut.  If there's a big-deal sports game on one of the many TVs, forget any possibility of conversation and just focus on eating the great food and imbibing as much beverage as you can.  Service is provided by a team of beautiful and amazingly efficient women.  Burgers and appetizers looked yummy too.
author: Michelle L.

description: Watched he Giants/Cardinals game and the Yankees/Angels game at the same time at this pub. Lots of tv's. Lots of selection of alcohol. The food was okay. I had bangers and mash ($12.50). Not sure if it was totally worth the price, but it was filling. It's a pretty typical pub. Not sure if it's a gem, but it shows sports.
author: Andrew Y.

description:
Everything you could want in an Irish Breakfast.  The Soda Bread is mindblowingly good.

I hear they serve drinks too, but I've only been in to eat.
author: Luke M.

description: I've never eaten at the Phoenix, but I've thrown back some pints there. It's a fun place to watch a football game.
author: Ben E.

description: One of the best Irish brunches in town, their Bloody Marys are like a friggin' meal unto themselves. The jukebox is worth checking out, and the bartenders are always cool and friendly. Look for the Irish quotes from Oscar Wilde along the walls.
author: Nish N.

description:
[Edit]: The head chef left, and now what was once surprisingly good and inventive pub cuisine is typical bar fare.  No more made-from scratch catsup, curry sauce or pickles--it's Heinz all the way, now.  To be fair, most of the food is still better than at most other pubs i've been to--just not by much.  Some of the old servers have left too, but the ones who remain are feckin fantastic!  Bernice, Emma, Christina, Joanna and all of em--they all rock! and Marsella is still the best barmaid I've found in this city. [/Edit]


Some weeks, I spend more time here than at home.  This is the place.  The drinks are a little on the spendy side.  But the servers are all feckin fantastic, every one of them.  There is one bartender in particular, Marsella, who makes flawless martinis (and what a babe, to boot).  The food far, far outstrips any other bar food anywhere.  They make their own catsup, from scratch (though they are a little stingy with the portions sometimes...understandably, as i've seen the recipe and yikes! i never knew so much work goes into catsup).  They even make the pickles from scratch!  Jake, the head chef, is great.  Some specials that come to mind are rabbit sausage, lamb shank wrapped in bacon, good stuff.  The Irish breakfast is great.  I try to behave myself here more than most places, since i'd probably have to move to another city if i were 86'ed from the Phoenix.  But i do get rather "tight" and the staff is never anything but friendly.
author: Mynameisdavid M.

description: This place is all around goodness. I've seen a couple of the 7 a.m. World Cup games here and it's been pretty quiet (three of us watching Italy, a small crowd watching Spain). But I think it'll fill up as the tournament progresses - saw Euro 2008 here and it was an amazing crowd. Food is fine, barstaff are just lovely,
author: Susan S.

description: Still awesome.  Went for the Sunday brunch.  My friend got the boxty benedict and I got the one with the grilled soda bread.  Pretty tasty, but definitely NOT as good as the Dolores omelette with hollandaise sauce.
author: Meh M.

description: ah, this is more like it.  good beer, great whiskey, and that great Irish bar feeling.  Casual atmosphere,  friendly people, great booze, that's my kind of Mission joint.
author: Joe B.

description: I don't like hanging out at bars. I don't drink that much anymore because I'm OLD! I don't like loud music because I'm OLD. I don't like drunk guys hitting on me because I'm ..I bet you thought I was going to say OLD but I was going to say desperate. Anyway , this bar is great to hang out with your friends and actually snag a table and not have to yell at each other to have a conversation. The food was great. Descent grub like pot roast and fish and chips. The margarita went straight to my head and I enjoyed every moment of it
author: Sophia C.

description: Warning!!!  Habit forming!  This place is hearty...yum...meats and soda bread.  There is just somethin about that bread and butter...I don't know...maybe there is crack in it?  The bloodies are mezmerizing...always hit me jus right.  Football too?  Yes...this is the place for a midwest transplant with an appetite.  Us corn fed biotches love us some bacon.  See you next Sunday.
author: Amanda T.

description:
I'm going to assume the current 4 star rating has everything to do with the bar and numerous TV sets showing every current sport program going on and nothing at all to do with the food.........

which SUCKS.  Overpriced, overcooked, overrated.  French fries are the absolute worst I've ever had anywhere. Cole slaw that accompanied my fish & chips was dry and flavorless. Fish was just okay, and you only get 3 small pieces for $12. Boooo.  

Okay, so they have a full bar and lots of good beer options on tap plus you can watch stuff while you eat/drink. There aren't a whole lot of places like that in the Mission so for that I gave an extra star.  

But, you'd be better off watching the game at your friend's apartment and making your own home-cooked food. Trust me on that one!
author: L. Renee D.

description: Any place that can serve up a kick-ass meal involving hollandaise sauce, potato pancakes, the saltiest bacon ever and poached eggs for under $8 is alright in my book.  The Phoenix is my go-to place for hungover brunch.  They have some killer bloody mary's for a little hair-of-the-dog treatment and the food is just greasy and salty enough to gorge yourself on while you try to piece together the previous night.  All the waitresses are super nice, the television placement ain't horrible (which is key during football season) and the soda bread is the best I've ever had.
author: Sarah H.

description: 5 stars for the margaritas. I know, right? Margaritas at a bar? but these even beat most restaurants.
author: Jennifer L.

description: The Mission, more so than any neighborhood I've found in SF requires a boat load of walking for some reason if you're going out at night.  Which is great, but occasionally I've found myself caught with fashion-over-function shoes, and man, these dogs get barking.  Luckily, I have never failed to get a table at the Phoenix, despite always going with 4+ people.  And the bar's never too crowded.  We stopped here because we didn't think we make it to La Rondalla without a drink in us.  Served our purpose perfectly.
author: Audrey T.

description:
this is my favorite spot to watch games and drink hoeagrdens.  They have shit load of beers on tap, and serve everything in the propper custom glassware.  

Also, service there is incredibly on point and friendly for a bar.  The chicken wings are a good call
author: Nick H.

description: I've never eaten here, but it's a pretty good bar. Lots of different stuff on tap, good music, not that crowded when I've been there. A refreshing change from the rest of the neighborhood, this place is pretension free (if you ignore pretending to be Irish, I guess).
author: John M.

description:
Irish Bars fall into some categories: Legitimate Irish Bars with Great Names, Fake Irish Bar Names like O'Reillys, Kells, O'Gofackoff, etc. and Irish Pubs that only serve Guinness.

The Phoenix is in a separate category, Irish Bar with a Name that sounds like a Music Venue. Pleasantly surprised to find this gem, I am always apprehensive when a friend drags me to an Irish Pub, I fear the worse. But this place was festive, dark and boisterous. Serve food and had some great beers on tap, skipped the Guinness and went straight to Boddington's and Speak Easy. Bartenders are easy on the eyes and quick servers. 

Will have to come back to eat, when i am not full of beer!
author: David B.

description: With its plethora of booths and tables and white floors, the Phoenix is very food-centric, and as such I don't really recommend it as a strict drinking establishment, unless Amnesia is too full and you're really desperate for somewhere that you and all your friends can sit down.  Unfortunately, the kitchen was closed by the time we got here, so I didn't get a chance to sample their culinary offerings, though I was certainly drunk enough to go for some.  Instead I just had a Black Bush neat, which for a small portion was overpriced at $7. (6 would be far more reasonable :)  So yeah, I'd probably shoot for beer and burgers next time.
author: Wes M.

description: In heaven, the Guinness & whiskey will flow like water and we will all eat heavy Irish bread, potato nachos & chips & skins from the Phoenix without fear of diabetes, cirrhosis, high cholestorol and general lard-ass ness. I always forget about this place and it's so delisious. I love the Irish people for we share a love of alcohol & potatoes, two of my main food groups.
author: Maria D.

description: One star for a decent selection of beers on tap ($5). One star for filling my appetite for futbol. One star for great meatloaf, burger, and fries. Minus one star for often-times weak whisky sours. Minus one star for running out of my favorite whisky at an inopportune moment in time. If I could, I'd add back another half star for the Joyce quote on the back wall- it always brightens my loser evening...
author: Stephen H.

description: I have heard not-so-good things about their food, but finally ate there a couple weekends ago.  My sister got the corned beef mash & I got the veggie mash, and both were D-licious!  And the $3 mimosas went down oh-so-nicely!  They have fresh-squeezed orange juice and you can tell!  mm mm.  The service wasn't actually all that great, but they were nice & I wasn't in a hurry, so we had a great time (although those front tables are awfully low, or maybe the seats are just awfully high).  I'll definitely be back and back and back.   And I'll try not to hold it against the server that she was routing for the Mets against the Giants (and the Mets did finally win in extra innings...boo..)
author: Kerry L.

description: I love to drink at restaurant bars, but I'm usually scared to eat from a bar kitchen. So many stale frozen salty fried things. Too much greasy burp tummy. But the other day when I had to have some chicken and potato food, had to, Ramirez said Phoenix. I was sceptical, but pleasantly surprised. I ordered some crazy chicken stuffed with bacon (hello!) over mash & root veggies with gravy. Did I mention it was fried?! I'll admit it was salty, fried, greasy burpish, but delicious too! Ramirez says they have an outstanding cheeseburger as well. BTW, sports on the TVs ALL the time. That bugs me, but Ramirez says sports are popular. Who knew?!
author: J. R.

description: This bar was the shit. Even now, I'm substiantially drunk. Big thanks to the cute female bartender for her help in the drunkenness.
author: Daniel R.

description:
a great homey irish pub.  nice bartenders and everything you'd want out of a pub :).

update 10/20:  i just tried some of their food at the yelp event last night and i really enjoyed it.... the rashers (these little patties with bacon and potatoes served with some great sauce) were excellent albeit cold (we did get them right out of the kitchen so maybe they're supposed to be cold.  the yelp event last night just reinforced my overall impression that i really love the phoenix as an overall lowkey spot to just chill!
author: Roshni R.

description: OK so I've never eaten here so I can't review the food but I honestly like the atmosphere here.  It has a nice neighborhood bar feel to it and if I lived nearby I would probably frequent this place.  It's a pretty decent sized place as well, not cramped at all.  And they have Smithwicks on tap....one of my favorite beers.
author: David C.

description: Sorry, but you're fookin' mad if you don't bow down to the Irish breakfast offered up between the cozy little walls at the Phoenix. I'm not sure the puddings are completely legit, but they're tasty and the bread is amazing (and available by the loaf for take-away). Round out the whole breakfast with some beans, and grilled tomato, and you've got yourself some full on breakfast action. For those only able to stomach a liquid breakfast, I suggest the bloody mary's...they are a meal unto themselves.
author: Steven C.

description: I have walked by many times, just never during meal time or wander time.  Today I wander past during lunch time.  I had my eye on their sheppards pie since the first time i saw the menu.  It is perfection.  Braised beef (not too stringy) with guinness gravy.  Im not a beer person, but the guinness gravy was perfect.  I ordered a lemonade (I dont drink a lunch because I'm a lightweight) and the bartender made one fresh squeezed because they didnt have any.  Wow, hows that for service?  What jukebox?  They had a nano hooked up to the sound system and people would just walk up and choose a song.
author: H C.

description: Three times here I always see the same sweet blond lass. We typically just drink, but I heard the food was good so brunched it today. Awesomest of awesome chipotle chicken sammie with cheese, Irish bacon and caramelized onion. Comes with fries, soup or salad and ice tea for $12. Not bad and service is fantastic!
author: Colleen B.

description: A jukebox with The Happy Mondays and Stone Roses? I'll take it...brought me right back to my college days! Before last night, I had walked or driven past this place hundreds of times, admired their neon sign, but never checked it out. I couldn't agree more with other reviewers' comments about the laid back, unpretentious vibe (which can be hard to find in The Mission these days). I didn't have any food here because we had all just stuffed our faces at Velvet Cantina (so, so good!), but I enjoyed a nice hefewiezen and appreciated the fact that I could actually sit and talk with my friends without screaming.
author: Abby W.

description: I'm always sorta slow to vocalize my like for this place.  I think it comes from me associating "bro" style drinking here, but I've decided to say whatever, brah and admit I like it.  It has a good pub feel to it - dimly lit, but not so dark you can't see the menu.  The only thing I don't like is that you can't really hear what the person across the table is saying.  They need some help in the acoustics department.  Great menu, especially for omnivores, good beer, good location, the end.
author: Katherine K.

description: this review is not for the food or the staff.  the bar manager here needs to effin wake up.  how do you manage to only staff only one bartender for one of the biggest day events in years? it's england vs the USA and you only have one bartender behind the bar?!?! the bar manager should have had at least 3 or 4 bartenders scheduled, with the extra bartenders done after the world cup match.  it's not rocket science.
author: Pickle R.

description:
Basically, it's a sports bar.

I love it for 3 reasons:
1) you can usually get a table in the otherwise-overcrowded Mission bar scene.
2) beer
3) The absolute BEST fish and chips in the city (and I am attempting comprehensive research on the topic).
author: Lily S.

description: Never tried the food, but the bartenders were friendly and attentive. Unpretentious, laid-back atmosphere with a mixed crowd. One of the few bars where you can actually enjoy a conversation over drinks without having to yell into your friend's ear. Beer on tap is always a plus for me.
author: Zell C.

description: cool place.  Potato skin nachos are great.  Watching sports here is fun except for one of the busted tvs.
author: adam b.

description: Nice place to hide out from the rest of the city. The bartenders and servers are nice and the internet jukebox has plenty of music to keep anyone happy for a couple of hours.
author: Nicolas H.

description: Excellent food.  Friendly staff.  Overall jovial atmosphere.  Great place to watch the SF Giants.
author: Sas C.

description: Please don't get turned off by the weird crowd, decor or the lack of parking, this bar totally makes it up with their food and drinks. I was in the mood for meat, so we took our friend's suggestion and checked this place out. At first when i came in i didn't like it, a lot of people, no waitress in sight, but i was hungry and there were lamb chops as a special, so i gave in. After having a first sip of the yummiest beer ever (leffe blonde?) or something like that, suggested by our server and taking  a bite of their in house made Irish soda bread - i was in heaven. I had my lamp chops (13.95!) and they were DELICIOUS! My bf totally cleaned my plate:) He order lamb stew which was also very good. Prices were right, food was delicious, maybe little lack of ambiance but it's still 5 stars from me.
author: Kate B.

description: Great place to catch a game - tons of TV, tons of beer, and plenty of seating. The food's not bad either. I got the chicken pot pie. I'm not sure why pot pie always comes in not-pie form - here it was a dish full of what would be pie filling, with a puff pastry on top. Somehow Marie Callendar's frozen pot pies are the closest I've gotten to an actual pie in the past five years.
author: Victor L.

description:
This is a great spot for food and drink.

Their breakfast is an Irish Breakfast - which is something I didn't care for however their dinners are amazing.

I recommend the pot roast and the burgers. Soooo good. They also have great happy hour food specials.

Drinks: Stick with Beer. The hard drinks are really watered down.
author: Jax C.

description: Irish nachos, vegetarian pot pie, a side of butternut squash...these words induce Pavlovian salivation as I write them. just beware how many pints you put away if you're having dinner here, portions are huge. i have accidentally made myself agonzingly full at this place on a few occassions...I also love any bar that serves breakfast, and where you can get food or drinks, or coffee, and where you can not even know what you're doing or what you want and still find it there.
author: d v.

description: Good pub, but not really a standout.  I like it.  I am fine with meeting people there.  I can drink their drinks and eat their food...  Everyone has also always been nice there.  Nice is a good descriptor for this.
author: Heidi P.

description:
So I went here with a group of friends the other night for drinks and it pretty much struck me as a regular bar-type establishment.

But I just have to say, one of the bartender chicks is totally rad. I had opened a bar tab and needed to spend 8 more bucks to reach the credit card minimum and close my tab (don't judge me, I'm broke!) so I asked this bartender to recommend something in that price range. She just asked me what kind of alcohol I'd prefer, then whipped me up a delicious specialty drink and took extra effort to charge me 8 bucks in the computer. Totally friendly and helpful, when bartenders can sometimes be super rude. Plus I got to try a new drink I never would have thought of on my own. SO APPRECIATED. Thanks, Phoenix bartender-- you know who you are.
author: J P.

description: i love it. The space is fun and pretty chill. Ive never had a bad time at The Phoenix. The bar food is amazing, I love the potato wedge nachos and the burgers are amazing. Good bar/restaurant  overall for sure.
author: Bobby P.

description: The perfect intermission to your night.  The Phoenix is is nothing special, but it serves a purpose.  It's location, menu and seating makes it the ideal spot to drop in for an hour in the middle of you night out.  Eat some moderately priced bar food, enjoy a beer from there above average beer selection (draft beer options are harder to find in the mission) and then shove off to a different venue.
author: BeeryMcGymrat X.

description:
It a great place to watch a mid-week game. I love watching college or pro basketball here on a week night here. But don't come here... I like it all to myself. Usually the place in pretty dead on the week-nights and the waitresses are more than accommodating in getting the game you want on one of the TVs. I did go on a Sunday for football it was pretty packed and the service wasn't as good as normal....but was still pretty good considering how busy they were.

Anyway, the food is pub/comfort food. The wings are some of the best you can find out in SF (I like the wings at Kezar Pub too). The pork loin sandwich is also really good.  The potato nachos don't sound very good but they are delicious. If you're into the traditional Irish fare, the Shepard's Pie is pretty excellent as well. They have tons of different beers on tap to boot.
author: Matt G.

description: Great Irish bar with excellent happy hour deals.  This is one of those neighborhoody places where you want to sit at a bar for dinner.
author: Joe R.

description: Great food, and I went on a Saturday night, found a table to sit at and enjoy talking with friends. Amazing to find a bar in Mission that wasn't jammed packed. Good place to go for eats and drinks before hitting other bars.
author: Alyssa C.

description: The Phoenix is a great bar - neighborhood-y, friendly, with an excellent selection of cider (including Magners, whoo-hoo!) and a brilliant jukebox. Their food is extremely hit and miss, though. Their inordinately high chef turn-over rate is the reason for the mixed reviews on their food -- I've had both incredible dishes (an amazing chicken and pasta creation) and also hideous inventions better left to Lovecraft novels (okay, so to be fair I REALLY should have known better than to order the vegetable enchiladas at an Irish bar). Stick with the basics of pub food -- fish and chips, Shepard's pie, etc, and you won't go far wrong.
author: Jude F.

description: You cannot get Irish 'brown bread' this scrumptious unless you haul your butt on the 12 hour flight to the Old Country... they just did some study about breakfasts and found the best combo to have in the morning is beans and toast... so all you chow'n down Irish breakfasts rock on!!!
author: Tessa R.

description:
i saw some people eating dinner at the bar and the food looked really tasty... lots of fried goodness...
we had already eaten each time i've been there so i would just have some drinks...
nice neighborhood bar to hang out at
author: charlotte s.

description: I'm all for an Irish pub, from authentic to stereotypical. I'm usually even down for the Disney esque versions that exist all over our fair land. Why? Because they usually mean hearty food, a decent crowd and an alright alcohol selection. I can safely say this place satisfies all three of these requirements. I don't know I'm a simple girl at heart (ha!) and I find places like this kinda comforting. The tasty bloody marys, mac and cheese with pulled ham and pot roast also are known to add to your comfort level. I've never seen this place entirely empty but the service has always been consistent so I find that a plus too. Definatly a place I can see as a meeting point for a mixed group of friends ready for a good night that doesn't involve major dressing up.
author: Veronica G.

description: A group of about 12 of us showed up here on a recent Saturday night, continuing a friend's birthday celebration, after dinner nearby.  Away from the swarms at 16th and Valencia, this pub is a reasonable walk from the crowds and a great place to get your night started.  The all-female bar tending staff seemed very pleasant and rewarded those of us who tipped well with quick service.  Both times I have visited this pub it has been strangely quiet, not good for business, but great for patrons.
author: Rusty O.

description: This place has the biggest lamb shank I've every seen. They have all my pub comfort food favorites:shepherd's pie, mac & cheese, and they also carry HangerOne vodka. It gets pretty crowded at night, but it's another fun place in the Mission to hang out. Would definitely go back.
author: Doris C.

description: Love this place... for some reason the Stella taste really good their... I only tried Fish & Ships and the burger is excellent... I am not a big fan of Irish food but love the place.... the girls behind the bar are extremely friendly and I feel I am at home.... prices are okay not cheap but not as expensive....
author: Hashem K.

description: I would have to say that they have some of the best wings i have had....and i have been all over the country and eaten plenty of wings both bad and great. In fact i do not go into a sports bar without ordering at least a half dozen...so after reading some reviews i had to go ahead and see what the fuss was all about. well.....crowded as it was during sunday football, i almost forgot to watch the game while i was devouring the little chicken pieces. If you love wings, (if you dont there is something wrong with you) and live in SF go on down to THE PHOENIX and grab a beer and some of the nations best hot wings, you wont regret it. THANKS PHOENIX!!!
author: Leonard P.

description: This place freakin rules! The servers/bartenders are super stylish, hot little things. This is probably the least pretentious bar Ive ever been to in the Mission. Five thumbs up!
author: Katrina C.

description: This place has the best burger I've had yet in San Francisco, plus a great selection of beers.  The Bleu Cheese Burger is highly recommended.
author: Zach B.
