description: Usually i like this place - whats the problem? its memorial day and they have one person working the bar and the tables.  What happened? She came to our table after 10 minutes said we took the wrong menus and said she would get water for us.  After waiting 10 more minutes and watching her run all over the place we decided to leave.  Get a clue and staff your establishment accordingly on a holiday!
author: Cster R.

description:
i always have a good time at phoenix. so it baffles me that i'm not here more often... phoenix is a casual, unpretentious local pub where everyone seems to get along well. the real treat for me, however, is when a real irish person with a thick accent buys me a pint and ask me to hang out with his people. ahhh, they like me. they really, really like me. so, um, anyway, the bartenders are friendly. the drinks are affordable and the food just might surprise you.

one of these days, i have to try their brunch. thanks, yelpers!
author: frisco j.

description: I've come to love it b/c it's comfy...for a pub.  I pass dozens of watering holes on the way to the Phoenix, but it's worth it. :)
author: Robby T.

description:
The beer selection is nothing special and the food is just ok. (i dont recommend the quesadilla)

The Mac and cheese is pretty good though.

It's also the only english speaking spot in the mission where you can catch up on some futbol as well as football.
author: Henry C.

description: A decent Mission Street pit stop - it's large and not too crowded, so if that's your vibe... come here. I had a tequila shot, which is almost impossible to eff up, so i cant really say anything about their drinkmaking capabilities... but my barmates seemed to finish their drinks pretty quickly.
author: Richard T.

description: I like this place for brunch or when I'm sick of the crowded hipster bars in the mission.
author: Kathryn T.

description: Best brunch? Bzzzt. No way. Twice now I've been suckered into this place and twice now I've had to bite my tongue when my fellow diners sing its praises. Amateur at best. Face it people - the Valencia corridor hardly has to try anymore and has gotten flabby as a result. Just say no.
author: patrick g.

description: Damn good Margaritas at an Irish Pub, who woulda thought???
author: Elissa D.

description: You wouldn't know it to look at it, but the Phoenix is always good, back-up fun. When I can't think of any place to go with some friends, we always end up here and it never disappoints. It is the setting of many a great story with my crew.  The most infamous was when a group of girls asked me if my friend's breasts were real. Good times...
author: Maya S.

description: Good things are, they have brunch, a good selection of beer on tap, and an internet juke box. (I'm always down with paying a bit extra to play my songs first) The atmosphere kind of sucks. It reminds me of a chain such as Chili's or T.G.I. Fridays, with a lot crap hanging on the walls. It's a mixed age crowd with a pretty large menu that is not particularly vegetarian/vegan friendly.
author: Crystal R.

description: One of the few bars I have as much fun in during the daytime as well as at night. Nice jukebox, and solid Irish eats.
author: April M.

description: There are so few bars to catch a game with decent or any food.  So, I was very happy that my friends found this one.  The bartenders are very nice and helpful. The food is really good.  The wings are yum.  Haven't tried the burger but it sure does smell and look good.  Lots of beer on tap and good strong drinks.
author: Gina T.

description: I have nothing against this bar, which serves a lovely Guinness with appropriate wait time, but I fucking hate places where I run into co-workers. I came here once and ran into a group of them and almost hurt myself while running straight towards the door. I've since quit my job, so no more running into coworkers. No more money, either, so I resort to drinking Mad Dog 20/20 in dark corners.
author: Laura S.

description: Perfect spot for a happy hour brew and some quesadillas as well as grabbing some great bar food on the weekends. Chill and dark, this bar is great for stopping by at anytime during the week when you're up for relaxing with friends and grabbing a beer. Not too expensive or hipster, the kind of bar in the Mission you could take your folks to and not weird them out. I want to try out some more of their food and the next time I'm there I'll be first in line for the famous Bloody Mary...
author: Michael E.

description: Had dinner at the Phoenix on Friday night and based on the other reivews, expected way better food.  The food was extemely bland and the side salad had very little dressing with no flavor.  Its a cool bar but I wouldn't recommend going there if you are looking for good pub grub - you will be dissapointed.
author: melissa o.

description: Great Irish bar with great grub.  Get the corned beef hash and wash it down with a Boddingtons.
author: Rudro S.

description: For the area it's a pretty cool hang.  Great bartenders and they got this cool new internet jukebox where you can play any song.  Pretty neat.  Doesn't get too packed on weekends and the people are usually friendly.
author: Mitch A.

description: Fun mission bar with cheap drinks and lots of seating plus a casual comfy feel.
author: Sara W.

description:
i have to say, i'm not much of an irish pub fan.  i just don't see the appeal of the crowd of neo hippies swilling beer that seems to follow in most of them.

but the phoenix seems different.  its definitely low key, now overwhelming celtic music, or even dave matthews band.  and the staff is really cool and friendly.

of course they have the usual collection of beers and whiskeys that most irish pubs have, so pub afficianados will enjoy as well
author: Steve S.

description: I went to the Phoenix last night and hung out for an hour or so in the company of many people I had just met, while quaffing a hearty stout with a highly respectable head. While the group mingled, I slowly relaxed and, in fact, found myself having a much needed quiet moment to collect my scattered thoughts on humanity, beer, yelp schwag, and forgotten dreams.  Now that's a pub!!!
author: Amy J.

description:
great irish pub that screens american and euro sports.  decent food. although i was not a fan of their avoca veggie hash.  they serve traditional soda bread.  full bar.

i also tried a dessert which consisted of berries, and seemed to be sort of bread pudding like.  i forget the name, but it was very tasty.
author: Sheri N.

description:
I went here on a Thursday and unfortunately they ran out of Stella.  Even more unfortunately, when the bill came I experienced some extremely dismaying sticker shock at seeing our beers were $5 a pint (not even Guinness or anything).  Call me a cheapskate but that extra 50 cents-$1 was really kind of insulting.  Is it just me? Perhaps it was my fault for being too uppity and not getting the $2 PBR special. *le sigh*
Otherwise, everything would have been perfect.  Nice atmosphere of unpretentious neighborhood pub where you can also have a good sit-down meal.  We had pretty tasty burgers that were also on the high end of the price range for burgers ($10) and noticed the couple next to us had bangers and mash and some sort of chicken and mash, both of which looked pretty good and smelled even better.  Oh, and VERY delicious beer-battered onion rings with a tangy, surprisingly good  "house ketchup."  Points for that.  And bathrooms were not disgusting, actually decent for a pub. Points for that too.
I'll come back, but during happy hour specials that may be more wallet-friendly.
author: Michelle K.

description: Never had the food, but I have gotten completely wasted here. This is a great place to sit with friends around a table, trade war stories(drinking stories, sex stories, or actual war stories).  I've never been in war, so I wouldnt' know. But, this is one of the mission spots that I seem to frequent when I go to the mission. I didn't even know they had food.
author: Srinivas R.

description: We went for breakfast. They hooked me at the bread. Oh my God. That bread is close to Godliness. The potatoes are delicious and the biscuits and gravy divine. The perfect "help I am dying from a hangover breakfast." And the prices will rock your world too!
author: Becky M.

description: It's OK. We went on a Saturday night, they are friendly people in there but all Irish drunks are! I know, I am from Boston and officially able to judge an Irish Bar. It has a good theme and did remind me of home, the drinks were good, the bloody mary was on point, tons of garnishes. The turn over at he bar is quick so you can wait a few minutes then get a barstool. I will go back to try the food. I like this pplace, like I said it's no REAL Irish Bar but, in SF it will have to do.
author: Heather L.

description: I came here with a big group. It was pretty cool and fun. However, it's really dirty, they don't really clean the tables. Also, it took half an hour to get a drink cuz the bartenders ignore you. The bartender had major attitude.
author: Tuppence D.

description: The Irish Nachos are the perfect drunk food - cheesy, guac, potato wedges, yum!!!  The vibe...I haven't made a decision about yet...when we walked in (4 women - late 20s) we noticed there were a lot of older guys around the bar giving us the once over.  That was a tiny bit creepy, but at least they stuck to their seats and didn't offer to buy us a drink.  I would've been out of there faster than you can say GROSS!  In sum, good place to hang out with friends in the Mission (good food, inexpensive drinks, and lots of comfortable booths for the fat ass who eats too many Irish Nachos).
author: Tabatha Y.

description: Great place for happy hour. Chill vibe, plenty of room, friendly service. There was a guy eating dinner at the bar and his food smelled good. I should have asked him for a bite.
author: Susan L.

description: I thoroughly enjoy this Irish bar.  The food is good and reasonable, and the Guinness is well-poured.   One star off for getting rid of their homemade mayo and ketchup.  I would go out of my way for those!
author: Rachael K.

description: A nice, warm-feeling Irish bar at which you can have conversation with your friends. The food is at times, insanely good (Baked Macaroni & Pulled Ham is my fave), and on other nights, just good.
author: David K.

description: Phoenix Bar has somewhat of a warm pub feel; it isn't an exact replication of an Irish pub, but more of a cross between an American neighborhood bar and an Irish pub.  Phoenix offers average drink prices, Guinness on tap (of course), and a chill crowd.  If you're looking for a place to grab a drink with some friends after a long week of work, the Phoenix Bar is a good bet.
author: Matt P.

description: I've been in here a few times now. They pour a great tasting pint of Guinness which for me is one of the FIRST things I look at when going to a pub. It had a cozy atmosphere and was nice and clean for a pub (not something you see too often). I was just in here for a predinner drink and the place was bustling with people having dinner. The food all looked both fresh and good and I'd definitely be willing to stop by sometime for more than a drink. In fact. I can't wait.
author: Jeff S.

description: I haven't tried the food yet but the bar scene was pretty awesome. i went to this gathering i found on craigslist, no its not a hook up gathering. It was for people who had rooms available for rent and looking for roommates. I met so many great candidates to be my new roommate but some couldn't afford the rent. :-( sad! It was cool though cause I met so many awesome people, all we did was drink beer, talk, and went on an adventure after the event. They had people walking around taking drink orders rather than me going up to the already busy bar. It was awesome. I would def come back just to kick back during happy hour. The bonus to this place is its near my condo!
author: Lucky M.

description: I'm fond of Phoenix purely for the big windows in the front, which are nice to dawdle next to on a random weeknight and watch the ever-entertaining Mission detritus pass by.  Otherwise not much to distinguish it from any other bar.  I've never tried the food, and you probably shouldn't either.
author: Sarah B.

description: I love this place.  It's divey, decent food, great place for a casual blind date or for a beer or two after climbing....and....wait for it... 20 OZ BEERS!!  YAY!  In my mind, there's nothing better than getting a 20oz for the price of a 16oz!  That's like, a free beer every once in a while!  And you don't even have to get stamps or use coupons!
author: Dave G.

description: Great pub feel.... very neighborhoody and not at all pretentious.  If you want to feel a place to stop by for a casual drink at night or on the weekends it a good vibe there.  Don't go if you want to "nightlife" scene.
author: Annabel G.

description: The Phoenix is solid -- never disappoints.  You can get what you want, when you want it, and pretty much that tells the story.  Nice beer selection, good atmosphere, not too loud, super-authentic joint, in my opinion.  Great bar between bars, not a final destination point unless you didn't realize that it would be.  Great as the next bar to go to, killer location, and beautiful Irish stout and whiskey.  Gets busy.
author: Abendigo R.

description: Went to the Phoenix for the second or third time recently and wasn't disappointed. This is a great Irish pub to hang out at where you and your friends can enjoy each other's company. I've never eaten here, but probably will at some point - but, I'd expect pub food, so my expectations are probably lower than they should be. The bartenders and staff are nice and interesting...
author: Dan M.

description: i'm a fan. the beer selection is great and i typically leave here having had a few too many beers, but in a good way. The atmosphere is above average the juke box has Johnny Cash. rock.
author: Natalie C.

description: A really cool ambiance that seems a lot different than the other places on Valencia. The food is actually really good as well, but don't expect the bar to be fully hipster-free: the female bartenders certainly were (and one was pretty attractive.) Get a Guinness and some Fish & Chips and you won't be saddened by what you get out of it.
author: Eston B.

description: My stumbling home to go to bed bar, also my getting out of work got to have a drink bar, also my Sunday morning got to wake up need a drink bar.  Wow, I love this place.  Like no ones knows your name but you keep coming back for more and more.  No really always a mission favorite for a beer and a nightcap of Bailey's Irish Cream, what everyone needs before sleeping in da Mission!
author: Bruce_ B.

description:
A+ #1 pub...
They have my ultra favorite Irish cider on tap (Magners)
and they not only have all of the great  beers on tap- they
know how to serve them!!!
Guinness with a nice, perfect head
served in a perfect glass
freezing cold Bass
thick and delicious New Castle
laid back atmosphere
If your not with a big group- sit by the window...
It is the perfect spot for people watching.
Oh, and as an extra added bonus, the ladies room is clean, well stocked, and not at all scary
AND as a final and- they accept credit cards
my new favorite place

OK I must amend this to say 

The drinks, fries, and soda bread are 5 star all the way
 The other food items we have tried here have been 3 star at most.
The Farm House Vegetable Pie actually gets 1 star if that
 The one time that I tried it- I was so very disappointed.
Think of a decent vegetable soup- covered in seasoned mashed potatoes...
Sounds good, right? 
Well it is A-served with a fork (and while I did try waiting for our server
To come by so that I could request a spoon, after 15 minutes of waiting she wasn't anywhere in sight
So I ate it with a fork
That totally sucked
And B-it is $9.50- which I feel is too expensive for what it was
 (which was a very small portion of soup eaten with a fork )
 A woman sitting close by had the same order as me, and I heard her complaining to her companions about it as well.
So it's not just me who felt that way.
The garden burger was boring and bland- and again overpriced for what it was
Husband has had the fish and chips twice and found them soggy both times
He has also had the chicken sandwich and was very "meh" about that too
He said it was too chewy and tough
The other issue I have had is the only time we have ordered appetizers and main courses (starving with eyes way bigger than stomach's)-
 they were all brought out at the same time.
This made no sense and resulted in a table full of food that  took a long time to come out at all 
and made no sense together (chicken wings with fish and chips)
and when we ordered-we made a pint of saying for the app we would like this and for the main course this
I know it is pub food but whatever-it's not McDonald's or something!!!
There are too many delicious places to eat in this area to waste time on "meh" food
author: Maxine M.

description: Hot boys, good food, great beer...what more do you need?
author: Erica N.

description: Finally tried the burgers, and they good.  I had the Phoenix burger, which was just the basics.  Although, I wanted the turkey burger but my friend made me get the Phoenix burger.  He had the blue cheese burger, the flavors were better.  By the way, still love the strong drinks.
author: Cindy V.

description: I can't say I have ever had a bad time here. Various beers on tap, friendly service, excellent jutebox! I love that when it is nice outside you can sit at the window tables and get in some great people watching!
author: Lisa K.

description: They have a really solid, delicious menu at this medium-sized Irish bar/pub.  The Shepard's Pie is fantastic.  But my favorite is brunch.  Go here for brunch!  Irish bacon.  Yum!  Boxty.  Yum!  Soda Bread.  Super yum!  And fantastic desserts and Irish coffee.  Hooray!
author: Lita F.

description: A pretty good bar but I think this place is best if you can go with a large group. It was fun to watch a guy get kicked out by the cute little female bartender because he could not pay his $10 tab. It was way too crowded on St. Patty's day but any other time you can usually get a seat.
author: E P.

description: Not bad as far as Irish pubs go in San Franciski. They'd probably be crucified in Ireland for serving both Guiness and Murphy's. The pub food is fair to good. I give it an additional fourth star because it's the best place in the city to play trivial persuit with your friends, provided you can score a table in the back after dinner hours.
author: Tal K.

description: One of the better bars in the Mission.  You're far enough away from the 16th/Valencia meatmarket that you can actually relax with a pint and speak to someone without yelling at them.
author: Eric L.

description: We had a Yelp game night here.  I like this bar because it has a nice pub feel and they serve food.  It's not hipster like most of the bars on Valencia and it's relatively well lit.  Four stars because there's lots of seating, table service, and it's not pretentious.
author: angela k.

description: I didn't realize this was an Irish Bar. Not even after I heard people around me talking with accents nearly as thick as Brad Pitt in Snatch. It wasn't until I looked up to write my little Yelp review that I saw it was an Irish Bar. Am I blind? Was it obvious? Was I drunk? Still - the Irish know how to drink! And that's what you do at a bar...right? Looks like they've got some good whiskey specials, and there was some special dinner on the menu. I didn't really pay attention to it. Nice ambiance inside. A step above a dive bar, a couple steps below a swanky lounge. Probably what you'd expect and "Irish Pub" to look like in San Francisco. In the end? The Bartenders were cute, the beer was good (had a fair selection on tap), I heard the Pogues on their Jukebox and I had a great time.
author: Eli S.

description: I have found my new favorite place in the city!  I LOVED the Phoenix!  I'm a big fan of small Irish pubs, and this did not disappoint.  We found it by accident after we tried to go to Amnesia, which was packed and they wanted a cover charge for a horrible band that was playing.  So, we left and thought we would give the Phoenix a shot since it was right there.  They played great music all night long(Bloc Party, The Cure, Dire Straits  just to name a few), our waitress was super nice, and our drinks were perfect!
author: Kim C.

description: As far as Irish food goes, this place hits the spot. Good breakfast and excellent Shepard's pie. They also have a great happy hour. The service can be hit or miss, but I like this place and end up here often.
author: Adrienne G.

description:
Two Eggs + Oven Roasted Tomato + Glass of Guinness = A Great Breakfast 

Throw in some black and white pudding and you've got the strength to drink all day! All that with soccer and rugby all at a great price. 

Go there! Save money! 

With all the money you save you can afford to tip your bartender/server, you cheap bastard.
author: Dubya O.

description: I've had some drinks here a couple times, once after a Yelp event even.  Good service, good beers and great Irish service ... I think I may have tried some of their apps too one night and they were good.  I can't swear to that though as it was after I had several beers.   It's definitely a good spot to do some drinking Irish style.
author: Derek D.

description: It's a good, solid bar. But more than that, it's a great and overlooked place for weekend brunch. The food is good, the service is great, and there's never a line. Perfect for a little hair of the dog that bit ya.
author: m t.

description: They had the game on, which made the boys happy...I contented myself with the fact that they carry Hangar...  Bartender was super nice.
author: Susan C.

description:
You know, it really pains me to write this review.  Prior to yesterday I had awesome experiences at the Phoenix.  In fact, I would regularly brag to my friends from out of town that I knew of a Irish pub that made their own condiments.  Beat that, out of towners.  The sad truth is that the service sucks almost as bad as the mean check out lady at Harvest and Rowe.  When the server at the Phoenix took my table's order she didn't really pay attention all that close to what we were saying.  My friend ordered some Huevos rancheros.  This was a dire mistake and mid way through she gave him a long "huh?".  When I ordered my skirt stake sandwich I thought everything was cool.  I asked for some goat cheese on it to give it that extra, well, you know, zing.  My friends and I gobbled up their awesome Irish soda bread while we waited.  The server did come back to clarify my order.  She asked: "did you ask for the rib eye or the skirt steak?"  She caught me with a big hunk of Irish soda bread in my mouth so as best I could I answered, "skirt steak".  Our food comes.  My friend, who also ordered a skirt steak sandwich, received his first, then the girl who brought out the food (not our server) tried to hand me a breakfast plate. I was at that point completely in a lunch mood so I shuttered at the plate.  I told her I ordered the skirt steak sandwich.  She looked like I'd done something wrong.  She grabbed the server and the server said, "I asked you if you wanted the skirt steak".  That she did, but I ordered the skirt steak sandwich.  The skirt steak breakfast special was actually what she ordered me.  It was a tough skirt steak covered in mushroom sauce.  I hate saucy food and saucy people.  It came with eggs that were floating in the gross mushroom sauce and also potatoes.  After awkwardly holding that plate near my head, and not backing down on the plate of food, the server graciously forced the plate on me.  She made it seem like it was my fault.  I backed down out of embarrassment and also starvation.  Oh, also, my goat cheese was no where to be found.  When our server cleared my partially picked at plate she made the mistake of asking if I liked it.  It was awkward.  I said, "well, no, I didn't really like it because it wasn't what I ordered". I thought for sure I wouldn't have to pay for a meal I didn't want (and didn't like), but no she charged me all right.  

I'm pissed off and I don't know if I'll go back to the Phoenix for food.  Perhaps, I'll go for the bar and the Irish soda bread.
author: K B.

description: Fail proof mission night spot with reasonably priced drinks and tons of space. You're not smashed against each other like down the street at Amnesia. This place seems like it'd be family friendly during the day and can accommodate large groups of people.
author: Jessica M.

description: Great Irish pub food. They have the best Irish soda bread evah! I tend to go for items that are main courses: root veggies, mashed taters and meat dishes and gravy. Roast beast is great. The Chicken & Mushroom Pot Pie is also yummy! The Chicken with Gravy and bacon (how could you go wrong with bacon?!) is delish! Shepherds Pie is fab! I have never tried the sandwiches or fried fare--but heartily recommend a solid meat Potatoes and veggies kinda experience. The place is loud, but the food is truly delish comfort food!
author: Charlotte S.

description: Love the cheese plate with sausage and pickles, its also big enough to feed a party of  6. I never had a problem getting a table and the noise level is just right for maintaining a conversation without raising your voice.
author: polina S.

description: The Phoenix is great.  I've been there for dinner and Brunch on Sunday.  Great food, great service, and of course, great drinks.
author: Josh S.

description: The Phoenix is a great place to watch football on Sundays. Unless you're the drunk girl weaving around the bar and screaming for the Patriots to win at the top of your lungs at 10 in the morning. They serve somewhat average breakfast/lunch/brunch food in the mornings and afternoons. But who needs great food when you've got all your basic food needs taken care of with good Bloody Marys, Irish coffees and/or Guinness to start your day?
author: Anne Q.

description:
You dont have to feel guilty about drinking a lot over brunch here.

The first visit was mighty tasty.  The second time wasnt quite there:  soggy calamari, sandwiches on rolls that tasted like blimpy buns.  3rd visit offered the shrimp omelette was bliss.

Tasty beer selections, and they do nice things w potatoes.  Also, the men watching sports from the bar didnt seem overly lush-y or overly asshole-ly, which helps.  Shared a smile with some nice lad also drinking Spaten.  Always helps!
author: M M.

description: A nice place to chill and hang after a long day in the office. The crowd is second to none and you won't feel suffocated as there are plenty of seats. The bartenders are nice too!
author: S L.

description: Superb pub grub and fresh beer. What more can you ask. I'd also disagree with the profile and say that for lunch at least the place is fine for kids in an Irish/British grow-up-and-don't-fear-the-booze way. Watch out for Big Game nights--particularly basketball tho' all sorts of collegiate poseurs show up in their daft clothes.
author: Stephen K.

description: My favorite Irish pub in San Francisco, very friendly bartenders, a good place to catch the game without a bunch of Marina yahoos hitting on your girlfriends.
author: John B.

description: Great Irish Pub.  Food awesome.  You have to try their sheppard's pie.  The juke box has lots of good bands.  Drinks are not too expensive.  Good to go when there is a good sports game, or drinks before going on a long night...
author: Bilal A.

description:
my burger was raw.... not rare, but RAW in the middle, Im sorry folks... I am a burger -a- holic and this place sucks.... never, ever get the burger...
booooooo!!!
author: Benjamin H.

description: The Phoenix is a good place to rise out of the ashes...  It's a warm, friendly inviting place.  The soda bread will ease your pain, and the Shepherd's Pie will soothe your soul.  For the ultimate indulgence have an Irish Coffee with your meal.  The "Tayto Skins" rock as well.  Can anyone say 'comfort food' ;)  Slainte!!
author: Mary B.

description: I went to the Pheonix for the first time Sunday night and it hit the spot for a number of reasons:  The mojitos are super minty and the margaritas are big and strong. They had the Sox game on. The waitress was very nice and very sexy. And the playlist wafting in from the other room was full of tunes that I had forgotten I love. Plus, its right around the corner from the  Lex. The only drawback was the $7 glass of wine. Not that I paid for it, but the person who did complained about it to me later. However, she did say it was a tasty glass of wine. Bottom line...its a great pub to drink and toast loudly with 20 of your closest mates.
author: Blue T.

description: They pour a decent pint of Guinness - not the best that I've ever had, but decent for this side of the pond; they have a fair selection of Irish (whiskey); and the overall atmosphere and professionalism of the staff is top drawer.  Saying that, I think that I will stay away from the fish and chips next time - stale, tasteless fish in crispy batter with chunky, soggy chips...... a shame really because I've had a real hankering for it recently.
author: ohreleigh ..

description:
So good.

The bf and I went on a Friday evening, so it was pretty packed. We'd never been before, but we'd read the reviews and it was near where we were supposed to meet up with some friends later.

The crowd was a mix of casual folks in groups/couples and people who clearly had come from work. We actually wanted to order food, so we found a table and a waitress came right over to offer us menus and take our drink orders.

I had to get a Guinness, at least for the first round, and it was great of course (good pour!). The bf got some crazy specialty coffee thing with several different liqueurs, and it was hot, creamy, sweet, and very strong. Quite tasty. For 2nd round, I had a Bass and he got a Guinness -- this from 2 hardcore microbrew fans.

The food totally hit the spot. We got a salmon boxty appetizer, which was pretty standard (though the creme fraiche, capers, scallions, and pan-fried potato base were a nice touch). I went traditional with the fish & chips, and he got a chicken & mushroom pot pie. Both were basic but really satisfying. Even the fries/chips (with vinegar, of course) were good.

I used the restroom before we left, and while I waited for the lady before me to finish, I had to admire the multitude of tavern mirrors lining the walls. We have one (an Early Times mirror inherited from a former roommate) hanging at our place, and I desperately wondered exactly how difficult it would be to take down 2 or 3 and get them out of the pub without being noticed. Alas, we'll have to make do with Early Times for the time being.
author: Nicole A.

description: I started coming for the Irish Breakfast, and have returned again and again because every single item I or any companion has ever ordered is just so tasty.  Best "bowl of fruit" in the city, I am convinced.  Friendly service, cold Guinness, tangy and spicy bloody marys.  Occasionally a rowdy crowd, but hey, it's a bar.
author: Andrea S.

description: The Phoenix is a great place for brunch or a weekend mid-day meal.  The Irish really understand the meaning of "hangover food".  It's delicious and most everything goes with a bloody mary or a beer.  As long as no major sporting events are on, it's not too crazy and we always get a table.  I would say that they actually are kid friendly during the day because they have high chairs, booths and the staff has ALWAYS been very nice to our kid.
author: Sarah W.

description: oddly shaped, seemingly popular Irish pub in the Mission.  definitely feels more like a college bar with an Irish vibe rather than an Irish pub with a college vibe - but that's just splitting hairs.
author: Barney B.

description: tasty irish food.....friendly bartenders....hot gals.....internet jukebox (altho last time i was there it was down).....a star for each
author: Sang L.

description: One of my favorite pubs is the PHOENIX BAR & GRILL.  I enjoy having lunch there on weekdays.  I bring a book, snaffle a booth and have a leisurely meal.  The waitresses are friendly, helpful and know to pour me an iced tea with lemon as soon as I sit down.  You read that right--I don't drink alcohol but really like the atmosphere, food and TVs so I go there frequently.  If it's soccer season, they are always happy to put a game on for me.  If I don't want to look at other sports, I read my book while I eat.  During the day it's quiet enough to do that or even have a conversation without shouting.  Now for the food.  Their Irish soda bread is the best I've had in San Francisco.  In fact, I can't even make it as well as they do.  I like their salads which are well dressed and contain interesting lettuces.  I love the burgers, especially the turkey and lamb burgers.  The lamb burger appears on occasion as a special.  I've had many of the specials including pork loin, fajitas, ribs; all have been delicious.  Since the food is cooked to order, it doesn't appear as quickly as a fast food restaurant but the time between ordering and digging into my meal has never been an unreasonable wait.  I give the Phoenix five stars because I am not a bar person but find that at this little gem on Valencia it doesn't matter.
author: Sandra S.

description: we went there because we heard they had great wings, and they do.. but that black and blue burger was something else! good meat and perfect spices. they also pour a good guinness. very friendly service. the only bad thing about the place is that someone had played enough sublime on the jukebox to last during our entire visit. yuck!
author: Frosty Z.

description: Spent many a morning-after-the-all-nighter with an old flame at this fine establishment. He broke my heart (what else is new???), but the Phoenix is still loving up on me strong and steady. The Phoenix Burger makes my eyes grow large and luminous with love. They cook it up good and black on the outside, pink and juicy on the inside. For a little extra, they'll throw on a cheese of your choice. This burger screams for a thick slab of extra sharp cheddar, much as I'm not really a fan of orange cheeses. Skip the house made sauces- they all taste the same shade of not-so-great to me but say "yes, please!" to the crispy fries. They do brunch foods on the weekends that never really appeal to me but the ex loved the fish and chips and I must say their crabcakes are the real deal. HUGE lumps of crab with minimal bread filler and a yummy sauce. Great selection of beer for the lads and mimosas for the ladies make this a great place to come-to and recharge after a long night out dancing.
author: Autumn K.

description: Solid atmosphere, solid selection of brews on tap, and lots of TVs!  Surprisingly - and I say this according to my experience at other pubs - their food was not expensive.  I was very pleased with my black and blue burger + fries.
author: Daniel S.

description: The Phoenix is great for lunch... the prices are good and the food is even better.. They have done some work on the place, and it looks really good.  I highly recommend this for lunch, dinner or happy hour.
author: Catherine H.

description: Like an oasis in the middle of Hipster Hell, the Phoenix is a great spot to have a beer (or five), soak them up with do-your-Irish-Mom-and-her-seven-siblings-proud meat & potatoes, and potentially spark up an interesting conversation that doesn't revolve around obscure band one-up-manship. An essential respite from any Mission dive crawl.
author: Katie C.

description:
i've been here for drinks a couple of times, and for an afternoon meal a couple of times, mostly because it was convenient or other places nearby were too crowded.

the food was ok, fish tacos and fish and chips were adequate, not great but not terrible. the drinks were ok, too. but the service every single time has sucked. once, we waited so long for our check, i had to get up and walk to the back of the place to find our waitress chatting with someone, and then they couldn't get the computer to work to process my credit card, so i had to scrounge all the money in my wallet to come up with cash. and there wasn't even an apology about it.

and the other night, i stopped in with a friend for a drink on friday night, in a mission to find a place we could sit down and have a drink and talk. it was busy, but i tended bar in a similar place for years when i was young, so i know it was not impossible to manage cranking out the drinks to a crowded room. the bartender looked like she was barely old enough to work there, and she seemed to be enjoying herself, but she wasn't really keeping up with things. we sat down at the bar and waited patiently to catch her eye to order a drink. and as we watched her serve people to the left and right of us, wash glasses, and refill drinks for people at the other end of the bar, our patience faded. she never even glanced at us -- who trained this girl? if you're working a busy bar, you absolutely must acknowledge your waiting customers. a look and a smile and a "i'll be with you in a minute" is all it takes. but no... we just waited. after ten minutes, we put our money back in our wallets and left. 

this might be a nice place for a daytime drink, or if you live in the marina and think anything on valencia carries a panache of cool, but for me? not so much.
author: leslie a.

description: If I judge the Phoenix Bar solely as a bar, I would say it is a typical hangout joint with one important advantage- they serve their beer in 20 ounce pint glasses!!! (suck it, 16 ounces). What really sets this place apart from other Mission spots and other Irish pubs is the absolutely fantastic food this place serves up. I had always assumed that they probably served up your standard mediocre Irish pub grub. I was utterly mistaken. A friend brought me there for lunch one day and I was blown away by the quality of the food. Since that time, I have frequented the Phoenix for lunch or happy hour grubbing, have tried almost everything on the menu, and have never been disappointed. The Phoenix is the best lunch spot in the Mission- try it all, you can't go wrong here.
author: Jonathan M.

description: you broke my heart!  i came here to try carlsberg on tap, which i have searched high and low for, and the replaced it with trumer.  eff that.  plus it reeked of bleach.
author: Ryan H.

description: fun little irish pub - stopped in for a drink on my way to dinner.  it seemed like a place i would go back and hang out on a weekend night when i could really experience it.
author: Carolyn B.

description: An 'irish' bar for faux Irish Mission yuppies to buy over-priced drinks and crummy food at.
author: Matt E.

description: excellent irish soda bread. the scene skewed slightly chach-y on st. patty's day, but what do you expect. watch out for flying paper airplanes. who does that? ;)
author: julia r.

description: have only been there for brunch, which is a hit of miss situation. once the cook just didn't show up. another time the kitchen was very slow. but the other times were a splendid treat -- very friendly staff, fun and lively crowd, and some of the best Irish cooking I have had in SF. if they are on top of their game, it is a true winner. but you have to chance it every time.
author: Eric P.

description: this place is solid. nothing amazing or unique, but solid. they have pretty good happy hour specials for appetizers, and it's a bit more spacious than other places in the area. service is not that good, but if you're proactive you'll get your order. sorta a pleasant (if bland-ish) medium between hipsterdom and frat-boy pub.
author: Kate A.

description:
i'm sorry, but i have to give it just 3 stars at the moment.  the food, though still pretty tasty, isn't as good as it once was.  the wait staff friendly enough.  but, they don't have hp sauce and refuse to stock it, they bring you a1 instead!!  hp sauce is not a1 and a1 is definitely not hp sauce (can i get an amen from you brits out there?  please?).  you must have hp with irish breakfast, and even with other irish/english pub fare.  when we asked our waittress about the hp sauce, she said they're 1! bottle (what?) ran out and the boss wouldn't let them purchase any more until the a1 ran out.  so, i am guessing that the new management is not irish or british?  just a bit annoying.  

in addition to the lack of hp sauce, sometimes they get really busy at brunch and are sorely under-staffed.  this happened especially during the world cup, but i've also seen this on other mornings, too (yes, i know i've gone back more than a few times than i should have - but, hey, it is right around the corner from where i live).  they have a really sweet busboy that helps them out when they're in the weeds, but he is running around like crazy, wiping his sweaty brow, and then he sets down the silverware holding the business end, and gives you your water with his hands on the rim of the glass.  this is just a case of poor training, but i have to admit it really made me lose my appetite.  this happened once, and i went back again, thinking maybe it was a one-off, but he was there again, and serving everything up the same way.  
does this bother anyone, but me?   i understand this is a cost of eating out, and that i don't know what happens in the back where i can't see (but, i do!  i've done my time in the restaurant biz), but when it is happening right in front of you it doesn't inspire much confidence on what the back of the house is like. 

so, that's my .02.  i hope that the next time i'm driven to visiting the phoenix (because as much as i don't want to, i probably will - creature of habit that i am), things have improved.
author: Cami B.

description: i love the phoenix for its soda bread and yummy butter. the lamb stew is a nourishing treat when it's been cold and you've been nursing the flu. on any given weekend, i like to traipse over to this lovely spot as i scoff at all the people standing in line to get into places like Boogaloo's (overrated, in my opinion) or Pork Store Cafe (love it but it gets too crowded sometimes). the servers are always nice and never hurried. The Phoenix was recommended to me by my favorite Irish barkeep in Portland (County Cork) - hooray!
author: ray e.

description: besides the loud douchebags singing country music that they ordered on the jukebox, this place is nice. friendly staff,nice ambiance. spacious. but seriously get rid of the jocky douches and play more joy division on that jukebox.then it would be totally magical
author: Lauren V.

description: i come here at least once a week to drink beers and/or jamesons with the guys. we tend to get very drunk and listen to the same britpop tunes on the jukebox, but i wouldn't have it any other way. the bartenders/staff are really nice here too. it's also a good place for brunch and bloody mary's on sundays during NFL season.
author: James J.

description: I love the food, the drinks and the ambiance here.  The food is always so delicious and hearty, the bloody mary's are delicious, and it's just a very down to earth place to hang out.  No attitude!
author: Jennifer C.

description: Excellent Bloody Marys, good veggie burgers. Great place to have a few drinks before walking around the Mission or going to the museum.
author: Sarah J.

description: Good happy hour munchies. Actually, everything the kitchen puts out is tasty. Also, a good spot to shake off that hangover.
author: Jeff B.
